39312590.review:
EDFのようなTPS, FPSをSteamで探してほとんどないことがわかり、このゲームらしさがわかってきたので書いてみます。よく喧伝されているようなゲーム性や魅力は省き、このゲームに特有のものを挙げます。

[h1]ロケーションが日本[/h1]
　謎の安心感があります。

[h1]敵が多い[/h1]
　冗談抜きに100体が群で一度に迫ってきます。他のどんなゲームを見ても敵がぽつぽつ来るだけに見えてしまいます。

[h1]敵がムチャクチャにでかい[/h1]
　蟻さんが戦車より大きいのでエイム技術が不要です。あるに越したことはないですがなくても全ステージINFERNOまでクリア可能です。そもそもこれはパッドでのプレイを前提に作られています。

[h1]リアルさがまったくないゲームシステム[/h1]
　4980円のゲームなのに、つくりがやたら簡素です。元が2000円のシリーズなのでその名残があります。結果的にストレスフリーで遊びやすいです。
[list][*]無限にリロード可能(一部の撃ちきり特殊兵器と空爆要請を除く)
    [*]移動速度は前後左右同じ(後ろ向きに走れる)
    [*]フェンサー以外リコイルなし(かわりに弾がバラけますが)
    [*]スコープの覗き込み(正確にはズーム)が1Fで可能
    [*]スナイパーライフルは覗き込まなくても同じように飛ぶ
    [*]レティクルは常時中央に表示(バグでたまに消える)
    [*]高いところから落ちてもダメージなし
    [*]常に敵影が映るレーダー
[/list]

[h1]1ステージが短く, リトライ性が高い[/h1]
　EDF:IAやSerious Samのように湧きを潰してはチェックポイントに移動してストーリーを進めるキャンペーン感は薄いです。むしろ湧きが有限でランダム要素のないゾンビモードです。1~7湧きぐらいで終わります。ステージごとに湧き位置や種類を覚えて, 有効な装備と戦略を練ってハメるゲームです。複数回遊ぶ前提になっているので音楽ゲームに近いものがあります。

[h1]射撃・爆発が派手[/h1]
　シリーズ旧作の名残があり、爆発エフェクトに独特のわかりやすさがあります。煙というよりは炎といった感で、妙な派手さがあります。大量に敵が出る仕様と派手な爆発がマッチし、敵群の中央で爆発を起こすと　大量のヒットストップがかかって吹っ飛ぶ類を見ない爽快感があります。これが本当に他にない。

[h1]上手さより知識量[/h1]
　EDFはステージが短く敵の種類・位置・数が毎回固定なので知識や戦略がものをいいます。「どの敵がどこに出るか」さえ知っていれば勝てるゲームです。上手い下手というより知識の有無に左右されるゲームです。

[h1]オンラインが気軽に遊べる[/h1]
　対戦ではない上にキル数デス数は表示されないので下手でもそんなにわかりません。極端な話最初から最後まで死ななければそれでよいので、腕に自信がなければメンバーの一番後ろでついていくだけで十分です。元々1人でクリアする設計なので1人いなかろうとどうにでもなります。責任感が薄いので適当にルームに入って何も考えずにプレイすることがままあります。極論、Human:Fall Flatのマルチプレイヤーのような気楽さがあります。
　例外として、「待機状態の敵を起こす」「引かずにひたすら突っ込んで死ぬ」の2点は積極的に死んでいるようなものなので好まれません。「敵が出たら/いたらとりあえず下がって, 誰かが攻撃したら自分も攻撃を始める」を徹底しておけば問題ありません。

39201456.review:
单人模式先不说，2~4人的联机模式有个设定比较恶心，血量和武器都有限制。想要获得和使用更高级的武器就只能调高难度，对萌新不太友好。不过总体来说四个人配合的好一点的话难度也不算太鬼畜。还有就是所谓的地图重复问题，我倒觉得这个影响不大，因为每个任务基本都是不同的区域路线。近100个任务下来感觉也没什么重复太多的地方。还有调整血量只能按左右调不能直接输入数字这点比较烦，还有就是载具的操控性真是过分……不过毕竟是主机移植的游戏，可以接受。

个人感觉缺点就以上这么多。

剩下的嘛……射击手感很好，武器种类够多，游戏体验都超棒。敌人从虫子到大怪兽，从小飞艇到飞行战舰，应对的战术都不一样。再多的我就不剧透了，神展开在游戏里慢慢体会吧233。如果有长期基友一起联机打的话这游戏能赶上求生之路2(当然没有PVP就是了)
总之这是一款能让中二病螺旋升天的游戏。推荐！

39182075.review:
I've wanted to pick this game up for a while now, and now that i've picked it up for the whopping price of $29.99 (on sale, might i add) i'd like to give my thoughts on it.

At first glance, this game may look like it isn't worth the 60 or 30 dollars you might spend on it. The graphics look like they're from the PS3 era (they technically are, since this is a port) and the UI looks weird. What may have attracted the users attention is the large spawns of bugs and aliens.  But once i finally found the will to buy the game the first level wasn't really surprising, as it did what most people said. You shot alot of giant ants until they were dead. Not necessarily underwhelming, but not the most fun ever. I decided to bear through the first couple of levels, But somehow, i was hooked and kept on coming back for more of the hectic shooter that i at first thought was a little boring. 

After a few levels it introduces a new enemy type, and even though i am not too far into the game, each new unit was different from the last and was fun to fight against. They are all unique in their own way and the best way it introduces it to you is pretty much the only way it does it, by shoving alot of them into your face. It was also fun to play a game where it seemed like the odds were stacked against you tenfold, but you somehow scrape it through while looking cool at the same time. 

Most of the game you will spend playing as 4 different characters. The Ranger, The Air Raider, the Wing Diver, and the Lancer. I won't explain these to you myself, as it is fun to experiment and play is different characters depending on what mission you're playing (or what you're comfortable playing with.) They are all unique in their own way and have cool designs. 

Shooting any enemy units is a blast and is very satisfiying to do (which is good, since its the only thing you do). Using any explosives is in my opinion the most satisfiying as shooting them into a group of units turns them into dust. Even shooting the tougher units is fun as it is satisfying to  see them being destroyed after all the firepower they've taken.

What most people like to talk about is the multiplayer, which in my opinion is the greatest aspect of this game. Although its hard to convince your friends to get a 60 dollar game about shooting ants, playing with more than one player is a blast as it is fun to kick ass with your friends. Sometimes its fun to have someone having your back as you're able to be trapped and caught by some of the enemy units, and they're able to save you.

The final thing i would like to talk about is the dialogue and plot. This game doesn't take itself seriously, so their plot is usually over the top and i enjoy that. I think that the voice actors were really bad, but somehow that added to the charm of the game. The lines they read with the voices they were making, it sounded like they were just having a good time making every aspect of this game. The lines were very cheesy and sometimes they were so bad that they gave me a good chuckle and some times. The voices sound exactly as what the voices of a dubbed anime would sound like, and i think that its fitting because this game seems to scream Japanese.

So for the final verdict, i would give this an 8/10. (a 7/10 if you buy it for 60$) as it has very fun gameplay, is repetitive (in a good way), has fun and cheesy dialogue and story which all fit into a fun timewaster which can, if you play it enough, get you absolutely hooked for possibly hours on end. I'd say to definitely get this on sale, as it seems like it isn't really worth it for 60$. It's very fun on its own, but is more fun if you play it with a friend. A good game that you definitely want in your library.

39172150.review:
PS2版の1と2以来のEDF入隊。
基本はそのままで正当進化しており間違いなくお勧めできる作品で、いい点は他の方のレビューに任せるとして不満点を挙げておく。

・レンジャーでオフラインNORMALのみをクリアしたところ25時間もかかり、悪い意味でボリュームが多い。
（単純計算で25時間×5難易度×4兵科×オンライン＝オールクリアに1000時間かかる）
・似たミッションが多い。いくつかは減らせたはず。
・1ミッションが長過ぎる。2までならミッションクリアのようなタイミングでも第2波、第3波が投入されマップが広いことも相まって普通に2,30分くらいかかることがある。
・しかも難易度もNORMALクリアまでに20回以上失敗するような調整にもかかわらず、失敗時は拾った武器とアーマーが完全に無駄。（高難易度で武器を集めればこれは解決できるが）
・相変わらずジャンプと緊急回避が同じボタンのため、前方への緊急回避と左右へのジャンプができない。
・アイテムを拾い集めるのがめんどくさい。
・アーマー値があがりにくい上に他兵科と共通ではない。（これは5で共通になったらしい）

2までは単独行動に対して今回は味方がいてそれなりに頼りになるために、1ミッションが長く難しく調整されたのかもしれない。
ただ、時間を忘れるほど楽しいのでとりあえずレンジャー以外は高難易度で武器稼ぎして各兵科でHARDくらいまでクリアを目標に頑張ってみます。
steamに5かIRON RAINが来るまでは十分楽しめそうです。

39123995.review:
EDF, a tough one.

If I were to make a list of pro's and con's, the cons would most certainly outweight anything this game has to offer.

A ton of bugs, including a certainly annoying mouse issue (you can fix with enabling "Override high DPI scaling behaviour" in the compatibility settings of the executable), super weird controlling scheme (it'll take a while to get used to using WASD for moving through menus) and all that.

It feels like SANDLOT never have made a game before this one...

But still, the game is ridiculous fun. The story sure is bland with "aliens attacking the earth", but it's not the worst part of it. Since it fits. To save the earth it's time to squash those bugs, with all means possible!

I'd 100% recommend this game if it wasn't for the high price, but if you have a spare buck (and the game is on sale) then go ahead and get this. You'll have hours of hours of fun, even more so with friends.

[i]The EDF deploys![/i]

39092902.review:
Imagine an engine that can both run a troop system full of commands and different squad members, AND a one on one kaiju vs. Mech battle in the same game. That's the flexibility of EDF 4.1

Many people have said that this is one of those "So bad it's good" games, but I couldn't disagree more. Sure the dialogue is absolutely abysmal at points, but when it comes to how the game plays, it hardly matters, and more feels like watching a poorly dubbed anime (with the whole translation thing basically making it exactly that). EDF's trick is throwing you in with a load of nonsensical enemies to shoot. The graphics, plotline, and previously mentioned dialogue aren't anything revolutionary, but gunning down 100s of giant insects in one of the 89 available missions is an amazing feeling. EDF is all about scale. Those giant transport ships dropping in more enemies, they're not in the skybox, they're tangible, you can hit them, you can land on them. Having something that isn't just scenery and is actually interactable is an amazing relief from what most games of the like do nowadays with ships and the like.

tl;dr: the shit is big and you can blow it up, buy it

39072907.review:
I SO much wanted to give a postive review, because initially (both in single and multi player) the game seems awesome enough to overlook the ridiculous menu system and many glitches and bugs. But I quickly found that there are just SO many problems with this game that I have to write something to try to offset the wildly, ridiculously positive reviews it gets. Do NOT be sucked in by the "overwhelmingly positive" reviews unless you have carefully read the following. Then, if you're still enthusiastic to buy it, more power to you. Meanwhile, you fanbois who will bash on me for this review, well, that rolls off my back, because this opinion is carefully thought out after approaching 100 hours of game-play.

1) The ridiculous clipping issues are completely untenable. As just one example, there are multiple levels in which you fight giant spiders that fire web strands. If they catch you in these strands, they drag you toward them, doing lots of damage to you as you are dragged. You can shoot these stands to break them, but it takes a lot of firepower to do it. But the spiders can somehow "sense" where you are, through buildings and even through entire MOUNTAINS. So, you repeatedly find yourself in a situation where you cannot even SEE the spiders, much less fire on them. Yet, they are able to web you and start dragging you... THROUGH a mountain or building that can't be destroyed. So, you will die because you can't even get one shot at these things, yet they can pin you against the side of a building or mountain, just tearing you up, and you're helpless. Worse is when two  or more work on you together, which often happens. So, as you're trying to get free of one web, you're just caught in another, dragging you two directions and doing tremendous damage to you. Die, and die again. Restart the map, and restart again. RIDICULOUS!!! YOU can't see through a mountain, so they shouldn't be able either. YOU can't fire through a mountain, so they shouldn't be able to either. And this is just one example of clipping issues that will kill you countless times.

2) This is worse than Starship Troopers, where you're perpetually asking the question, "WHY am I forced to take on waves of giant insects while armed with a peashooter? Ohhh... but you can gain better weapons as you win missions. Except that very quickly you start seeing the exact same drops again and again. There are dozens of weapons for your class that you'll never see, but you'll see the same lame-azz weapons mission after mission.

Ohhh... the "fix" is that you're supposed to "farm" for better weapons by playing missions on "hard" or "hardest" or "inferno," so that you get better and better weapons that drop on those levels of difficulty.

Except that you have the same problem as before: The SAME weapons keep dropping, so you have, like, one barely-decent rocket launcher and one barely-decent shotgun, with all the rest of your weapon possibilities being garbage. And all the really awesome weapons you read about never drop. You are ALWAYS and ridiculously underpowered!

Do NOT believe the fanbois that will claim that you just have to keep "farming." What they are really saying is: "I endured the GRIND, so YOU should have to also." So, be aware, this game has GRIND like you'll rarely see! If you have countless hours of your life to devote to just this game, and you enjoy, I mean ENJOY, playing the SAME mission again and again and again and again and again and....








again and again and again and.....








again and again....

just to try to get some decent weapons, then, by all means, you'll LOVE this game!

Normal people, however, and those who also live a real life outside of mommy's basement, quickly find the absurdity of the weapons progression to be, well, absurd!

3) Everything I've said thus far concerns single-player. A whole new level of absurdity is achieved in multiplayer. There, you have both armor and weapon-level limits for each mission. These limits ALWAYS put you at a radical disadvantage! For two-player, the mobs get 1.8 times harder to kill. Yet, now, you are weapons-level limited, so it's even harder to kill them. Furthermore, the number of mobs doesn't scale reasonably, so it feels exponentially harder in multiplayer!

Ohhh, you want to uncheck the two checkboxes that would allow you to NOT have armor and weapons-level limits? Sure you do, but you can't. Those are LOCKED. How do you unlock them? Well.... Brace yourself....

ALL you have to do is complete a net-total of 70% of the game including all four character classes. That's it. Just play about (no kidding) 1200 hours of (mostly repetitive) multiplayer (much of which is to farm weapons), about 350 completed missions, with all of the character classes, and you can finally "earn" the privilege of unlocking those checkboxes and thereby finally be able to bring your best weapons into the fights.

Ohhh, but you'll still have the problem you had from single-player: You CAN'T get those better weapons without farming in the harder modes.

You thought that "normal" was hard? Ha! Silly you! Normal ain't anything! You want to just enjoy some casual play, thinking that "hard" means hard, and "inferno" is for the hard-core fanbois that have nothing better to do with their lives than feel like "winners" because they can beat "inferno" levels? Sorry, there really IS NO NORMAL! "Normal" is very hard!

Even "normal" is FAR from reasonable. The higher missions (85+) are just INSANELY, STUPIDLY hard, even on "normal." And why? Well, because, see above. YOU didn't invest 500+ hours into farming weapons on the off chance that you'd get one of the rare drops that gives you a semi-decent weapon. So, you'll wade into battle with your peashooters and have to hit the mobs 2 to 100 times (no kidding) to kill them. Meanwhile, hundreds of them are swarming you, and you're overwhelmed.

This is worse that Serious Sam, because you don't just respawn and keep going. In THIS game, you die and you must restart the whole mission.

Again and again and again and again....

Well, I did that "again" bit to you once for effect, but, seriously, I cannot BEGIN to do justice to how RELENTLESS the "again" in this game is! You have never seen grind like this before; I sure haven't!

So, here's the deal. The game is a rip-off at $30! It's an insane rip-off at full price. At, maybe, $5, the average gamer is going to get enough value out of it. But you have to ask yourself ONE question....

Are you a HARD-CORE shooter who lives in mommy's basement and has nothing better to do with hundreds and hundreds and hundreds of hours to just TRY to get decent enough weapons to progress, or are you a more casual gamer who likes to play other games and has a REAL life?

Put another way: Is your entire identity wrapped up in beating games like this, or is your identity wrapped up in REAL-world accomplishments and relationships?

If you answer "yes" to the former half of those two questions, then this game is for YOU, and you will derive great personal satisfaction out of knowing that you are just WAY more bad-azz (as a gamer) than people like me who complain about the weapons-progression system and grind. If you answer "yes" to the latter half of those questions, then STAY AWAY, because this game is soul-sucking in its relentlessly overwhelming difficulty and grind. It is NOT fun to die continually on the "harder" missions, all the while being absurdly underpowered, and where the ONLY "answer" you'll hear is "farm for better weapons." And you'll just "love" almost beating one of the harder missions (after trying dozens of times) and find that the game glitches, one or more of your partners are disconnected, and you're left alone.

I really could go on and on. There are multiple other things about the bugs, the glitches, the HORRENDOUS menu system, and much more. But you have been warned. There is one primary sort of gamer that this game will appeal to. ALL others should pass on this!

38987739.review:
Ich habe seit langem nicht mehr so ein fantastisches Spiel mit so einem super Humor gespielt.

Kurzgefasst geht es um eine Alieninvasion bei denen riesige Insekten -Spinnen, Ameisen, Bienen und sogar Drachen(!)- aber auch hochhausgroße Kampfroboter die Erde überrennen. Deine Aufgabe: Mit allen zur Verfügung stehenden Mitteln die Invasoren abwehren.

So gibt es vier Klassen. Der normale Soldat (Ranger), der Unterstützer (Air Raider), der Tank (Fencer) und die Fliegerin (Wing Diver).

Am Anfang ist dein Arsenal ziemlich sperrlich. Lediglich hat man nur ein Sturmgewehr und einen Raketenwerfer zur verfügung. Jedoch mit jedem Level werden neue Waffen Freigeschaltet. Der Unterstützer kann später riesige Mechs und Panzer als Unterstützung aufs Feld anfordern. Die Fliegerin heizt mit ihrem Jetpack durch die Lüfte und schießt Blitze. Der Tank hat eine dicke Rüstung an und benutzt Schwere Waffen wie eine Gatling um den Feind einzuheizen. Der Soldat ist die Ausgewogenste Klasse zwischen Feuerkraft und Schnelligkeit.

Der Clue an diesem Spiel ist das es herrlich amüsant ist mit allen Mitteln den Feind aufzuhalten. So werden ganze Stäte in Schutt und Asche gelegt um die Insekten zu vernichten. Wer fordet nicht gerne einen Satiletenschlag al la C&C auf eine Einfamilienhaus große Spinne an? Oder Boxt mit einem riesen Mecha auf den kleinen Bruder von Godzilla?

Langzeitspaß ist auch gegeben. So gibt es ca. 100 Missionen in denen man den Invarsoren zusetzen kann. Durch die verschiedenen Schwirigkeitsstufen, die Vielen Waffen, die vier Klassen und die vielfalt der Feinde, bringt es immer Spaß eine Mission nochmal zu spielen.

Ein Manko ist die Steuerung. Während man zwar über die Einstellung in der Exe Datei die Steuerung wieder auf normal stellen kann, ist das Helikopter fliegen eine Qual. Ich habe noch nie so eine schlecht implementierte Steuerung erlebt wie hier beim Helikopter.

Ich kann dieses Spiel nur empfehlen. Es bringt Spaß und ist sehr humorvoll gestaltet. Jedem Frischling kann ich nur empfehlen den Multiplayer Modus zu spielen. Es wird einem nicht nur sehr geholfen, der Loot wird auch fair geteilt, darum lohnt sich egoistisches Spielen nicht. Man wird eher nur aufgefressen und stirbt,


Abschließend bleibt mir nur eines zu sagen:

EDF!! EDF!! EDF!!

38806132.review: A pretty decent game, although It is not worth the base price ($49.99 at the time of this review). If the game can be bought for $35 or less than I'd say go for it. The gameplay is fun, although sometimes monotonous. The game's single player 'career mode' progresses through a series of missions, and you pick the one of four classes and their respective weapons loadouts to complete the missions. However, the game is best played with others, be it online multiplayer or split-screen. Unfortunately, many weapons and even one of the four classes is useless when playing alone, because they require multiple people to operate. The game's mini map is a little inadequate, so when progressing through a level it becomes easy to backtrack or lose sense of direction. All in all, a good game to kick back and play with your buddys, and a decent game to burn some time when playing alone.

38767902.review:
Well, my friends all got this from the winter sale and sang its praises to me. I said "looks fun, but I dunno if I'll spend 30 bucks on it." So one of my friends got it for me. Would I have spent 30 bucks? Kinda? In terms of Fun™ it's definitely worth it, but if you want a polished game experience, look elsewhere.

Gameplay is sorta like Serious Sam in that it's a shooter based around taking on huge mobs of enemies. Each mission's objective (at least 40 missions in) is to exterminate all GIANT INSECTS/Robots/Monsters/whatever on the map. You have 3 fun classes and the Ranger, who is effective but isn't as exciting due to a lack of gimmicks.
-Ranger has consistent ground mobility and pretty standard weapons like rifles and grenade launchers. Still decently fun, if a bit... unimaginitive I guess?
-Wing Diver gets a jetpack as well as a host of laser/plasma weapons. Really cool to float around the combat area while exterminating bugs with her ridiculous weapons
-Air Raider is a support class who can call in air strikes and vehicles. He also has stuff like laser guiding kits and mines but who would use that stuff when you can just nuke the enemy or call in a Gundam?
-Fencer is essentially a Warhammer 40k Terminator. You choose 4 weapons which are wielded in pairs. These include shields, greatswords, gatling guns, high caliber cannons, shoulder mounted mortars, and more. While slow, a skilled player can make the Fencer dance around the battlefield with dashes and animation cancelling. My personal favorite class, with Air Raider at a close second.

This game is so jank that it loops back around to being charming. Story is laughably bad, probably on purpose. Dialogue is the exact same - nobody can accidentally write something this awful. Graphics look like something out of 2006, probably so the game doesn't implode when you have to fight 200 ants at the same time. The only ACTUAL flaw is the underground missions due to the darkness and close quarters.

And the game isn't just piss easy. You play through the game on normal, and then the REAL game begins. The enemies are tougher, but your arsenal just gets better and better. Tactics and teamwork actually matter.

Overall, EDF is an exceptional game. Definitely buy it if you love having Fun™, but if you want a serious game with cutting edge graphics, emergent AI, all the bells and whistles, stay away. You'll probably like this game anyway, though.

あーあこちらオオハラ、コントローラでは問題ないのにマウス&キーボード操作で感度3000倍になってしまう
ウィングダイバー(とその他兵科)諸君聞いてくれ
*SteamApps\common\Earth Defense Force 4.1
にあるEDF41.exeを右クリックし互換性タブの「高いDPIスケールの動作を上書きします」
にチェックすることで正常な感度に戻すことができる。
試してみてくれ！

ゲームのレビューを言えばやっったら細かくリアルに描かれた日本の町を舞台に大量かつ
巨大なアリやロボットを倒しまくる爽快な国産TPS。

一つ一つのミッションは短くハクスラ的要素もあるので相当長く遊べます。

リアルな街並みが高層ビル並みのデカさの兵器などに踏みつぶされ壊されていく様は
ゲームとはいえなかなか見られたものではないし
"自らの要請した空爆"で大量のアリどもを町をごと爆破しつくす快感は
他では味わえないものがあります。

また4.1と奇妙なナンバリングになっているが別に4の後日談だとかおまけってことはなく
もともとPS3&Xbox360で発売された地球防衛軍4をPS4で発売する際に多くの新要素と
バランス調整を行ったのもののＰＣ版がこの作品。
ようするに4のリマスターというよりかはリメイクといって差し支えのないものになっています。


4ということもあり何度侵略されてるんだこの世界はとお思いでしょうが
世界観は3でリセットされているため、今作は二度目の侵略ということになります。
(残念ながら3はXbox360かPSVitaのリメイク版のみでＰＣ版は存在しない…だれかここから出してくれ！)

勿論というべきか前大戦で地球人はフォーリナー、すなわち宇宙からの侵略者たちを追い払うとともに高い技術力を得ており、地球防衛軍(Earth Defense Force)略してEDFは前回あれほど苦戦したフォーリナー相手にかなり善戦しています。
この戦い、勝てるぞ！

だからシリーズ初めての人でも安心して入隊してね(ニッコリ)


4はもともと完成されていたものなわけですし、それを改善した4.1はかなりの良バランス
イージー、ノーマル、ハード、ハーディスト、インフェルノと五段階の難易度がある本作ですが
どの難易度もそれぞれうまく調整されており飽きさせません。

とくにオンラインでは使える武器が難易度によって異なり
敵は弱いがこちらの装備も弱いイージーと敵は強いがこちらもそれなりの装備を使える
ノーマルやハードでは立ち回りが大きく変わってきたり
最高難易度のインフェルノは本っっっ当に敵が強いかわりにこちらの装備も
めっっっちゃくちゃ強いため、圧倒的火力VS圧倒的火力
やるかやられるかの駆け引きを楽しめます！

まああっちは圧倒的物量で攻めてくるんだけど


またＥＤＦには四つの兵科が存在し、空爆や戦車やヘリなど多数の兵器を要請したり、無人戦闘兵器をばらまいたり
電磁バリアなどで味方をアシストできるエアレイダーや
圧倒的な火力と装甲を犠牲にして手にした機動力を武器に敵をおやつかの如く溶かしていき
高難易度では油断するとすぐ自らも溶けていくウィングダイバー
アーマースーツに身を固め、ガトリング砲や120ミリキャノンを担いでのろのろ歩いたり
スラスターを装備したブレードやスピアー、ハンマーなどで敵に突っ込みあっちゅうまに
敵を壊滅させちゃうフェンサー
なんやかんや普通が一番、器用だけど全然貧乏してない歩兵のレンジャーの四種が使えます。
どれも違った立ち回りが要求されるため、とても楽しめます。

ストーリーもかなり気分を乗せてくれ、英雄になった気分になれます。
オンラインもまだまだ人はいますし攻略Wikiもやたら充実してますので長く楽しめる作品です。
ＥＤＦはあなたの入隊をまってますよ！

38582433.review:
TL;DR: Words can't describe how floored I was after playing this game for a good hour or so. How this slipped under the radar until now is beyond me, but you owe it to yourself to get this game, find a friend, and slog through it. It's wonderful.

I can't believe how good this game is. I laughed at them asking for $50 for about a year, given the dated visuals and lack of presentation...but I finally bit on the $30 sale, and the sheer gameplay depth here is astonshing. Don't be fooled, the game does look like it's straight out of the early X360 days (because it is), the story and voice acting is B-movie at best, and playing this with anything other than a gamepad is essentially lunacy.

But the sheer variety in classes and their loadouts is what kept me in this game. I've never seen another game like this diversify gameplay across four classes so well - you've got a mix of bullet hell and tactical shooter in the Ranger, the Wing Diver is essentially half resource management and half Mercy, the Fencer gets to act like he's either in Armored Core or he's Reinhardt, and the Air Raider gets to call in tactical nukes, mechs, bombing runs, and file paperwork.

Co-op play is a must for this game. Find another person to bring along with you at a minimum - this game is nothing but a disappointment alone. The classes were built to work with each other, and most of them aren't as effective without support in some fashion.

It's not a perfect game by any means - for every great gameplay decision they seem to make a terrible one, and the console port isn't without its flaws. It's a game not meant to be taken wholly seriously, although there is plenty of room for tactical play if you're into it. (Most of my complaints actually stem from the in-game menus and matchmaking - stuff easily overlooked once you're in the thick of it.)

Overall? It's highly worth it if you like the sound of a co-op shooter with depth, lots of explosions, and hilarity. If you're on the edge, get it on sale, but I honestly think the $50 they ask for it isn't out of the question. It's got a lot of polish underneath the dated surface.

I'm disappointed in this game. Due to the 'Overwhelmingly Positive' reviews, I was expecting EDF:IA with better graphics and more fun.  That's clearly not the case. If you liked any aspect of EDF:IA, do NOT buy this game.

This game is clearly a console port.  From the intro game screens, it detects that you're playing with a kb/m but it doesn't show a mouse cursor. You're expected to scroll the mouse up & down & sideways like you would a joystick controller. That control method extends to all of the game dialog boxes.  For someone used to a real kb/m game, it is disconcerting.

On the surface, the graphics are amazing. However, after playing a bit, you see the shearing & insides of ants/buildings as you're bounced around.

The real dealbreaker is the movement speed.  The chars move extremely SLOWLY compared to the rest of the environment. For a game that gives every appearance of being a fast paced, arcade style shooter, this is very disappointing. The only char with any decent movement speed is the Flyer and, as expected, you can only use that in limited bursts.

38527226.review:
After playing this game for quite a while, I would say you should definitely get it if you have friends willing to get it as well. Beyond that, it's worth many, many hours of gameplay. There'e just a few problems with the game. 

First, the game has a sort of infinite scaling thing for your health. you have to pick up 'armor' drops from fights that drop from enemies. It doesn't even explain how exactly this works, as you can collect 30 armor crates and it will increase your armor by like, 3, which is your max health. Now you're talking about a game where you start with like 200 hp. 

Second, that brings me to another issue, which is the difficulty. You could try to use the 'git gud' argument but that doesn't work here. Many enemies either use overwhelming numbers where you simply can't kill them fast enough, or they have 100% accuracy on their weapons, like lasers, where you are always going to be hit if they can see you. 

Third, as far as difficulties go, the rewards you get scale up pretty normally, while the difficulty on the settings is just absurd. Typically you can play up to hard pretty well. You might have a bit of trouble, but if you play well and play smart you'll be able to play through the game on hard. But if you DARE set the game to hardest? The fourth of 5 difficulties (The hardest is Inferno) then all of a sudden, pretty much every attack will one shot you. The only way to get around this? Grind the same levels over, and over, and over again farming armor crates. And as I said, you get like, +1 maximum health for every 5 crates you pick up... and you're going to need thousands of hp if you want to get into inferno difficulty. 

Fourth, weapon and class issues. The problem with this is simply that some things just don't scale well. For example the Wing Diver. You would think getting a higher level weapon is a good thing right? Well the Wing Diver uses energy to fly, and that same energy is used to either reload, or if the weapon doesn't have a 'clip', then simply fire a weapon. You end up getting weapons that have incredible power, but take up like 300% energy, so you have to recharge your energy 4 times over just to fire this weapon once. Meanwhile, for that whole time, you are stuck defenseless, unable to fly, on the most immobile class on foot. They do this for other things as well, such as the Ranger where if a weapon has incredible power, it's always offset by something such as a very small clip, an extremely long reload, or just not being able to reload the weapon at all. They like doing that one. 

So all in all, great game, can't recommend it enough with friends. Just know the endgame is only for those who want an endless grind for the sake of an endless grind.

This game is the first EARTH DEFENSE FORCE game I've played and I must say it's absolute bonkers.

Keep in mind that this is the English text version of the game review, as I'm not familiar with the Japanese language.

[b]Pros:[/b]

-Controls are solid, the characters you play feel very responsive.

-A variation of playable characters with each their special skills and weapons

-Weapons are a joy to use and feel satisfying.

-The large open areas are still pretty tough to move around in, even when you can fly, enemies can still hit you pretty hard.

-Giant insects, crawlies and robots

-You can basically whipe out an entire city without penalty (As in destructible houses/buildings)

[b]Cons:[/b]

-Graphics leave something to be desired, it's fun and looks good but nothing we haven't already seen.

-Menus are cluttered and can only be navigated by keyboard.

-Buttons and keyboard layouts are all over the place as someone used to generic western controls for navigation (WASD, Mouse & Enter... Instead its the arrow keys and spacebar, no mouse, mouse works for camera movement In-Game)

-This is minor but still a personal annoyance: The font is too big, sometimes overlapping with other text like in loading screens


All and all, pretty fun and best played with a friend or online with people :)

38363406.review:
TLDR: It's Starship Troopers meets Japan: The Game, The Life, The Experience.



Most of EDF 4.1 involves blowing up or blasting through giant bugs and robots with guns, lightning, lasers, tanks, missiles, helicopters, and sometimes other giant robots, while singing your way through it. Seriously, that's the entire point. Go out and have a blast. If you're looking for a game with a deep plot and story, you could look between the lines and probably overanalyze something into existence, but otherwise this game might not be for you.

Gameplay-wise, there's a number of things to get used to. Rangers play differently than Air Raiders, which play differently than Wing Divers, which are a totally different playstyle than Fencers. Each class is their own game to learn, with little tricks to figuring out each. 

If you don't want to pay too much attention to the finer details and sally forth to kill something, Ranger is a good starting point. You have your basic infantry weapons, and some really interesting things (bouncing shots, ridiculous missiles and grenades, healguns). Their Buffalo shotguns are also hilarious for sending dead friends into the depths of the world or to outer space. Just try it, you'll understand~

Air Raiders are their own special cup of tea, but if you think they're just a "support class," you're dead wrong. Sure, they can be used as that, and in cave missions a lot of the times that's where they can really shine. You can pack your deployable thingies and heal your team back to perfection. Or, y'know, use that spider mech thing and crawl on some walls with really awkward controls or something. You can even put your deployables ON the awkward spider mech, and help your team that way! Outside, however, is where air strikes rain supreme! If you want to toss out a beacon and watch the fireworks, this is a class for you.

Wing Divers also have that unique kind of gameplay that you'll only find with EDF. Instead of normal infantry, they only use plasma-based weapons. Whether that's in the form of a laser chainsaw, explosive light balls, lightning machine guns, or pinpoint (or not-so-pinpoint) lasers, you'll be using your jetpack fuel for everything. That's right, jetpacks! You're like a portable charger that grew wings and electrified stingers. You're going to get into the fray quick and obliterate it just as quickly. Very high-risk-high-reward style though, for if you run out of your energy, you can't do anything other than hop around and pray that red bar fills faster (except for weapons that store a charge on their own. If they don't empty, you can still use those~). For those that like that all-in kind of style. Some sniping options are viable, but not as fun.

Fencers are a strange mixed bag of "fixed artillery" and "close air support craft." You'll start out with this class not knowing exactly what you're trying to do with it. You might think you know, but you know NOTHING. Don't worry, it happened to me too~. They can be played a number of different ways, their namesake being the slow-moving-but-tanky defensive lineman, that also happens to have 105mm howitzers strapped to its back. That's only really if you don't know how to do a dash-cancel. Look up guides for that. Once you get that down, you'll have one kit that gets you places and lets you stab bugs with beams of light, spears, axes, giant hammers, and whatever other nonsensical this-should-be-on-a-mech-stabby-thing. And you'll have a kit that deals with everything else (I do like me some howitzers). That's the way I do it at least, but mileage will vary between players. For players that like adaptable, technical styles of play, where positioning is almost as important as the shooting.

If I had to choose one thing about this game that's annoying, it's the online progress bar. You have to apply SO MANY hours just to see 1% increases at times. For those that haven't experienced it, you earn progression by both:
A) Beating the mission with 1 of 4 classes.
B) Beating the mission at 1 of 5 difficulties.

For the less math-inclined, you replay the same mission at minimum for 20 times to obtain full progression for that mission. Why would you do this to yourself? Well, once you can get 70% completion of the online mode, you can uncap weapon and armor level limits when you make a lobby. By that point, honestly, you won't need the uncapped stats. It's just there to make you feel like a goddamn superhero for putting in the work, and frankly that's amazing to me.

Now, that's probably my only real issue with the game. Progression for HP increasing and weapon pickups seems fair. Just pick up the boxes and you're good!

I've spent a ton of time just working my way through online progression, working with friends and unknowns online, and in general enjoying the pure PvE experience. You can play it however you really want, though blowing up friendlies isn't so recommended. The community, in my experience, is there for you, and as for those local to the Japan-side, the in-game chat works wonders. You can communicate nearly everything using them.

Highly recommended to play with controller. Choking hazard for those under the age of two. If you find yourself chanting the various songs in the game, don't bother consulting your doctor. That just means it's working.

The EDF deploys~

The game simple, yet full of action in any difficulty, (not that agressive on normal an easy) you kill every enemy on the mission you win. Some of them just dare you to stay alive  for some time and resist waves of enemies.

You collect drops from dead enemies (armor, weapons, health) to get more weapons and Hp for your char.

Contrary to popular belief, you dont need to grind, farm, you name it.
You can if you want to;  It's not necessary; just complete the game in any dificulty and eventually you get tons( the required amount) of armor for the next difficulty. Know your limits dont jump into inferno too soon or you will get frustrated and will want to cheat the missions.

Some missions have you fighting for your life against hundreds of giant ants, 20 robots, 3 ships and tons of dragons, drones, giant spiders and one Almost-Godzilla. sometimes everything at the same time.

TL;DR
Online coop in this game is amazing(little crashes from time to time but meh)
Local split screen to play with your brother
Millions of giant insects
Giant robots
Godzilla 
Hundreds of missions( with many difficulties)*
Hundreds of weapons( like 800)
Mindless fun.
Amazingly useful quick chat messages.
EDF community is great.

38055475.review:
馬鹿ゲーのふりしたカジュアルＣｏｏｐゲーの傑作
さくっと出来て、わーっと楽しめる
難しいこと考えずにやってもどうにかなるけど、ある程度は考えないとクリアできないという、絶妙にカジュアルなバランスが素晴らしい
「ＰａｙｄａｙとかみたいなガチＣｏｏｐはちょっと……」という人にもＣｏｏｐゲーの入門としてやってもらいたい

逆にＣｏｏｐゲーに慣れてる人にアピールする点としては、
『メタビルドが多様で、汎用ビルドが、ほぼそれを下回る性能に調整されていること』だろうか

同じ兵科でもミッションや、パーティメンバーとの連携によって、有利なビルドがかなり変わってくる
汎用ビルドだけで突っ走ることも可能だが、ミッション毎、パーティ編成毎に、メタ装備を持って行くと、より効果的になる

ただ、事前のブリーフィングやマップ、登場する敵の予測などが見れないため、初見だと結局、汎用ビルドで行かざるをえない＝ワンパタなプレイになるのが大きなマイナス点
旧日本軍のインパール作戦やポートモレスビー攻略戦なみの、いきあたりばったりを毎回、強いられる
このため、必要な装備が足りないせいで詰むことも、かなりあっていうね
せっかくのＣｏｏｐゲーとして面白い部分である、メタ装備の多様性を自分から潰して、無難な汎用ビルドを強いてくる開発陣はアホ

サプライズ演出上、ブリーフィングできないのはわかるけど、
途中で一回くらいは装備を変更できるシステムはないと、初見は捨てプレイするか、汎用ビルドでワンパタプレイするしかなくなって
結局使う武器が８００種類中の３種類くらいまで絞り込まれることになるっていうアホさはマジでアホ
せっかくの初見で最大限楽しめるサプライズ演出のコンセプトが、装備変更できないことで、やり直し前提になってしまってて、かみ合ってないんだよ
やり直し前提にしない場合は、汎用ビルドでワンパタプレイで、装備やクラスの豊富さが死に要素になるだろ？
もうちょっと考えてゲーム作ろうぜ？


ゲーム性意外の部分で、特に見所になるのは、エフェクトの外連味
グラフィックの質自体は、大量のモブが押し寄せるゲーだから、良くはないが、
その分、モーションや爆発、機械の破壊パターン、着弾エフェクトが、アインハンダー等の傑作ＳＴＧを彷彿とさせるかっこよさで、気合い入りすぎて気持ちいい
これが、大量のモブをなぎ倒す爽快感に直結してるので、このへんの割り切ったコンセプトはすげえ評価できる

演出面も「プレイヤーが何をやりたいか、わかってる奴がつくってる」感があって◎
地球防衛軍とかいうアホ丸出しの子供だましなタイトルから、見て分かるとおり
このゲームのターゲット対象年齢は、精神年齢８歳の大きなお友達
いい年扱いたおっさんたちが、エイリアンを相手に、戦争ごっこする
そのために必要な全てが揃ってる

例えば
・俺たちがやらなければ、地球は終わりだ！　
・空軍は基本役に立たず、歩兵がどうにかするしかない
・頼りになりそうな博士は、かならず作戦失敗のフラグを持ってくる
・敵の基地に突入して、余裕で殲滅、と思いきや、閉じ込められて全滅しそう
・でかい怪獣が現れた→よし、俺たちも巨大ロボを呼ぶぞ！
・味方の兵士全員が、死亡フラグ乱立
・隊長「俺に構わず行け、お前が指揮を引き継ぐんだ」 


カジュアル・爽快感ＭＡＸ・バランス良好・精神年齢８歳のおっさんがメインターゲット
この四つのキーワードに惹かれたお前は、５が出た今でも、買って置いて損はない

37930633.review:
I have just finished the game. Just finished it. At only normal mode. I am crying. I am very moved.

Little bit about my gaming choices, I am a super fan of RPG gameplay, making choices in story mode, etc etc.

I was recommended by a friend to play this game, and I was quite skeptical about mission based action games. There wasn't any hardcore roleplay, or any detailed customization options, or was there choices to make in the story, and yet...I am utterly IMPRESSED.

I have never felt this level of satisfaction of completing a game, even in most RPG games, at most, I would be ah, what a good story that was.

The moment I finished the last boss mission, while watching the last scene, I had tears swelling up in my eyes, and when the credits rolled and the EDF song started playing, I just couldn't stop the tears.

To the yet-to-buy friends from any part of the world, if you're reading this review:

- When I first started the game, I was doubtful on whether this game will be fun at all or not.

- First Mission: The feeling of shooting giant bugs, and seeing them die in odd blood-spraying animation, seems oddly awesome.

Now don't just rush and buy the game yet, cos the best part not here yet.

- Next few missions, when you first hear the citizens screaming for help, and when you hit the trigger button and defeat the bug, and you save them while thinking "meh, they probably don't even know what's going on.", and suddenly you hear their shout of thanks, the feeling of "oh...I am a hero to them. huh" will come rushing into your head.

- Another few more missions, getting called "Sir" really feel awesome, and these people salute me while they offer to help me in the mission...I should salute you not the other way around! I thank you NPCs for actually fighting at all!

- Some more misisons, oh no don't kill the Wing Divers, no no no don't you dare you little pesky spider! No! Alice-chan! Lisa-chan! NOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO!!!!! *stares at dead Wing Diver* AHHHHHH DAMN IT! *cries for a bit* That's it...Die YOU STUPID TOO MANY EYES!!!!!

- Later Missions, EDF! EDF! EDF! WHOOOOOAAAAAA!!!!! CHARRRRGEEEEE!!!!! RANGERS!!!!!

- AWESOME Missions, Whew. That was hard. Wait what? What are you guys talking ab...WHHHOOOAAAAA! Giant LIZARD!!!! GODZILLAAAA?????? WHY?! WAHHH????

- EVEN MORE AWESOME Missions, OOOOOOOoooooOOOOOOOOooooooYEAAAAAAAHHHHH I AM A ROBOT!!!!!!!! COME AT PAPA DUMB LIZZZZYYY!

- Almost towards the end..., EDF! EDF! EDF! WHOOOOOAAAAAA!!!!! CHARRRRGEEEEE!!!!! SAVE THE EARTH!!!! DIE YOU LITTLE PESTS!!! ARRRRRGGGGGHHHH!!!

- LAST MISSION. I AM NOT GIVING UP! NO! NO WAY! I IMMA WIN THIS WAR AND SAVE EARTH!!!! ARRRRGHHHHH!!!! EEEEEE!!! DDDDDDD!! FFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF!!! YEEEEAAAHHAHAHAHHHA!!!!

- Defeated last boss..., ah...ah....AHAHAHAHAHAHAAH URGGHGHGHGAHAHAHAH yeahhhh I...I....I did it....SOB....Earth is....safe...finally....HAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAAAHHAH *STARTS SOBBING LOUDLY*

...and the day was saved.

Thank you for reading this odd review, but all my honest feelings are poured into it.

And for you, on the other side of my screen.

Will you join my fight to save our home?!

Will you join....the EARTH DEFENSE FORCE?

37850786.review:
Graphics:  Late Playstation 2 Era
Sound:  Mediocre
Voice Acting:  Laughable
Plot:  Pretty Lame
Gameplay:  Repetitive

Fun:  YES!

Here is a game that brings forth the campy low budget atmosphere of a B-movie into the video gaming world.  All of the above is true:  The graphics, sound, voice acting, plot and gameplay are all pretty meh across the board.  That said, this is perhaps one of the most amusing games third person shooters I've played in many many years.

It helps that the game doesn't take itself too seriously.  While not going full Goat Simulator and relying on 'lol random' to make up for effort on their part, the game designers instead have made almost every level* a sandbox for you to fight giant bugs using progressively more ludicrously overpowered weaponry.  You will go from rocket launchers that take several shots to level a single building to multi-launch missile systems that can level an entire city block with a single squeeze of the trigger.

It's that progression of power in your weaponry that is part of what makes this game so compelling.  The power progression combined with a menace largely composed of big creepy crawlies makes for a video game equivalent of going after an ant hill with a magnifying glass on a sunny day.  Each city level with the bugs has them crawling all over the sky scrapers like they own the place.  And it's oddly satisfying to level said sky scrapers while happily scouring the city of the infestation.  Sure you probably caused more property damage and loss of life than the aliens ever would but /dammit/ if you didn't show those jerks what for!!

We've not even gotten onto the vehicles yet either!  While they're largely limited to a single class (Air Raider), they are pretty cool and include the relatively mundane in helicopters and tanks before going to railgun platforms, mini-mechas, multi-pilot regular mechas, and finally a Jaeger.  Also provided:  A giant Godzilla-alike with the serial numbers filed off for you to punch around in said Jaeger.  Sadly the Jaegers are multi-pilot so no drifting for you but as mentioned above several of the vehicles are multi-pilot and it's pretty cool if you have some buddies to work together with to pilot a tank that is wider across than a four lane highway.

So the Air Raiders have some pretty cool stuff, so maybe you think they're the only class you really need.  But wait!  Why summon in a giant mecha when you can basically be a human-sized mecha as a Fencer?  Sure you're slow as molasses but with the right skill and weaponry you can put out as much if not more damage than anyone else.

Want more mobility?  Try a Wing Diver!  Fragile but with a jetpack that allows unparalleled mobility and a selection of unique laser and plasma based weaponry you can happily glass your foes from above!  At least until the bees arrive.  OH GOD THE BEES.

Want to be boring?  Pick a Ranger!  OK OK I kid.  The Ranger actually is a good balance of mobility and power when compared to the Fencer and Wing Diver.  Sure they can't fly but they have the fastest on foot speed, and their weaponry is simple and effective unlike the unwieldy battleship cannons the Fencer uses or the also-uses-your-jetpack-fuel plasma weaponry of the Wing Diver.

So you have four different ways to fight, but what about things to fight?  Well I've mentioned some examples above but there are many more.  Your enemy will not just employ giant bugs but also various mechanical foes like mechas and flying drones.  Thought the bees were bad?  Try dragons!  You also have huge ships that act as spawners and interlocking plates that will cover the sky overhead.  All of this adds to the challenge as the game goes on and gives you new ways to try and use that arsenal you are trying to stockpile.  Go ahead, call in a nuke on a beach full of giant angry red ants.  It's great fun!

So in conclusion, Earth Defense Force 4.1: The Shadow of New Despair is a great game.  It's not perfect.  It has a ton of flaws thanks to the fact it is a low budget game designed for consoles.  That said I'm excited about the idea of there being a sequel to this game in ways I would never be for other shooters with multi-million dollar budgets.  It's simple, it's enjoyable, and I think it reminds us that that is all you need in the end.  This, to me, is the blueprint that other looter shooters should follow.  Where instead of incremental upgrades of rifle you're waiting to pick up the next ridiculous multi-grenade launcher that can blow up everything around you (and you) in a satisfyingly hilarious way.

If I can make one small suggestion though ... the fact weapon pickups can be duplicates which you get no benefit for it annoying.  At least make them count as armor upgrades or something, SHEESH!!

* Subterranean levels and levels out in the country side are sadly lacking in big boxy targets for you to boomify with your weaponry.

37829397.review: Earth Defense Force 4.1 makes no attempt to be anything other than the best B-Movie sizzle reel possible: at its core, it is a third-person class-based cooperative shooter, pitting the titular Earth Defense Force against the invading hordes of aliens, giant bugs, war machines, and more. This is wrapped up entirely with campy overacted dialogue, enthusiastic CPU allies, and video-card destroying quantities of insects, explosions, and the rubble where Japan's skyscrapers once stood. Best experienced with three friends online, a 2-player local co-op mode does exist. The default controls may be a little wonky, some vehicles may be a little weird to use, and some classes may be more enjoyable than others, but EDF 4.1 is worth a look as it is one of the few games that remains true to its core belief: the Earth must be protected at all costs, no matter the odds.

37627188.review: Do you like absurd amounts of explosions? The thunderous roar of machine guns? Unlimited ammo and more enemies than you can shake a shotgun at? And do you want to do it all with your friends? Then you've come to the right place. This game is about using absurdly awesome weaponry to fight absurdly sized aliens. 37625185.review:
10/10 - An outstanding horde shooter for fans of Borderlands, Left for Dead, Serious Sam and the like. Perfect for playing splitscreen on the couch with friends or online.  It's a fine blend of Starship Troopers, Anime and a Sunday afternoon picnic gone awry in the worst kind of way (yup giant ants). 

I piloted a giant mech, punched Godzilla in the face, leveled entire city blocks and carried a tune with my squaddies all a the same time. I can't remember the last time I did that...  It's just one of many epic and insane encounters one can experience. 

Sometimes you'll feel like the guy who has to open the door at Walmart on Black Friday, but that's okay too... at least you can bring a shield ...or bazooka or choose whatever you want from the hundreds and hundreds of weapons and gadgets available.

The visuals are a feast for the eye. Granted you won't see anatomically correct nosehair or butt sway animations as the rendering horsepower was directed to give you more on screen enemies, more explosions and other eye candy. I mean that's what we're here for right?

The campaign goes on and on - even longer in multiplay coop with additional missions, which is a good thing. There's a good mix of mission types as almost every one feels unique. The ending takes an unexpected turn where you have to blow up a big floaty thing  and stuff - who would've imaged that in a shooter game!

This game has comedy value, both intentional and not. Along with the utterly cheezy dialogue, you'll encounter wonky animations, insane physics and poor Japanese translations. Note to the devs, its perfectly broken please don't fix it. どうもありがと!

37364738.review:
This game has absolutely no right to be as enjoyable as it is.

The graphics are 20 years out of date, the sound of the giant bugs is as gratingly repetitive as an old 8 bit game, the unlocks are almost laughably unbalanced and the handling of most of the vehicles is questionable at best.

But somehow... somehow... the whole game revels in its shoddiness, in its kitsch B-movie style and atmosphere complete with awful translations, and you end up revelling in it as well. No, wait. You end up LOVING it.

Somehow none of the downsides matter.

So the graphics are awful. It doesn't matter because when there are literally a hundred giant ants swarming across a city towards you while ridiculous giant robots stalk the horizon behind them... you really don't care that none of it is that well rendered. The spectacle, the sheer joy of being in the middle of something so ridiculous just stomps flat any piffling concerns you might have about the blockiness of the UFOs or the way the ants animate when they go over corners. Not to mention the advantage that it basically runs at 60fps on a potato.

The grating sound? Your friendly troops drown it out by singing the stupidest, most glorious anthem ever voiced by any pretend-videogame-military ever. It's so utterly terrible that I could barely see through the tears of laughter as I listened to my dying allies singing it full-throated as they were slaughtered by B-movie monstrosities from beyond the stars.

The horribly unbalanced weapons? Welp, there are nearly 1000 of them. Don't like one you got? Just keep playing and pick up more green weapon crates. You don't really lose anything by failing a mission - you can just play it again. Seriously, it's that half-assed. It's like they said, ehhhh, we could spend months trying to balance these weapons and vehicles... or just throw so many at the player they'll feel like kids in a candy shop run by a psychotic sugar-addict. And sometimes, just using something awful and winning is just as much fun as using the most gloriously over-the-top mega-missile imaginable. I'm looking at you motorcycle sidecar.

This game is a glorious, shoddy, messy tribute to gameplay itself. Pure, unadulterated, ridiculous fun. You don't need to get anything else even close to perfect if you can make the gameplay this good.

THE EDF DEPLOOOOOOYS

37237633.review:
One of the best co-op games I've played, though I doubt much of the online community remains so you probably want to bring friends. Probably the most fun I had with a game in 2016(i'm writing this near the end of 2017). 

I'm too lasy to write a comprehensive review so I'll keep it short. There's a lot of stages(almost 100 without dlc), and a large amount of enemy variety(from ants to giant robots). Missions can take place in cities with destructible buildings, large open barren wastelands, underground tunnels, etc... You have all the difficulties unlocked from the start but progression is more like Diablo. Weapons have a level attached to them and you permanently increase your max hp by picking up armor during missions.Higher level weapons tend to be more over the top and effect your playstyle more than lower level weapons. Harder difficulties change the types of enemies that spawn, with variations of some enemies being exclusive to the harder difficulties. 

4 different classes, each with different playstyles. Ranger is like playing a standard 3rd person shooter, though you have an evasive roll. Weapons are mostly standard stuff like assault rifles, snipers, and rocket launchers. Wing divers get a jetpack and use energy weapons that focus on high melee damage or high ranged AoE damage. They have an energy meter that is used for both the jetpack and reloading, so they are big on meter management as depleting your meter leaves you mostly defenseless. Air raiders are lacking in ways to do damage to enemies directly. They can summon vehicles such as tanks, helicopters, missile launchers, and mechs. They can call airstrikes, deploy automated turrets, boost ally damage, heal allies, etc.... Fencers can wield 2 weapons at once, allowing a total of 4 weapons in your loadout. Their movement is unconventional. By default they move painfully slow and have no defensive measures, but they can become the fastest class in the game with the right setup. Lots of melee weapons, shields that can reflect projectiles, gatling guns, cannons, and short ranged spears.

For those not in the know Earth Defense Force 4.1 is a "remaster" of sorts of Earth Defense Force 2025, the newest game in the series. It features native 1080p resolution (possibly 4k, I'm unsure), keyboard and mouse controls (2025 didn't release on PC), and 60 fps (although this is locked at 60, why can't I go higher?)

Earth Defense Force is a series about blowing the absolute fuck out of giant insects with a wide array of weapons, and 4.1 delivers as well as anyone can expect.

I won't go too deep into this as you have probably already decided whether you are going to buy this or not, but do know this, if not for Bloodborne and EDF 4.1 I wouldn't own a PS4 today, if Bloodborne were to get a PC release I would pawn that PS4 in a heartbeat.

36842421.review:
[h1]Imposible aburrirse matando bichos gigantes y robots alienígenas[/h1]

Soy fan de la saga desde su "nacimiento" con el título de [i]"Monster Attack"[/i] que salió en Play Station 2. No hay tramas, no hay dialogos, no hay historia, no hay gráficos realistas, no hay simulación. Solo [b]ACCIÓN.[/b]

Gran cantidad de misiones y ninguna se te hará repetitiva. Lo prometo. Tu unico objetivo es disparar a todo el que no sea humano. Te presentan diferentes clases de soldados, cada una con sus armas y habilidades. Las armas tienen munición infinita, ya entenderás por qué. A mayor dificultad, necesitarás mayor estrategia, tanto en la combinación con las armas, como el lugar donde te cubras.

Si bien tiene gráficos de "animé" y las animaciónes de ciertas criaturas no son las mejores, se le perdona. ¿Quién tomará esas cosas en cuenta cuando puedes sacar el mejor lanzamisiles que tengas a tu disposición y acabar con toda la ciudad? En efecto, los edificios son destructibles, es algo genial. Dispones desde armas "reales" hasta futurísticas. (Supuestamente, sacadas de tecnología alienígena).

Lo mejor de todo es que puedes jugar solo, pantalla dividida o hasta online. Player vs Player y Coop. Así pues, no hay manera de que te aburras, aunque jueges la misma misión varias veces.

Las misiones son muy variadas, pocas son repetitivas. Pero algunas valen la pena con batallas de lo más épicas que hayas jugado antes. La adrenalina es lo mejor, vayas ganando o vayas perdiendo.

[spoiler]No conozco a nadie que se niegue a pelear contra un dinosaurio grande estilo Godzilla desde un robot gigantesco.[/spoiler]

Siempre suelo dar pros y contras en análisis, pero este juegazo no se lo merece, con un puntaje de 10/10. Te prometo que no te arrepentirás de haberlo comprado.

36841638.review: EDF 4.1 is a wonderful game about killing bugs to save the earth and flattening the city along the way. The game is pure distilled action as each stage is just you, the bugs and maybe a few NPC distractions. While there IS a story, it's nothing to really write home about and in the end it's all just set dressing for the game's action. With four different classes each with their own selection of weapons (and seperate completion percentage), there's a LOT of content if you really sink your teeth into this game. The game itself has a feel of camaraderie that I think is sorely missing in games, even the NPC chatter makes them feel like they're people fighting beside you - even if the dialouge is disjointed at times. The whole package is just unapolagetically upbeat in the face of despair and I love it.

36749792.review:
The one and only reason I've decided to write this review is because of the Steam Awards. I have nominated EDF for the Dogs of War award even though it's unbelievably hard to describe why is this game so fun and weird at once.

I love EDF. Even though I didn't play that much and even though I didn't finish it, it's a game that I always remember as THAT ONE GAME WHERE YOU SHOOT HUNDREDS OF GIANT ANTS AND ROBOTS WITH BALLISTIC ROCKETS, SPACE RAYS AND BIG RED INFLATABLE BALLOONS (wait what). It never fails to amaze you with the sheer amount of different weapons and ways to kill your enemies with a big ba-da-boom

The graphics are not too shiny. When they game came out on the consoles, it didn't look good back then.
Music is nothing special. FIne, but I don't wake up in the middle of the night whistling the main menu theme. Except for the "edf deploys" song, this one is unbelieveably catchy.
The animations are sub-par at most in case of the insects.
The story (huh, there is some story, wow) is so B-quality that it's absolutely hilarious. "They have a screen shield. My god, they have A SCREEN SHIELD! That explains everything!" or "They have survived for the last 8 years. How? Oh, they were living underground right under our biggest cities. We didn't know about it. We are shocked." A delightful humor in parodying the staples of the genre.

But god damn me if it is not the game I think about when I say "Quality coop action experience".
Buy it. You either love it in the first hour or two or you don't like it from the first second. There is no third option. Try it and then return if you don't like it. Or welcome to the EDF family. Strike team out.

35832346.review:
While I recieved EDF as a gift, I'd had it on my wishlist from the second I heard about it. Having finally played it, I can honestly say it was worth the wait. A small breakdown:
Graphics: Fun and bright with just the right touch of realism. 8.5/10
Sound: Overall clear with a few unfortunate incidents of overlap during critical mission points. 7.5/10
Controls: Fairly smooth aside from vehicles and Lancers. Flight controls of Winged Divers are ace once you get used to them. 8/10
Story: Obviously linear, it being a mission based game, without much variation between character types. Listening to the AI soldiers adds a bit more depth to the story. Kinda cheesy voice acting, but still enjoyable. 7/10
Enemy and Ally AI: Bugs a mindless drones (pun unintended) that continuously swarm at you opnce you're in sight. Allies are pretty much just cannon fodder unless playing multi player. 7/10
Replay value: 80+ missions per character, fun gameplay, collectable items, multi player mode, and achievments as well as downloadable content mean you will be this game for a long time. 9/10

In general, play EDF as soon as possible and make sure to enjoy it with friends.

35647050.review:
The trailers don't do this game justice. 

Extremely addictive arcade like fun, with lots of charm and humor, even the story which of course isn't it's strong point (being it's a game about giant protecting the world from giant insects, and has other arguably "silly elements" Etc lol..) is still quite interesting & I found it very humerous at times.

It's a fast paced action game, so if you don't like games which require pretty decent reaction times I wouldn't reccomend this at all. It has some interesting character building elements, such as obtaining new weapons (of which, there are loads.) and increasing your armour capabilities.

39 Hours in, still haven't completed the main missions with a friend online on difficulty setting hard. We've hit a few walls, but it never feels like a drag, instead there's a great feeling of accomplishment when you clear a mission which at first felt so overwhelming! 

We're probably near completion, but there's still alot to do. Use different classes, find new weapons, do it all again on harder difficulties Etc..

My only faults I've found so far:

I did have to tinker around with display settings as I seemed to be getting some horrible FPS drops. I found making sure that G-Sync is turned off for it is a must. (There is alot of infomation on steam forums to help out wih getting the right settings to fix issues though)

There seems to be no way to do a PvP battle unless offline on splitscreen? I could be wrong though. Shame because I would love to destroy my friend in a map created purely for PvP with one of the many crazy weapons :P 

 9/10. Looking forward to getting the DLC's :)!

35328149.review:
Start with the crazy guns, irreverent humor, stylish characters, and shoot-and-loot gameplay of the Borderlands series.

Add the massive waves of enemies, and the work together or die co-op of the Left 4 Dead series.  

Add the cheesy, corny, so-bad-it's-good aesthetics and storytelling of B-grade, giant monster and alien invasion movies.  

Put it all together and this game is what you get.  

This game is fun, but it does have some major flaws.  

Pretty much every single game mechanic feels like it would have benefitted from more work, further playtesting, more bug fixing, and better balancing.  Sometimes that gives the game a quirky charm in the same way that the low budget movies that inspired it are undeniably entertaining.  Sometimes it's just frustrating.  

It's a console port, so there's not a lot of configuration options for video or controls.   Has some graphics issues with newer computers.  Workarounds are in the forums.  

Small player base.  Not very many open multiplayer games at any time.  Even less that are willing to welcome a new player. Lots of complaints about cheaters messing up people's progression by hacking loot drops.

Overall, it's a good game that could have been more polished and less repetetive, but no other shooter I've played captures the same feel of massive gun battles that cover entire sprawling areas.

34912598.review:
[h1]The premise is cheesy. The dialog is hammy. But ham and cheese has never tasted this good![/h1]

[h1]Before we continue, let's get the negatives out of the way so we can focus on talking about how awesome EDF is.[/h1]
The base price can seem a bit steep given the game's age, and the highest discount you'll ever find is 40% off. Yes, it's a console port. That means enduring some things such as a clunky menu interface and unmappable, hardcoded keybinds. Increasing your arsenal and max health isn't just tedious, it's a requirement for the higher difficulties. There's talk of a cheater problem in public lobbies, and creating a private online game requires you to invite your friends through the [i]chat shortcuts window[/i], of all things. I don't believe you can invite anyone mid-mission, either. Sometimes there will be so many enemies or explosions on-screen that your framerate will take a very noticeable hit even on a good computer. I don't think there's a borderless windowed mode, if that matters to you. Oh, and the game can't even be launched if you're on a version of Windows older than 7.

Now then, if you can get past all of that, you may very well find yourself putting countless hours into this game.

[h1]What is EDF?[/h1]
It's a game where you save the world (even if that means leveling a city block) from hordes of giant insects, alien robots and spacecrafts, and several other deadly foes. It's like Starship Troopers but without the gritty satire, leaving it more goofy and colorful. You have to hope that the bad voice acting is intentional. Some levels are reminiscent of the finale of every early Power Rangers episode, fighting gargantuan monsters with robots included. If you enjoy watching corny movies from the 70's and 80's because you feel that's part of their charm, you might enjoy EDF. The game doesn't take itself seriously, so why should you? And how many games can you name that let you sing inspiring military marching music alongside your comrades?

On the surface EDF looks like some weird homage to the somewhat obscure N64 title [i]Body Harvest[/i]. You utilize a variety of weapons and vehicles to fight off large alien bugs, saving screaming citizens from being eaten. That's about where the similarities end, however. The game is mission-based and consists of 89 levels (+9 more online) distributed over only 16 maps, but the developers did a good job at spreading them out in ways that you don't grow tired of the same maps quickly. The weapon variety is huge and each of the four classes plays quite differently. Even if you're not a fan of relatively silly games, EDF still offers plenty of gunplay for those who simply enjoy blowing stuff up. The multiplayer especially is an absolute blast with friends. At first I disliked that online play limited your max health and weapon level based on difficulty and mission progress, but later I began to appreciate the forced challenge that makes multiplayer so special.

[h1]Finally, I'd like to talk about the story.[/h1]
You might be thinking that the story of a game which takes a B-movie approach wouldn't be particularly good. And... you'd be right. The story itself isn't anything special. But it's because of that that it's so easy to overlook the [b]way[/b] they tell the story, the little things almost behind the scenes. That, I feel, is something worth discussing. Don't worry; I'll try to keep this relatively spoiler-free regardless.

First off there's a couple of things pointed out to me by the [url=https://www.youtube.com/SoberDwarfShow]SoberDwarf[/url]. During a couple of different missions, the navy, artillery crews, and air support have to retreat for one reason or another. Players of the Air Raider class might take issue with these parts of the game, because it means that they are temporarily unable to call in air strikes or request vehicles, making the class quite handicapped for a while. The support teams eventually return to help, but for that duration, the story of the war has a direct impact on the player, which isn't something all that common in video games, let alone ones of similar tone to EDF.

Another bit of storytelling is found within the game's inventory screen. Never would have guessed that one, huh? Every weapon has a description below its stats, usually detailing not only its usage to the player but also its role to the military as well. Yes, someone had to type up stuff for over 800 weapons. Gag weapons notwithstanding, you may come across weapons that are useless or otherwise outright terrible. In most cases, these are prototypes, some failures and some early in development. It is here that you see a bit of behind-the-scenes details involving the EDF's Research & Development, which gives the game's military a bit of authenticity. That authenticity lends toward immersion, which is something I always approve of in a game.

Lastly, I want to address something else quite unique to EDF's story. Initially the game starts off as a sort of power fantasy. You get to destroy bugs and other aliens and be the hero. About halfway through the game, however, the game undergoes a shift in theme. Everything still plays the same, but it's like its genre or sub-genre has changed. I would argue that the game later becomes a sort of horror game. I'm not talking about your typical horror of gore or jump scares, but one of an older style more akin to early 1900's radio drama. Don't get me wrong, the Genocide Guns witnessed fairly early in the game would be legitimately terrifying in real life. But what the game does closer to the end is instill a grim reality. No matter how hard you try, no matter the valiant struggle, humanity itself may very well be coming to an end. That feeling of powerlessness portrayed through the story's climax is a direct contradiction to the power fantasy established in the beginning. I believe you'll be hard-pressed to find another game that sort of changes its genre the more you play it. Whether or not this a deliberate portrayal, I think it was worth pointing out.

34892918.review: I usually don't care for extreme Japanese stereotypes, or really just anything Japanese. But this beautiful creation of a game. It is just so much fun to see what it would be like if we threw out the Geneva Conventions for the military and tested it on giant insects. But there are some serious problems with this game, one of them being the grind for better weapons, as you progress through a level you will find crates dropped by fallen foes, green is weapons, red is armor, and white and yellow is health. When you complete a leven with the crates you collected they will give you a random selction of weapons, but the problem is when you start to build up the armory, you will start getting duplicates, so you will have to go back and get them over again and pray that you don't get more dupes. Another problem is the fact of in multiplayer, weapons get levels, and you can only use certain guns on a certain difficulty, which isn't fun when you want to use a minigun but don't want to get murdered by a swarm. Do get it though, worth every penny.

Это игра, которой нужно дать шанс. Нужно дать ей пару часов, чтобы она показала, что ОНА такое, что она может предложить. И спустя эти пару часов, понимаешь, что она не похожа ни на что. Она - это ШЕДЕВР, в котором есть своя атмосфера. Свой геймплей. 

И вот, спустя 100+ часов, слова E.D.F. перестают быть просто аббревиатурой названия. В них появляется  свой особый смысл, связанным с воспоминаниями об эпичных и, скорее всего забавных моментах, с которыми игроку предстоит в данной игре встретиться. 

Однако полностью раскрыть себя она может только в онлайне, желательно конечно с друзьями. Поэтому, если у вас есть 1-3 друзей с чувством юмора и желанием провести много веселых вечеров, то берите и дайте ей шанс. Она превзойдет ваши ожидания.

34285127.review:
I dont even know where to start! This game is possibly my top pick for best coop game of all time simply because its got everything a fun coop game should have and then some

*PROS*

-4 Playable Classes: theyre completely different playstyles with their own different gear and gimmicks. They even vary when everyone is the same class

-Weapons: literally hundreds of weapons, ive put countless hours into this game and im not even at 10% collected. Some are great and some are jokes

-Scale: seriously the game is gigantic, huge swarms of hundreds of enemies and colossal monsters and machines that reach the sky in size. You fight across entire cities with destructible buildings and structures

-Mission based fun: the whole game is split into individual encounters that, even if some are the same objective, the game is always introducing new enemies and challenges as you progress to keep it fresh

-Replayability. There's so much content that itll take forever just to beat the game on Normal, but theres also 3 difficulties higher that increase the HP and damage of enemies as well as new varients that dont appear in lower difficulties. With 90+ missions NOT including the 2 DLC mission packs, you will be playing for a long time (Vanilla game +DLC is about 150 missions!)

-English Dub/Script: its just beyond entertaining. The whole game has this B-movie Starship Troopers dialogue and the script is just laughably dumb on purpose. The original japanese sounds good, but i think its conveyed better in english because the corny aspect is on point

*CONS*

-Menu Controls: At first, the menu will confuse you if you use a gamepad (which i think is the best way to play) because the joystick controls the selected menu buttons (new game, load, options, etc) and the d-pad pulls up new windows (invite friends and view invites is in here) It isnt so bad once you learn it but early on i had no idea what was up with the menu

-Performance: if you dont have a good graphics card or play on a laptop this game is going to drop in frame rate or even crash. Theres a LOT of enemies on screen and a LOT of explosions with many lighting effects going off at once. I used to play on a laptop and i guaranteed would crash in tunnel levels as a fair warning.

Overall EDF 4.1 ends up being a great pick up and play coop experience. Theres so much chaos and shenanigans that id be impressed if you could play this without laughing with your friends, cannot recommend enough 10/10 looking forward to EDF 5 ^^

34282988.review:
It's hilarious fun.

Four different classes, each with their own advantages and disadvantages.

Ranger - Standard Soldier type.  Assault Rifles, Shotguns, Sniper Rifles, Rockets, Missiles, Grenades.  Some special weapons like acid guns and flamethrowers, as well as a heal gun.  Tough, decent damage, can roll through a lot of things.  Can also drive vehicles that are called in by the Air Raider.  Very 'average' playstayle.

Wing Diver - All weapons use energy, which also is used by the jetpack.  Fastest unit if you get the hang of it's movement, but lightest armored.  Weapons all do decent damage, which types include: Rapiers (short ranged beam spam), Lances (Short Range, high damage laser blast), Lasers Rifles (Mid Range, continual damage.  Comes in various types, including a chainsaw), Thunder Bows (Lighting Gun.  Mid Range, decent damage.  Penetrates through enemies), Energy Snipers (Comes in Thunder Snipers and Laser Snipers.  Thunder shoots a long range blast of lightning.  Lasers emit a constant beam, but are a lot less damaging 'per hit'), Energy Projectiles (Affected by Gravity, decent damage... honestly never used em), Plasma Launchers and Grenades (High Energy drain, big boom), Mind Guided projectiles (From the small, fast Mirage, to the slower Geist and up.  Lock on and keep firing).  Also a collection of special weapons, dealing odd effects.

Air Raider - Take the Ranger, but can't roll through things as well.  A support class.  Uses Limpet Guns (Attaches to what it hits, secondary sets em off.  Comes in regular HE and 'Frag' Splendor, with various types of launchers), various bombs, turrets, buffing stations, defensive walls, ect.   Biggest things are 1: he also can use a Guide Kit, either Laser or Beacon that the Fencer needs for locking onto with some of his biggest missiles.  2: Air Raids.  In the form of bombing runs, artillery, satelite lasers, cruise missiles, ect.  He also gets to choose a vehicle he can call in, from tanks to mechs to helicopters.  The vehicles and Air Raids require 'points' to recharge (or some big ones, charge first) before you can use them again.  Gain points by defeating enemies.

Fencer - Slowest unit (unless you get Dash Canceling down), but the highest armor and has some of the biggest guns.  From giant swords and shields to miniguns and light tank cannons.  Even various missiles (with the biggest requiring a helping Air Raider taking a Guide Kit).  Harder entry than the Air Raider or Ranger, but worth the effort if you keep it up.

Then it's simple, you follow the song.

To Save our Mother Earth from any Alien Attack.
From Vicious Giant Insects who have once again come back.
We'll Unleash all our Forces, we won't cut them any Slack.
The EDF Deploys!

EDF!

34113522.review:
I don't want to do a long post, so here's the sum-up: 

Some people complain about the game freezing even though they meet spec standards. Mine is pretty solid in terms of specs and I've had no issues ever, even when I torrented this game. 

Heavy farming and repetition. If you can't play something similar to Dynasty Warriors or Diablo 3, this won't be the game for you. 

Some complain about the UI. I can't get behind it. It's super minimal. Radar, ammo, health. Basic and simple. Ammo is infiinte in general, but you have "magazines" that require reloading. So, be aware of that. 

4 classes, wide variety of weapon pairing and combat styles on the basis of gear, wild enemy experiences, a wonderful satire of the alien genre. 

My review was in the place of a recorded 11.8 hours, but trust I've played for over a hundred. I torrented this to ensure that I liked the game before I bought it. Hate me for torrenting.

34097842.review:
This game is basically someone in japan getting stock 3D models of insects, military gear and a license for the havoc physics engine. And some dope, presumeably. For some reason, this mixture works.

Multiplayer is what this game is about. Community is really nice, somewhat chaotic.  However, this game really has the worst looking game lobby, ever.  No kidding. If the game would create an excel spreadsheet with clickable links everytime you click "refresh" it would be better. Hopefully, the developer looks at the code of TA spring or FA forever as inspiration for future games - unless the dope gets in the way, but there is always hope.

Else, this game -obviously- has some issues, check the community guides here for some workarounds. Note that being not balanced is not considered an issue, of course.

Also, if you want to have fun - don't watch youtube movies about this game. The mechanics can be learned playing an hour or so with your friends on normal/easy - and then you can discover by yourself.
