33988830.review:
From my own personal experience Earth Defense Force 4.1 is great fun to be had if you invite some friends over for some couch co-op. Don’t purchase this game if you expect something that falls into normal game categories, unless those categories have a entry for shooting buick sized spiders with a mecha. Honestly after completing the entire game and the DLC missions and I’m still trying to figure out if the game designers wanted you to take the game seriously, or just laugh at the comical noises a character makes while being eaten by a giant ant. Either way, I enjoyed every second of the game. Now the game does have an online 4 player co-op option for those who are interested though I personally cannot comment on it because like I mentioned before I just invited some friends over to play. 

In summary this is a third person shooter with 4 classes to choose from each with specific loadouts and you fight giant bugs and robots. Sound ridiculous? It really is, but it’s a lot of fun. Go in with no expectation and you will leave entertained. 

The only real con in my opinion is the current steam sale price for the main game ($50). Personally I found it was money well spent, however to others the current sales price is pretty much the purchase of AAA title. So if you are on the fence about purchasing this game find out whether you have a friend to invite over to play with, or some friends that want to play through the main game with you online.

33962116.review:
HIghly recommended zone-out and shoot all the bad things game. Everyone that i've played it with can pick it up and understand it within moments and have a blast. 

Pros:
- Great two player couch co-op. 
-Destructable, large, open, and great-looking enviornments
- Mindless kill-large-swarms-with-crazy-weapons gameplay reminescent of serious sam but with more giant insects. 
- Simple to learn
- Has a charming B-movie feel that doesnt take itself too seriously.
- Lots of fun guns LAZER CHAINSAW!!! Full auto rocket launchers! Mechs! 
- Tons of levels with a wide variety of difficulty levels

Cons:
- Can only take two guns into battle. With having so many guns this makes it not only a pain to figure out what each one does but also makes you constantly exiting and restarting levels trying to find the one for the task at hand. 
-The armor pickups (basically health) only apply to the class that picked them up. This makes farming necessary if you want to bring other classes to be able to survive harder difficulties & levels. Armor should be shared among classes.
 -With a crazy amount of weapons and levels for those weapons, they should drop more frequently. What you'll get i srandom and there is a huge range for the levels of weapon that drop that you will need to farm alot and get used to having 12 weapons drop and only 1 at a level you would use (typically with a draw back that you wouldnt want to use) and getting alot of awesome weapons but at a much lower level. 
- Fencer class is awesome in theory but impractical in use. 
-Ranger depends on getting good vehicles, meaning a ton of repetative two player farming for a chance at getting something useful.

33690652.review: Possibly the greatest game series of all time, and it deserves way more publicity than it gets. Most AAA developers would probably focus their efforts on general polish, idiot-proofing everything, and crafting a balanced, finely engineered, and extremely bland experience. These guys have their priorities straight: hundreds of weapons, swarms of enemies, and complete mayhem. Many of the weapons are unusably bad, but taking a new gun into a fight and discovering it only shoots sideways is part of the fun. And despite all the chaos and laughs, skill and strategy really count. You will sometimes find a map is absurdly difficult until you coordinate with your teammates and change tactics. This is as good as co-op gets.

33645551.review:
Can't recommend at $50 but got it on sale and I'm pretty happy with it.
Haven't checked out any of the DLC content yet.
[list]
The Good:
 [*] Purely co-op fun with massive battles
 [*] Quite a few weapons to unlock between 4 classes (though assests get reused)
 [*] Can be very challenging
 [*] Refreshing art style for someone that plays a lot of gloomy, realistic games
 [*] Friendly fire is fair (on low difficulty)
 [*] Pregenerated text responses are hilarious
  AI allies will respond to some of them and even sing the EDF Theme with you.

The Bad:
 [*] Lack of story including an actual resolution
 [*] Console port menus (No cursor, drag mouse to scroll)
 [*] Capped at 60 FPS 
 [*] Strange movement-balance between classes 
 [*] Falling into water is not handled well by any of four playable classes
 [*] More communication lines should have voice acting (Wing Divers especially)
 [*] In some levels enemies just spawn out of thin air
 [*] Soldiers saying vague things like "You remember that one place? This reminds me of that."
 [*] Lacking in customization  and could benefit from more RPG elements

The Ugly:
 [*] Looting is boring. Armor grind is meticulous.
 [*] No workshop or mods for such a simple game is ridiculous
 [*] Open mic only; Most games have chat turned off entirely which is the only other option and includes text as well as voice.
 [*] Poor game browser and PUG finding.
[/list]

33618528.review:
This is basically Starship Troopers on an acid trip. In Tokyo. Through campaigns in which it's perfectly acceptable to level six city blocks just to wipe out a giant spider, or cleave your way through 200 huge insects with a laser chainsaw.

Don't overthink it, don't worry about gear, just have fun. Weapons drop like candy, and before you know it you'll be toting a plasma cannon that can take down a small moon, and a sidearm that looks like the ultimate Gradius power-up on steroids. And it's not all giant bugs -- as you progress you'll battle giant Japanese robots, huge quadripedal bots that look like anime versions of AT-ATs, and dragons. Yes, dragons.

Through it all, you'll hear the patriotic cheers of your fellow EDF soldiers, their fight songs, and their awed exclamations every time EDF's majestic air force swings around for another carpet-bombing run. EDF!! EDF!! EDF!!

33591469.review:
For what its worth I've never felt the need to write a review... until I was shockingly snapped up in the mandibles of a giant red ant for the first time, being gnawed alive, while covered in the painful stinging webs of jumping spiders and my platoon rallying around me and getting trapped in the bukkake of horror as well, their hopelessly valiant warcries for their fallen AI comrades haunting the comms feed while being torn to shreds. My guard post wasn't broadcasting anymore and my gruelling 20-minute battle was coming to a very pitiful end due to my screwup where my Vegalta D calldown landed on a skyscraper roof. 

Cycling through my unreloaded weapons while close to death, I found the only thing I had that I could use... a Whale 150mm close air support designator. I was being thrashed about so wildly my aimpoint went wild, and it settled somewhere near the face of a gleefully mocking spider that was trying to get close.

It was my first time using it too, three faint 'bleeps!' that seemed to last an eternity and then I see this HUGE f***off green tracer sail in from above the clouds, shearing right through ITS FUCKING GLEEFUL FACE AND SLAMMING INTO THE SPINE OF THE CHITIN COVERED FUCK THAT HAD ME, DETONATING and taking out the intersection and a skyscraper with it and flinging me into a collapsing wall, with 8hp left to spare!!! My camera was afixed on my ragdoll-limp body, as the debris and mountain of corpses pile atop me. I was stuck!!! How amazingly shit was this mission going to become?! I was cackling so hard at that point at the insanity of the moment, the botched mission didn't seem to matter, that was a single moment in the game that won me over entirely. But then I realised all the red blips on the radar were gone. I had survived, and the battle was won. And the radio chimed grimly, 'to all ground forces, you are not alone".  

10/10 would deploy again. /T=T EDF EDF EDF

(PS: I have only experienced this level of rare, thematically beautiful and creatively tactical sandbox insanity with Tribes 1/2 or Cortex Command!)

33567126.review: 虽然游戏还可以，但是并不想给好评，首先这游戏布娃娃系统设定特别的“好”你打死了那些恶心的怪物以后尸体不会马上消失，还有尸体碰撞设定，这时候神奇的事情发生了，你要是用的爆炸属性武器，你来尸体上打一枪你会发现你自己飞了，对，没错，你就因为这脑残的布娃娃系统被自己的武器误伤了，伤害还不低，后期一片一片的尸体死亡后就是不消失，估摸着就是制作人拿来恶心玩家的，虽然职业有四个，说白了没什么平衡，突击兵还均衡，机动性凑合，武器基本上就是RPG 毕竟伤害高射程远，羽翼这东西就是脆，但是对单体伤害挺高，毕竟她的狙击类武器伤害挺高，92级的一把枪是5万*3的伤害，唯一缺点就是子弹跟能量是一起的，换句话说就是你飞天都是消耗的备弹，回复速度也不算多快，至于空袭兵，说真的，低难度下，是亲儿子，高难度下召唤的载具被摸一下就三分之一血下去了，摩托车驾驶手感感人，飞机坦克倒是能凑合开，就是载具的机枪那个手感是真的垃圾当然等级高了能召唤泰坦支援，虽然跑的慢，但是有种环太平洋的画风，至于重甲，有大神说重甲才是唯一能玩的，不过前期重甲是真的废，虽然你有伤害不低的手持火炮，但是机动性差的要死，火炮很多都是特么个抛物线，打出去弹道就下垂，手持机枪的手感更别提了，恶心的想吐，看的挺厉害能拿四个武器，虽然有盾反，但是不会用，拿近战武器空格变成冲刺，拿火炮啥的就变成喷气背包，别多想，连放不起来的，冲刺是冲一次停一下才可以继续，至于喷气。。。。。那个冷却时间我都想骂制作人。本体有98章，但是基本上没什么剧情，纯是文字介绍大概意思就是外星人各种入侵地球也没交代为啥入侵，玩多了倒是谁都学会了个EDF，不过唱的EDF歌挺好听的还魔性。至于其他设定，就是各种跑图捡箱子，绿色箱子是武器箱，红色的是胜利结束后结算的生命值，白色小箱子跟白黄大箱子都是游戏内及时回复血量用的，顺便说一句这游戏光捡箱子能捡的烦死你，多人模式下是各种外国佬，找个玩PC的国人是难的要死，包括相关的QQ群，贴吧，公共组一类的，再说武器设定，有很多武器都是一次性的，看的宣传说的武器种类多，其实到最后你用的就那么几个固定的种类刷，其他的什么激光笔，奶棒枪，还有个奇葩的从两个方向发射的枪，这些玩意设计出来我估摸着就是拿来凑数的，别有什么自称大神的说练的多了就能瞄准好了，你再习惯能有用单发或者连发的枪好用？血量是刷红箱子刷上去的PC的特殊原因，这游戏有挂，至于汉化用游侠的就行，3DM的还不如没有。

Also erst hatte ich ja echt die Befürchtung, dass dieses Spiel auf Grund der Einfachheit schnell an Reiz verliert, aber tatsächlich wurde ich übberascht. So ca. ab der 17. Mission man auf Normal schon schnell sterben kann, was ich finde für einen guten Schwierigkeitsanstieg auch innerhalb der einzelnen Schwierigkeitsstufen spricht. Stumpfes farmen reicht wirklich nicht aus um die späteren Missionen und höheren Schwierigkeitsgrade zu meistern. Gefragt sind da Skills, Teamwork, taktisches Geschick und gut geplante Vorbereitung. Das hätte ich von so einem Titel wirklich nicht erwartet. Gepaart mit der großen Auswahl an Waffen und den verschiedenen Einsatzmöglichkeiten der einzelnen Klassen ist dieses Spiel (auch wenn es echt nicht so aussehen mag) sein Geld wirklich wert. Sollte man sich wenigstens für den nächsten Steam Sale auf die Wunschliste packen.

33309505.review:
Игра вызывает неистовый прилив адреналина и восторг от происходящего. Так и хочется описать несколько ситуаций, которые игра вывалит на игрока, но я решил оценить игру без этого.
Данная игра - шутер от третьего лица при игре за один из 4х принципиально разных класов. Настолько разных, что огнестрельное оружие есть только у 2х из них, третья большую часть времени находится в полёте, а последний закидывает защищаемый город арт абстрелами и вызывает технику и роботов, значительно упрощающую некоторые задачи (бить гадзиллу лучше всего сидя в шагающей крепости, А лазить по тоннелям в паукороботе). Боеприпасы у ручного оружия за редким исключением бесконечные, только успевай перезаряжать.
В качестве врагов мы имеем разнообразнейшую живность и роботов. Как то гиганских муравьёв, отличающихся друг от друга не только по цвету, пауков двух основных видов, пчел, плюющих шипами. Драконов, которые не смотря на съхожий вид, ведут себя сильно по разному и так же имеют разные параметры опять же по цвету и размеру. Летающих дронов 3 вида. ОБЧР(несколько видов), боевые триножники, летающие тарелки (несколько видов), барьерные шагоходы, четырёхногая шагающая крепость, гадзиллы и разнообразных боссов.
В качестве арен несколько больших карт, которые придётся начинать с разных сторон, что сделает их настолько разными, что первое время вы не сможете понять, что две миссии подряд были на одной и той же карте. Строения красиво ломаются от взрывов настолько, что из города можно оставить только воспоминания.
Из монстров выпадает лут четырёх видов, два из которых - аптечки, один - случайное оружие и последний - просто красные коробки. Чем больше вы их поднимите, тем больше перманентно у данного персонажа будет хп.
Оружие. Даже перечислять не буду, тут просто огромное колимчество всякого рода вооружиения. Часто совремшенно по-разному работает, но главное тут то, что оно РАБОТАЕТ. То есть ракеты с самонаведением, дробовики, лазеры, мартиры, гранаты, топоры для экзоскелетьного персонажа, танки с рельсовыми пушками, всё это можно использовать в игре, что-то более широко, а что-то весьма нишево, но в разхных ситуациях может пригодиться то ,что не считаешь нужным в принципе.
Игровые ситуации - врагов больше, чем вас, других игроков и всех неписей. Всегда. Или это будет сцена с расстрелом подбегающих насекомых, или паника при атаке драконов всверху, тоннелтьные засчистки, или битвы с боссами, игра предлогает намного больше игровых ситуаций, чем большая часть игр подобного и смежных жанров. И не одна битва не будет требовать QTE, или искуственно ограничивать вас. Игра предоставляет нам 5 уровней сложности, спокойн опереключаемых перед битвой, чем выше этап и больше сложность, тем лучше будет лут и приятней победа. 
Недостатки, ибо без них никуда. Интерфейс требует привыкания, хотя разобравшись весьма удобный. Русский язык отсутствует, а значит базовые параметры оружия и, кому интересно - сюжет, придется воспринимать на инглише. Или даже японском. Графоний простой, изначально приставочный, что заметно. Часто не понятно, чем лучше то или иное оружие, пока его испытаешь в битве. Для любителей получать все аччивки всё печально. Пройти все этапы на харде(а это третья сложность) уже само по себе проблематично, ибо пройти все миссии на максимальной сложности за все классы - это временами немыслимый мазохизм для отчаянных задротов. ЧТобы понимать разницу в сложности - на нормале(2я сложность) у монстра может быть 200хп, а в том же этапе на инфёрно - раз в двадцать больше, этак 3,5 - 4,5 тысячь. И урона примерно так же. Ещё и скорость больше. И количество. А играя в группе враги имеют ещё больше жизней и урона в зависимости от количества игроков. Что в общем плюс, но не для получения аччивок.
Играть или нет? Да, однозначно. Море удовольствия и веселья вы получите в куда как большем объёме, чем от многих ААА игр.
10 из 10. Скорей всего, эта игра даст вам намного больше того, что вы от неё ожидали, если вы рискнёте её попробовать.

33261694.review:
This is one of the funnest games I've ever played and I love the series. So why not recommend it you say? Because it's terribly optimized and even if you have a system well over the recommended specs there is no guarantee that the game won't crash. Some levels you may have no issues with then others will crash a few seconds into the mission. While others it may be well into the mission before it crashes for no apperent reason.

Overall there was only two levels (out of 89) which I couldn't beat because of crashes and had to play it on a lower end extra computer (which seemed to play it better but yay cloud saves). I am enjoying it but semi regular crashes are irritating.

If you enjoy this series then it may be worth it for you if you're willing to risk not being able to refund it if the crashes happen after playing for 2 hours, which is likely, then go for it. Otherwise be cautious and know that you are taking a risk.

Pros-
Amazing and fun game and the best version of series.

Cons-
Poorly optimized and will likely crash often if you lose the dice roll of it not liking your computer

Shit for graphics options

33249982.review:
Both amazing and the biggest piece of crap game. It's a terrible port that makes the UI terrible. You change settings by sliding mouse left and right and you scroll through options by moving mouse up and down. The UI is frankly really ugly and the game is only okay looking. 

With all that said though, it's amazing to play. It really is fun. I assume I enjoy it for similar reasons to enjoying terribly made movies. There is always something absurd happening. Overall, it is enjoyable and rewarding to play. The difficult modes are actually engaging. If you like games like helldivers, you'll like this style of gameplay, despite this being a third person shooter. 

Flight mechanics are really satisfying and the ability to access high points without hitting a skybox is really enjoyable. I'd definitely recommend this game when it is on sale.

EDF 4.1 is hard to desrcibe as anything other than bombastic. This game provides you with literally hundreds of different options for blasting, burning, smashing, sniping, slicing and otherwise destroying hordes of enemies. At any time you may have more than 100 foes onscreen, each one individually is not striking with its visual detailing but the sheer numbers keep you too busy to care. Enemies include a fair number of different types, introduced over the course of the campaign, though you will kill a hell of a lot of ants. Fun to play solo, way more fun to play as a group.

Gigantische Insekten und Ausserirdische Kampfmaschinen greifen die Bewohner der Erde an.Mitten in den Morgenstunden in ihren Städten erscheinen sie und töten alles was sich bewegt.Das Militär ist an ihren Grenzen und kann die Menschheit nicht mehr verteidigen.Doch da am Horizont erscheint Hoffnung.Vier Kommandoeinheiten der EDF bekommen die Freigabe das Militär zu übernehmen und in den Kampf zu führen.

Ranger - Special Marinesoldat mit Multiraketenwerfer und Schnellfeuerwaffen 
Wingdiver - Scouteinheit mit Experimental Waffen(Plasma/Electro/Projektile)/Flugfähig mit Wing Jetpack
Airaider - Befehligt von Luftschläge bis Wolkenkratzer hohe Kampfmaschinen vollgepackt mit Feuerkraft aller Art
Fencer - Special Marine in einem Kampfanzug schwer wie ein Pkw mit schweren Lafetten,Multi Lockon Raketenwerfer,Panzerbrechende Hochgeschwindigkeitsmunitions,Geschütze die man auch auf Panzerfahrzeugen wieder findet.

33139703.review:
■2017/07/03現在のレビューとなります。

まず最初に私自身、本シリーズでの地球防衛を行うのは今作が初めてです。
（別メーカー製のゲームでは沢山地球や銀河を防衛はしてますが・・・。）

ルールはとても明解でミッション中に蔓延る人類以外を排除すれば概ねクリアです。
時と場合によっては人類を故意に排除する時もありますが。

また、プレイヤー側は4兵科選べそれぞれ特色がある上装備の性能もかなり違います。
ミッション内容によって武器を変更したり、兵科をそもそも変えたりと戦略性があると思います。
当然、装備次第ではミッションクリアが出来ないパターンもありますが、
その辺はサクッと撤退して装備を切り替えたり出来るのであまり問題は無いと思います。

難易度も豊富で、Easy、Normal、Hard、Hardest、Infernoとなり。
敵の耐久力や攻撃力、出現構成やドロップ装備と違いがでます。
難易度によって戦略が大きく変わったりするのでその辺はとてもプレイしていて楽しいです。

また、オンラインとオフラインでもある程度の補正が変わったり、
ミッションがいくつかオンラインだと多かったりします。
当然ソロでオンラインミッションを受ける事も出来るのでご安心を。
（※実績に関しては、一部ソロでは取れないのがあります）

プレイ開始からNormalをオフラインでクリアするまでは物語や操作方法等を勉強しつつ
ゲームの大筋を理解し比較的単純なアクションゲームと感じましたが、
難易度を上げたりオンラインプレイを始めて本来の敵が蟲やロボではなくプレイヤー自身のライフ（Armour）
であること良く理解しました。

よっぽどこのゲームを研究や修行を行っていない限り、通常プレイで高難度を開始するには
それ相応のArmourを稼いでおく必要があります。
当然難易度に見合った装備もある程度回収しておく必要もありますが、
装備はある程度性能差でなんとかなる時も多くそこまで辛い事に陥る前にはある程度の装備が手に入りましたが
Armourに関しては1箱辺りの増加量が固定（兵科毎）で難易度でボーナス等々はありません。

友達と歯応えのある難易度を協力プレイするにも概ねワンパンで死ぬArmour値では物量攻めの本作では話にならず、
２～３発は耐えれるArmour値を揃えるには膨大な時間を放置プレイする程の効率が求められたり、
そもそも自分だけArmourを稼いでも周りが同じ時間をArmour稼ぎに時間を割くか？という所になります。

折角の物量を捌くアクションゲームとしての地位を確立しているのに、
Armour稼ぎの概念が本ゲームのエンドコンテンツの様な立ち位置の一つとなっているのは残念です。
ただ、上記の不満点を踏まえた上でも本ゲームはアクションゲームとしてはとても面白くおすすめ出来ます。

33064269.review:
If there was anything in my library that I could describe as pure, distilled GAME, Earth Defense Force 4.1 would be it. There's no deep narrative, no unskippable, poorly animated cutscenes from wannabe Hollywood producers, no extended tutorial that assumes you're a 80-year old grandmother who's never played a game in their life, not even a hamfisted political message. Just you, the rest of the Earth Defense Force, any friends you bring along, and a giant arsenal of weapons and vehicles against the alien menace. The story is barebones and the NPC chatter is a hilarious B-movie homage, what more do you need? You launch the game, load your save file, pick your loadout, and are in a mission shooting bugs all within 30 seconds.

Boy, are there missions. Over 100 (in multiplayer, a select few are skipped in singleplayer due to the way they were designed) missions to choose from, with even more available from the mission packs. Starting from the humble beginnings of mission 1 where you fight swarms of nothing but giant ants all the way to the depths of hell itself known as Mission Pack 2 where no amount of anime girls painted on the side of your tank will save you from a gruesome death, the game operates on a very steady difficulty curve. New enemies are introduced every few missions, just frequently enough to perpetually keep you on your toes. Thankfully, new weapons are also introduced at a similar pace, making sure that both your playstyle and the enemies to engage you always stay fresh. Unlocks are tied to the mission and difficulty level, so the further you progress the more cool toys you get to play with (and use to get that sweet, sweet revenge when you go back to an earlier mission that gave you trouble).

Speaking of difficulty settings, there are several. Easy, Normal, Hard, Very Hard, and Inferno, to be exact. Difficulty setting is more than just "challenge", it also serves as a psuedo-new game plus. Increasing the difficulty setting not only increases the raw power of the enemies, it also makes them more intelligent, more aggressive, and grants them access to more dangerous attacks. However, it also increases the armor limit and weapon level limit, allowing you to bring more firepower to match. Said limits also line up nicely for cyclical playthroughs of the game, so finishing on Normal will leave you equipped to immediately transition into Hard mode, and so on. Since the difficulty setting also influences weapon drops, this means that you'll continue to aquire more and more powerful weapons as you make the transition to higher difficulties, giving the game quite a bit of replay value.

As for the progression system, it's been the mainstay since the original Earth Defense Force on PS2, and is arguably one of the game's weaker points. Killing enemies can drop weapon boxes, armor boxes, and health boxes. Weapon boxes give you a random weapon of the appropriate strength for the mission for your current class, armor boxes permanently increase the maximum armor of your current class, and health boxes instantly heal a set percentage of your armor. This means you will spend quite a bit of time running around picking up the spoils of battle, and if that sounds annoying, it's because it can be. Some people enjoy it, some don't, it's really up to personal opinion. The weapons you recieve are also purely random, so you can spend many, many attempts at the same mission trying to get a weapon that just won't drop. This can either mean more replay value or more frustration, depending on your viewpoint.

There are four classes to choose from, each with completely different playstyles and weaponry. Rangers are the standard footsoldier. You get conventional weaponry ranging from assault rifles to rocket launchers, and a nifty dodge roll to boot. Ranger's biggest strength is their versatility; they always have a tool for the job, and can comfortably handle any situation. Wing Divers are a high mobility class armed with energy weapons, from beam rifles to laser javelins, they're all about moving fast and high with their jetpacks. Energy management is a must, because your weapons draw from the same power supply as your weapons. Wing Divers, in the hands of a skilled player, can zip around the battlefield at lightning speed, obliterating everything in their path, but one false move can leave you with empty weapons and no power to fly away, leading to an embearassing death. Air Raiders are the masters of support, and bring vehicles into the fray. Your only real offense (if you even bring one) is a sticky grenade launcher, but you have the power to call in bombing runs from the air force or artillery, call in pilotable vehicles (anything from a motorcycle to a giant mech and everything inbetween), and even support your teammates with healing, buffs, and deployable cover. Airstrikes and vehicle call-ins "reload" by earning points (generated by any enemy dying) however, so careless usage of your tools can leave you helpless. Finally, Fencers are heavy power-armored soldiers that bring weapons to match, and have the unique gimmick of being able to equip four weapons at once, two for each hand. Gatling guns, naval cannons, rocket pods, pilebunkers, giant axes, you name it they've got it. Typically lacking in mobility, certain weapons (mainly melee) allow you to do a boost dash; learning to cancel this dash (with melee attacks, shield parries, or even certain launchers later on) and chain them together allows you to move at breakneck speeds, dashing around like an angry hornet and blasting actual hornets. These four classes are so radically different that you basically have four different games to play, and in multiplayer they can work together in many interesting ways, (an Air Raider giving laser guidance to a Fencer with a long range artillery cannon, for example) which allows for a large variety of team combinations.

Whether you're looking for a simple game to blow off some steam in once in a while or something to really sink your teeth into and rack up a massive playtime, EDF 4.1 delivers. Tight, responsive controls (except for low-level Air Raider vehicles, they do get way better as you get stronger variants at least), the choice of KB/M or controller (unless you want to drive that damn minibike, holy hell) and very good optimization make a quality port. Only major quirks include a lack of mouse support for menus (instead you navigate with WASD, left click confirm, right click cancel) and a baffling design for the invite menu (you have to use the arrow keys to pull up the friend invite panel), as well with a very disappointing open mic (you can disable voice chat, but this also disables text chat, I recommend using an external VoIP program for communication). Overall, the port is extremely solid, which is something I don't get to say often. Special mention to the game's netcode which is the best I've ever seen. As a co-operative game, the devs made everything client-sided with a stellar focus on syncing to the host as much as possible. When a bug or two falls out of sync due to a ping spike or what have you, they quickly get back into position and due to the clientsided, well, everything, you'll never experience phantom damage or screwy hit detection. I frequently play with people on the other side of the planet and experience zero noticable lag whatsoever.

If jumping into a giant mech and punching a kaiju in the face is your idea of a good time, then Earth Defense Force 4.1 is definitely worth a try. Don't forget to spam the fight songs, the NPC soldiers will sing along with you.
[i]1-4 THE EDF DEPLOYS![/I]

33036483.review:
From what I've seen, it's not a bad game, but it's not that good either, I have paid 32 CAD and I feel like I have paid too much, for 20$ it would be worth it but since it is a 2015 game, 10$ would be the right price and just look at those DLCs.

Well, it sure is overrated, there are better games.

Here are some good points and some negative points.


Good:
It has a lot of content which you get during missions randomly, pretty cool idea.
Fighting giant creatures.


Neutral:
Graphics and textures are okay, it's a console game so don't except much.
Good optimization is rare these days, isn't? I've seen worse, that is why it is a neutral point, it's not that good but it could be worse.

Really, but really bad user interface.
Barely any options/settings.
No pistols, that would be cool in my opinion, sure, there would be the weak pistols at start but the stronger ones later such as the Desert Eagle, Smith & Wesson .500, Thompson Center Contender G2, some new created handguns just for this game, etc.
No melee weapons, I think it would have been a great idea to have one up to three (more is always cool) character(s) which can uses melee weapons and skills, kind of hack & slash against monsters.
You get pass through almost everything, jump onto a tank, your feet and some of your legs goes right through it.
You can't shoot civilians nor allies (except real humans).
It needs more vehicles and mechs.
It needs some kind of level editor, creating our own maps and missions,, so being able to create our own fights and all, that would be great.
It needs customization for the characters, weapons and armors.
It needs an in-game shop (no microtransactions stuff, just in-game currency) to buy the customization stuff and some unique weapons and outfits.
All right, it is pretty cool that there are 400 ants at the same time, but do they really need to all be at the same location? They're all getting through each other and all, not so so realistic, well, of course, you can't except some realism in this game but if some points were, that would be way better.


Just an idea that would be great but isn't so important, being able to play as the creatures against the EDF would be pretty neat.
Also, being able to play as Spider-man would be a great thing- Just joking about that part, that would be pretty neat though.

I'm leaving it a positive feedback because it is good, just not great nor revolutionary and there is no game like this, the closer you can get is the Lost Planet series.
I'd wait for a heavily discount/until the game is 10$ or less.

Ignore the other reviews, people are exaggerating, It seems that people doesn't need a lot these days to be impressed even though the overall low quality of the game.

7/10

32980464.review:
Complete and total titanic insect genocide brought to you by those weirdos who made Robot Alchemic Drive.

PROS:
- You kill bugs.
- You kill bugs with four different classes.
- You kill bugs with a smorgasbord of weapons, from simple rifles to WMDs.
- You kill bugs with a myriad of deployable vehicles, from simple tanks to vertical fortresses.
- You kill bugs across god-knows-where in over one hundred levels.
- You kill bugs in english or in japanese because people are picky like that.
- You kill bugs with random people online in a hundred more levels.
- You kill bugs with your friends.
- You kill bugs with your friends friends.
- You kill bugs with your friends enemies.
- You kill bugs with your enemies.
- You kill bugs.

CONS:
- Much like this blatent joke of a review, this game is very repetitive with only new enemies being the differences between levels.
- Very much an opinion but the loot collection system could be better, you have to scour the level for armor and weapons in the midst of the action because you have zero time after finishing a mission to do so.
- In regards to the last con, armor is artificially scaled to further push the tedious grind. Details below.
- Very apperent flaws with collision IE enemy spiders freely web you through several city blocks worth of scenery.
- A very very [i] very [/i] long term con, theres little to do after 100%ing the game aside from beating levels with all four classes on all five difficulties.
- All cosmetic dlc is locked onto a very low level vehicle/gun and is inevitably abandoned once better gear is obtained, this all should be a skin of some kind that can be carried forward IMHO.

It has come to my attention that this game is throttling armor collection in favor of a tedious, not enjoyable, and trainer teasing grind. What i mean is that one armor box does not equate to one armor point and the percentage gained differs from class.

Ranger 0.47
Wing Diver 0.23
Air Raider 0.46
Fencer 0.58

Fencers will have the easiest time bulking up while Wing Diver will have to collect 5 or 6 armor boxes to gain a single health point. It may be based off of movement speed because wing diver can fly and collect faster but it all sounds like a bunch of bull.

Doesn't really detract from my reccomendation, it's still a fun game to screw around in. The thing is always a decent price around the steam sales and its worth every penny if you got some pals to play it with you.

8/10, would squash bugs again.

32896811.review:
Think it looks borring? Play it, play it with friends. It's not. It's awesome sights, hilarious moments, and if you ever liked sci fi anime, sci fi cheese, or even just massive machines, tanks, missiles, cannons, there's just something here for anyone who's ever liked a machine that goes BOOM!

If for some reason you're having trouble with it, read the instruction manual in your library with the fun pokes of engrish spelling errors. Yes they are intensional.

Dare to re map your controls that work for you, and remember with the Fencers your controls are slightly different, but every single one of your weapons has a sub effect, often a form of jump jet manuver, jet dash, or zoom function pending on the weapon for that hand. Consider keeping one melee weapon for forward dashes. Jump jets and weapon swap to use jet dash is VERY functional for getting around.

This is a game great for meeting people, having fun with friends, vehicles, loads of weapons, go recruitment crazy with NPC's, it's just a lot of CO OP friendly fun with a TON of weapons to unlock and their functions are incredably varried. There's so much to try, and that's BEFORE you grab some of the DLC that has dropped along the way.

If there is even just ONE thing you think you would like in this game, you're gonna have fun once you get there. It's a step back into the Dreamcast kind of gaming era before everyone thought their games had to be top leveles of shaders and the likes to just look and be plain massivly fun.

It remembers what video games were meant to be. It naturally teaches you to play well with others when you don't even realize it, and you'll be a better gamer for it.

32819099.review:
Is Earth Defense Force 4.1 The Shadow of New Despair fun? Definitely! Is it a good port to PC from console? Nope!

The game functions perfectly well but there has been no care taken to adapt the interface or even flow of the game menus to use on a computer.

When you launch the game, it says to press a button to start. Depending on the button you press, it'll decide that you're using controller or mouse and keyboard. Naturally I clicked my mouse button and was told I was using mouse and keyboard.

After that I was temporarily at a loss of what to do next. I wasn't given a mouse cursor and my scroll wheel didn't change menu options. Instead it mapped my mouse movements of up and down to changing menu options. The rest of the game interface works the same way: left and right to change quantities in an option setting, left mouse button to select, right mouse button to go back.

In the actual game, things get better. Scroll wheel changes between active weapons, you can change key bindings for controls, etc. One criticism of the gameplay is that there's little visual or audio feedback for when a weapon is ready to fire again. I'm not talking about reloading, that's clear. Instead, I'm talking about the time between shots.

An aspect of the poor adaptation to PC does show up while playing. Say you're in the middle of playing single player and a friend comes online and wants to play multi-player. They can send you a Steam invite, which is great. When you accept the invitation is when things get funny. It exits you out of the single player game and takes you back to the start screen after preparing you for multiplayer. You then enter the game again through the starting procedure: press a key, choose profile, etc. Then it sends you to the multiplayer room.

Anyway, the game is fantastic fun, especially with friends (either 2 player local or 4 player online). There's stuff to unlock, the loot boxes are for the entire team. That way you don't have to worry about "ninja looting".

I know I talked a lot about the interface issues but really, you spend a lot more time in the game than you do in the menus :)

32818249.review:
# TLDR Start
If you like NGE (Neon Genesis Evangelion)
or
If you liked SHOGO (Shogo Mobile Armor Divison) 
This is the game for you!
# TLDR End
 


I was just about to start up the game again... 
((After a brief and somewhat unnecessary break from it (about an hour))
but then I thought that this creation actually deserves a review from me. 

First I thought; This game is awesome, I need to buy it. 
After I tried it I thought; what the hell, this is not what I expected, 
it even sucks a little...

But then after playing through few missions and getting the hang if it. 
I realized; It is fantastic... It does not suck. 
It pulls you in!

Its a "no brain game" 
you aim and shoot, 
nothing more. 

that is. 

Until you start searching for finesse and efficiency. 
That is when it starts to become, 
challenging! 

Imediately, 
you find yourself withdrawn in your study, 
seclued in tactical thinking...

Trying to find the perfect formula of:
How to embody the perfect Pesticide.
Pesticide incarnate. 

One starts to mix and match different gear, 
trying the missions on different difficulties, 
finding out where the limit goes and how to break it. 

I never thought this game would be so satisfying, 
challenging and rewarding at the same time. 

If you like NGE (Neon Genesis Evangelion)
or
If you liked SHOGO (Shogo Mobile Armor Divison) 
This is the game for you!


You might think that it ends here, but Oh no. 
there are Four different Classes out there to master. 
All with different gear. 

I just picked up this game
and I am not expecting to put it down in the near future. 

Final verdict: Get it. 
It is really wort the EPH*
*Expense Per Hour = Cost, divided by the amount of hours you played it 
(Just compare it to going to the cinema... Argh!) 


PROS: 
- Excellent experience and feeling from the different weapons. 
- Tons of weapons!
- 4 Classes.
- Lots of different difficulties.
- Replay value is Immense.

CONS:
Must not be used with GSYNC and fullscreen. 
This makes the game freeze periodically in menues and during gameplay.
However there is a solution to this issue. 

SOLUTION : 
- Go to Nvidia Control Panel 
- Manage 3D Settings. 
- Program Settings 
- Click "Add" 
- Select "EDF41.EXE" (Or browse to it) 
- in "Monitor Technology" select "Fixed Refresh" 
= No more lagging in game nor in inventory view, game runs flawlessly. 

Thanks for reading!

Now I will go and play :) 

With best regards
David

32745395.review:
This game is so stupid.

The voice acting is garbage, the dialogue is garbage ("The giant insects have been underground this whole time. Does this mean we've been living above them???"), The story is garbage.

But I love it. I love all of it. This game is so stupid and I love it.

Gameplay is a blast. Giving you four different soldier classes with tons of different weapon options to use to tackle missions gives a lot of replayability to the game. I've only played up to the 5th mission but from what I've played there's generally a ton of enemies on the field at any given time. The game is challenging but it doesn't feel unfairly so. If you support your team (even the dumb-as-bricks AI) you should be able to come through the mission no problem.

I haven't tried online gameplay just yet but I do so look forward to giving that a try.

I don't know if this game is worth the normal $50 price tag to me (I got my copy on sale for $30) but I don't doubt it will give fans of Starship Troopers or people that like mowing down scores of enemies a fun time.

32351962.review:
Oh god, where to start with this?

Let me just say that I love horde shooters. Alien Shooter 1 and 2 being my favorite, horde shooters are the ultimate boredom-killer for me. I love the mindless joy of slaughtering hundreds and hundreds of enemies, gunning them down like an 80's action hero on a caffine drip. I always thought AS would be the pinnacle of this rare genre for me. And then I discovered EDF.

Little old you, a soldier among many, are plopped in a massive destructable city crawling with the nightmare of all nightmares: giant freakin bugs! Spiders weaving deadly webs between buildings, swarms of house-sized ants crawling over the roads, massive wasps buzzing about... welcome to hell on Earth.

There's something incredibly satisfying about this game. Maybe it's the chance to squash the sum of all insectaphobic and arachnifobic fears. Maybe it's the insane array of weapons. Maybe it's the choice between being able to fly around and dispense high-tech death as the Wing Diver class, drive a huge array of vehicles and call in crazy supports as an Air Raider, become a walking tank yourself as a Fencer, or just be a brass-balled badass as a Ranger. Perhaps it's the way the game excells at making the player feel tiny and insignificant among the hordes of oversized creepy-crawlies. Or maybe it's the feeling of being a ruthless war god as you wreck buildings and slaughter alien menaces over decent-sized maps despite being the aformentioned itty-bitty human. 

There are, of course, downsides. The voice acting is hilariously bad. The missions feel roughly the same after a while (although the game does a decent job of throwing new things at you here and there to break that monotony). The level design is a bit limited but does the best it can with its limited resources. And of course it feels very, very much like the console port it is (although some people are into that sort of thing. Not judging!).

All in all, this game is well worth a look. Hours upon hours of endless bug-splattering, alien-swatting fun awaits the person adventurous enough to give this a try.

32024712.review:
EDF does not have a happy ending but if you try, it can have an honorable one.

Service in the Earth Defense Force is not for everyone. I enlisted in the Earth Defense Force as a Fencer out of four possible choices (and I'll never change). Each class has their own unique philosophy in approaching the extermination of giant insects and it's up to you to find what fits you best. Rangers are reasonably quick and well equipped to battle anything on even terms. Air Raiders deploy vehicles, equipment, and airstrikes to support the combat action. Wing Divers take flight and strike with devastating energy weapons. And finally the Fencer, heavily armored and heavily armed, looks to deal heavy blows with meaningful shots.

With there being four classes in mind this is where a bit of grinding slog comes into play. All four classes have a massive arsenal of weapons to unlock. Not all of these weapons are immediately useful direct upgrades but the variety, if you're willing to experiment at the cost of possibly being knocked unconscious, is a welcome change of pace from games where everything shoots the same bullets just at a slightly different rate.

The enemy ranges from basic ants trying to drown you in acid to horrifying alien machines razing the landscape. Ants, spiders, hornets, alien walkers, drones, drop ships, motherships, kaiju, there's quite a line up of enemies that is only doubled by more deadly variants them on higher difficulties. Whilst individually these things are easy to dispatch there's a slightly complicating twist: they'll come at you in furious marauding armies and mobs. It's here that the game can mean two things to you, either its repetitive, or it's a challenge. I've embraced it as a repetitive challenge, one that I'll faithfully meet until I've cleared all the missions on each of the harder difficulties. (But seriously someone please remove spiders)

If you bring friends (I would recommend bringing friends) or take your game online the difficulty scales with the number of participants. To make this repetitive challenge more interesting, I would strongly encourage playing the multiplayer. Whilst the multiplayer component isn't perfect, the occasional game lobby crash for example, it is well worth it to fight and struggle alongside fellow members of the EDF to save the planet. Some enemies will test your patience. Some missions will test your skill. Overall EDF is a fulfilling journey in killing piles of foes if you allow it to.

EDF does not have a happy ending but if you try, it can have an honorable one.

31915596.review:
[h1]Summary[/h1]

Low-budget, highly repetitive yet addictive, B-movie-esque, third person shooter with thousands of weapons to unlock, waves of hundreds of enemy bugs, robots, dragons, and more to mow down, destructible cities, tons of levels, extreme quantities of content to unlock, health and items to grind/farm for, with both single player and co-op campaigns. Up to hundreds of hours of content if you enjoy the basic premise and gameplay on offer.

[h1]Who is this game for?[/h1]

Anyone who doesn't mind repetitive, mindless third person shooting action.
Anyone who loves tons of weapon unlockables.
Anyone who loves poorly translated, B-movie-esque (think the original Resident Evil's, "Wait! DON'T, OPEN, THAT door," & "It might be helpful if you, the, MASTER of unlocking... took it with you," but set against an, "Aliens are invading Japan!" backdrop) dialogue.
Anyone who likes simple arcade shooter gameplay.
Anyone who doesn't mind grinding/farming for health and weapons.

[h1]Who should steer clear?[/h1]
Anyone who demands storytelling.
Anyone averse to repetition.
Anyone who dislikes grinding/farming for health and weapons.
Anyone who isn't a fan of tongue-in-cheek silliness.
Anyone with severe arachnophobia.

[h1]What is EDF, anyway?[/h1]

Do you enjoy shooting giant ants? Do you enjoy shooting giant spiders? Do you enjoy shooting giant ants AND giant spiders? What about huge hordes of them? Do you enjoy shooting enormous hordes, hundreds at a time, of giant ants and giant spiders? What about doing that in completely destructible cities, where every single building can be demolished by your rockets?

Do you enjoy games that allow you to unlock weapons? Do you enjoy games that allow you to unlock HUNDREDS of weapons? Completely ridiculous weapons like inflatable blow-up doll decoys, and missiles that move so slowly through the air you can outrun them on foot, but when they eventually detonate, make enormous insane mushroom clouds? 

What if there were robots mixed in with the insects? What if there were GIANT robots, taller than skyscrapers, mixed in with the insects? What if there were mechs, flying saucers, drones, and dinosaurs mixed in with the insects? What if some of the insects could also fly? What if they were bees, or wasps, or godzilla? Giant hordes of hundreds of wasps, godzillas, flying saucers, robots, ants, spiders, and more, in tons of levels set in destructible cities?

What if there was super cheesy, poorly translated dialogue, too? What if your NPC allies kept saying things like, "It's YOUR turn... bro!" or, "If only you freaks had never come here!" or, "EDF! EDF! EDF!" while you were fighting the giant hordes? With the hundreds of weapons. In the fully destructible cities. Possibly in your own giant mech, sometimes.

Would that be fun? 

That's Earth Defense Force in a nut shell. 4.1 is the latest iteration of the series, and the first (from original developer Sandlot, at least,) available on PC. 

If the above scenarios sound at all enjoyable to you, my recommendation is: buy the game. Buy all of its DLC. Buy any future DLC that comes out for it. Then play alone or hop online with your friends, start on the lowest difficulty, and work your way up to more health and better weapons, until you can survive on the harder difficulties. Do it now. The Earth needs Defending. EDF! EDF! EDF! 

Er...

Ahem. Where was I?

[h1]No, but seriously... WHAT IS IT?[/h1]

EDF is a third person shooter in which you choose one of several character classes, and battle against waves of progressively more challenging alien invaders consisting primarily of insects and machines... with some surprises thrown in.

Generally, you will begin the game at the lowest possible difficulty, and then play through an enormous number of somewhat repetitive but increasingly difficult levels, while farming for armor (HP) and weapons. You can replay levels as many times as you like, finding those best suited for farming, to better prepare for future levels. 

You can then play through the levels on higher difficulty settings, which will result in new and better weapon drops. This continues until you reach a point where you are capable of beating the game on the hardest difficulty, where enemies move faster, do (and soak up) more damage, and kill you more quickly.

The first few levels are nothing to write home about in terms of the number of enemies on screen. Eventually though, you'll be facing huge waves of spiders and ants, backed by flying saucers that drop yet more enemies, flying drones, huge mechanized walking fortresses, giant robots taller than buildings juggling you through the air with lasers... you get the idea.

Trust me... it gets I N S A N E...

Visuals are very "meh" by design. This is part of a simple, low budget series in Japan, intended to provide the most content possible at the lowest price. And in that regard, provided you enjoy the game, it definitely delivers. You can spend hundreds of hours in this game, and the quantity of enemies, weapons, and the sheer levels of insane, at times overwhelming action, are a lot of fun. 

It's an incredibly simple premise, but the result in practice is a very challenging, enjoyable shooter that will keep you busy for a long, long time... possibly for years.

[h1]PROS[/h1]
Extreme amount of content
Extreme challenge in later levels, at high difficulties, demanding practice, patience, and grinding/farming to survive
HUGE numbers of enemies on screen at a time
Ridiculous assortment of weapons
Runs great on fairly low-end to mid-tier hardware
Full controller support
Active online playerbase, albeit somewhat small
Fully functional online AND offline co-op. 

[h1]CONS[/h1]
Simplistic graphics
Can be extremely repetitive
No real storyline to speak of, apart from brief level introductions and radio chatter
Can be VERY challenging, and VERY time consuming if you plan to 100% the game
Frame rate dips may become common on lower end hardware during the largest enemy wave spawns (this has become a staple of the series though, so for some this is a good thing...)

All in all, the ultimate B-movie third person shooter. I love it. I've been playing the series since 2017 on Xbox 360, but it goes back further than that.

NOTE: If you'd like a game with the same basic premise, but more of a "Western" feel, and some more polish, check out Earth Defense Force: Insect Armageddon, made by a different developer, in consulation with Sandlot. Sandlot are the developers of the originals, including 4.1, however. Personally, I prefer Sandlot's games - including 4.1 - but I did find IA enjoyable for what it was, too. Check it out if you're intrigued.

31891362.review:
After around 30 hours of play time I feel like you could compare this game to a ski course. Going down the easy normal or hard ski courses will be fun for the first few times, but eventually it will start to feel like the same thing over and over again. The missions are always very similar to one another with minor and major changes to shake up the experience. Going on the lower difficulties will sometimes offer a challenge though, basically they lodged fucking rocks in the ski hills that you have to overcome. 

These missions are sometimes extremely difficult and will be almost incompletable without the help of another  player in up to 4-player coop. When you play on hardest or inferno however, they will lodge a whole lot more fucking rocks in the hill and it will feel like you aren't making any progress, but I feel like this is where the game shines the most on an enjoyment level. You will have to plan out each action you or your friends take, and learn from each failure while trying different weapons to complete different challenges. You will have to all work together and coordinate yourselves to overcome some of the huge boulders that will impede your progress. Sadly, if these take too long it will feel like you won't be making any progress, but if you are looking to not mindlessly shoot bugs and actually think and plan out your actions, then the harder difficulties are for you. 

Not to say that the lower difficulties aren't fun and can't be hard because they will kick you in the teeth every now and then, and I think if you like making constant progress and trying newer and cooler weapons, the lower difficulties are for you. It can feel like a crawl when you try very hard to complete a mission on hardest, only to find out you still have a 1% completion rate. Overall the game will make you very angry but also will bring you some of the greatest times I've ever had in a video game. The difficulty spikes are rediculous and most of the time after completing that hard mission you will go back to it being incredibly easy, but it is still fun nonetheless. Fully worth the purchase no matter what your play style, just get ready for a lot of shooting bugs, and skiing.

Don't let my 150+ (at time of review) hours fool you. I put about the same amount of time in this game on PS4 before buying it on steam just to play with my steam friends. There's not much to say about this game that hasn't been said in other reviews. It's pure mindless fun. 

Disclaimer: The game is kind of boring on single player. Get a friend for local co-op or go online for up to 4p co-op (you cannot local-cop + online co-op, unfortunately).

It's a tongue-in-cheek killfest with over-the-top weapons, ridiculous plot (if you want to call it that), and cheesy voice acting. This game is the epitome of how gameplay can be so much fun that you don't need professional actors, hi-res graphics, or deep story. It's like an homage to games of ye olden days when you just needed a controller (or m/k) and something to shoot. No regenerating lifebars (pick up your health drops on the field like a real soldier!) Infinite ammo (on most weapons, but you still have to reload). 

The only thing I can think of to make this game batter would be a level editor. Oh, and bring local co-op online multiplayer to the PC version.

31205747.review:
There's not really much I can say to distinguish this review from all the others, but I can safely agree with pretty much all of them. 
This game is simple, you start a mission, kill everything, and repeat for each mission. Almost 200 of them, in the base game. This is split between multiplayer exclusive missions, and singleplayer missions, roughly 50/50 but I believe MP has slightly more. 
There's 4 playable classes, ranging in their complexity, but all of them have pretty much the same effectiveness so it's all about how you feel like playing. You can be the typical grunt armed to the teeth with grenades, rocket launchers, flamethrowers, machine guns, shotguns, pretty much anything. You can call in support vehicles in another class, like tanks or air strikes, or even deploy turrets. You can play an [spoiler]anime waifu[/spoiler] air mech suit, with high damage weapons but low health, or be a hulking walking suit of armor that's the equivalent to about 5 tanks.
There's an absolute ton of weapons, each of them pretty distinct. Few weapons are direct upgrades of previous ones, having small tweaks, making them more of a sidegrade. E.G. More ammo, faster firerate but slightly longer reload times and less damage. Or grenade launchers will either be timed or explode on impact, and some missle launchers have shorter lock on range, some lack lock on, and some burst fire.
The missions themselves get stupidly insane the further you go in, it starts out almost boring for the first 5 or so, but soon you're knee deep in bugs and mechs, and you'll be crying for more allies to assist you. They aren't exremely long, either. Most will take 10-15 minutes each, making them short and sweet. 
Multiplayer seems fine for the few hours I've played, runs well and despite my awful net there's not too much rubber banding going on. Best played with friends, obviously, but randoms will do fine. 

There's a few bugs (hah) here and there, I blew myself out the map once when I shot myself with a rocket accidentally, and the AI is absolutely braindead at times. (They'll try to shoot enemies through walls and buildings, or in the underground missions they'll leap off and be unable to walk back up. Though the game compensates these sections by adding fresh units at the end, so no biggie.) 
Also, some missions require explosives or some other means capable of killing large ships that spawn enemies, if you bring guns that don't reach high enough to destroy these, you can't win the mission. It's a little annoying, but it does state in the briefing what you'll be fighting, so it can be put down to your own fault. (Though at one point I brought a lock-on rocket launcher that couldn't hit a ship that was placed unusally high, that one annoyed me a bit.)

All things considered, the game's fantastic, and if you enjoy senseless murder of bugs with a huge and stupidly fun arsenal of weapons and classes, then you'll get a great kick out of this. Here's hoping for a PC port of E.D.F. 5.

31059706.review:
Yes, it has shit graphics, is pretty grindy, only has about 15 different map layouts which they reuse, has some weird weight mechanics, has very, very bad voice acting and a seriously campy story ... but none of that is bad. In fact, it is kinda the point. The whole thing is just like a cheezy B-grade monster movie with a very Japanese twist. 

Every level is mostly just "Kill Everything" yet somewhere amongst the frantic spraying of bullets, rockets, guided missiles, grenades, napalm jets, plasma blasts, lightening streams, lazers, bigger lazers, even bigger lazers, tank shells, artillery shells, heavy cannons, mortars, carpet bombs, ICBMs, orbital lasers, limpets mines and tazer wire is some genuinely awesome moments. Flying through the air with your jet pack or rushing into a group of enemy in your power armour or laying down the hurt with your tank all feel great. Four very distinct classes with over 150 different weapons each means there is all kinds of ridiculous crazy in this game.

Plus there is no other game that has this kind of epic scale. 

The first time your screen becomes a sea of red because there are 1000+ ants rushing you on a beach, or you are fighting off 100's of giant mechs in an open field with an army of AI and airsupport, or you are fighting a colossal ant queen and her minions deep underground, or you are shooting down giant spaceships as they turn a whole city to dust, or you fight all these things at the same time in a ruined wasteland; then you will understand the point of this game. 

It is just epic fun. 

Especially when you get some buddies (or strangers) together online or in splitscreen.

30987757.review:
Most of the people I've explained EDF to walk away laughing at me, not kidding. "It's a game where you kill giant insects, robots and airships"

You may think it sounds extremely repetitive when I explain it like that but this game actually manages to keep it extremely fun and entertaining throughout the entire 89 missions in singeplayer. I joke alot about this game, it's hard not to but I'm completely honest when I say that this is probably one of the most entertaining games I've ever played. I'm a hundred hours in and I still play it from time to time.

I would say EDF 4.1 is perhaps one of the purest examples of videogame entertainment. There's no original story or fancy graphics like most of the AAA titles. In fact, it's the complete opposite. The story is like your typical B-Action Movie, the graphics are like playing an outdated PS2 game and the voice acting is absolutely terrible. And these are exactly the reasons why I love it and what gives the game it's charm. It's a japanese game so playing EDF is like listening to a terrible english dub from your typical anime, it's absolutely hilarious. And let's not forget about the EDF songs, that you can happily sing together with all of your troops on the battlefield.

There's also a surprising amount of replayability. The 4 classes you can pick from all play diffirently and have a ridiclous amount of weapons you can unlock, you could play all the missions over and over again with these classes and it would never be the same. You can mow down waves of insects with ridiculous weapons and feel like a demi-god or get your ass handed to to on the Inferno difficulty (seriously, Dark Souls is a stroll through the park compared to Inferno.)

What I like is that not every mission is just: shoot down enemies, wait for next wave, repeat. No. In fact, most missions actually require some careful choices about which weapons you pick and an actual strategy. 

Oh, and if you can convince a friend to buy it (despite it's high price, which is the only downside) like I did, play co-op! Playing the co-op missions with a friend was some of the most fun I've ever had, probably on the same level of enjoyment as Borderlands 2.

I cannot recommend this game more, seriously. I know the price is quite a shocker but it's so worth it, or just get it during a sale!

30919445.review:
一开始看到大家的评论，我是半信半疑，这种旧主机平台一样的级别画面，从外表上看，一股廉价感的味道，看起来只是个堆怪让你杀穿的游戏，但是说真的，每一个玩过的人，最后都会大喊三个字
——“EDF！”
极其畅快，爽疯了，牛逼炸了，这太对味了，小巧的体积呈现出了不输60G大作的内容，虽然只有几个场景，但是当你玩过以后就知道城市场景是有多大，多开放了，起码有圣安地列斯那么大了。[spoiler] 放在这里说了吧，这游戏是任务制的，但是每一关的任务的地图，绝对大到让你满足	[/spoiler]
----------------------------------------------

只要你还怀有那一份对科幻战争的幻想，那么玩到它，你可能会觉得，卧槽，这就是我想要的地球保卫战啊。游戏很聪明，把资源用在了各种敌人表现力上，突出一个“大”和一个“多”（还有爆炸），虽然画面糙了点，但是一个拥有所有建筑可破坏的一个超大的开放地图，一支拯救人类的军队，以及各种B级片里才有的敌人玩命一样的涌上来，那一刻，再屎的画面也已经阻止不了你代入这个世界
游戏内容，更是惊人。游戏中你会不断的感受到各种即视感，对的，如果有这方面ACG文化的积累，那么你会玩得无比开心（具体有neta到哪些桥段很多人也有说，不再说了），游戏中提供多种职业，[spoiler] 高难度真的难，要根据情况更换职业和打法，顺便说突击兵这个职业可以用奶枪，可以奶队友或者对着脚底射奶自己[/spoiler]，大量武器配置，你可以在每一关都可以根据你想要的体验，定制你的玩法。最骚的是，这些武器，还有你的生命值，是要刷的，玩的开心，你一直玩，就会越来越好玩。
--------------------
--------------
----------
-------
不过对于飞翼双马尾这个职业有一个地方很烦，就是飞行消耗能量就算了，武器也要消耗能量也还行，消耗的是同一条能量槽有点恶心，关键是能量槽的回复速度在这种快节奏的情况下对这个职业的体验很致命，前期也许没有感觉，但是后期的节奏越来越紧张，没有给你站着回能量的余地，对于自身比较脆需要位移打骚操作的职业来说，后期体验真的累，再加上后面你需要用到的狙，电磁炮消耗量挺大的，敌人又多，又硬，最好玩的职业被一个回复速度给限制住了，不但武器选择畏手畏脚，实际战斗中位移/输出，以后，必然导致无法做出输出/位移的操作，这个矛盾点也导致了高难度下很考验控能量，但是我觉得没必要把玩家逼那么紧，这和游戏想要带给玩家爽快与挑战的一个中间点有偏差，回复速度快上个1.5-2秒会好很多，要不只能带着那几样撑得起消耗的武器，虽然能玩，但是就浪费了这么多的装备所能带来的多样化体验了。
-----------
--------------
-----------------
---------------------
几场迎击战做得特别好，特别带感，非常有EVA里迎击使徒的那种画面感，就差一手阳离子炮了
我要在最后再捧一下，这个游戏牺牲了画面[spoiler] 真要画面好，这游戏容量要爆	[/spoiler]，但是却呈现给了玩家最好的游戏内容，如果你不是为了看画面，而是真的想玩一款能让自己代入进去，能玩得开心的，那么EDF将成为你一段时间内的游玩首选
对了，支持本地双屏以及在线合作，和朋友一起玩的话那么游戏的乐趣将会产生质变，这里极其推荐拉身边的朋友一起来试试
前期上手的话从突击兵开始熟悉，手里一定要带一手榴弹发射器，要那种直接接触引爆的，不要延时爆炸的，这个用来在城市中拆楼。清出战斗场地的，要不然不好和敌人打运动战。
注意，这游戏对昆虫恐惧症有致命杀伤力
再有，曾经有过的中二病，在玩这个游戏的时候差点觉醒了。。[spoiler]如果你是现役中二，恭喜你，再拉一个和你一样的中二你们可以狂加戏到上天了[/spoiler]不过EDF的老哥们真的都是人才，没事唱歌，没事说一句特呆的台词，比如什么啊，忘带便当了，在大战中的语音也配得很卖力，AI表现一般，但是多亏整体氛围一直在推动游戏节奏，你也不会去过多的在意这些小问题。
游侠的汉化目前最完美
最后，后面的任务真的难疯了。。
目前卡在第45关，甚至普通都过不去，太恶心了（用突击兵一手连狙和一手奶枪总算是磨过去了）
哇，支援兵实在是很强，但是单人想要好好体验这个角色 的话需要先去先去多人联机带着刷一刷 装备，或者有条件的 开本地双人，用1P带2P的形式，就让他挂机在那里，杀完了吧装备一捡，再把他人救起来就行了，装备箱全队共享的，空兵的能量紧缺和血薄的问题可以靠支援兵狂续和狂加防御立场完美解决，载具一扔，机甲杀穿美滋滋
添加一条个人 感想：要加多人局的话，最好别和日本玩家一起玩。又开挂脾气又古怪嫌弃你HP太低狂踢人，明明自己是开修改改了十几万血的败类，欧美玩家比较欢乐，就算是开挂的玩家也不会太猖狂，玩家之间也不会过多的歧视和嫌弃

追加说明：EDF5的试玩中可以看到，空兵的能量槽终于分开来算了，很是欣慰

30887487.review:
Likely the most 10/10 7/10 game I have ever played.

What I mean by that is that, from a completely objective, artistic point of view, the game is a 7/10. The production values, graphics, sound design (okay actually the sound design is pretty great, never mind), level design, story, and dialogue are all pretty mediocre.

However, the game takes all these mediocre parts and cobbles them together in such a way that it accidentally turns out fantastic, which blows me away every time I load the game. It's not that it's "so bad it's good," because it's not. No part of this game is "bad." It's just *average*, which really doesn't matter because performing guage managment and blasting ants to smithereens with Wing Diver is the most pure and childlike fun I've had in a video game since Twisted Metal 2.

That said, there are some legitimately great points to this game, which are namely the things that a game of this genre *must* get right in order for it to be a cohesive experience, and those are the music and the weapon variety. The OST is well-made and, while a bit campy, is exactly what needs to be playing in the background of some of the more ridiculous missions.

The weapon variety is what makes this game, though. Where the dialogue and story fail to get you wrapped up in this world of hope, despair, and lasers, the driving force of "oh gosh I wonder what batshit insane weapon I'll unlock this time" will suck you in and strap you down for the wildest ride this side of the Pacific.

Highly recommended. For a 7/10 game, it's 10/10.

30857440.review:
Relentless, silly, over-the-top action from Japan!  EDF 4.1 is the best entry in the series (as of writing this review) & this PC port isn't too bad, a fairly modest PC can power past the frame rate slowdown this series is usually notorious for.  Just be aware there is some engrish in the menus & the lobby system for online play might be a little strange.

4 unique character classes with very different playstyles coupled with over 90 missions out of the box & an assortment of around 800 useful, insanely powerful or downright silly & useless weapons ensure a long lasting romp should EDF get it's hooks into ya!  Co-op with friends (2 player local splitscreen & 4 player online, splitscreen players cannot go online) make this crazy game even better.

If you can deal with some jankiness & somewhat grindy gameplay & adore B-Movie esque cheese, EDF 4.1 is a good time, especially if you can bring a few friends along for the ride.

Oh a word of warning, there is friendly fire in co-op, you can't turn it off.

Also a note on DLC, only the 2 Mission packs are really worth the money & even then I'd say wait for a sale, they add around 20 super tough missions each with new enemy reskins, they are meant to be attempted after you've beaten the main game.

Now go save our Mother Earth from any Alien attack!

30732468.review:
がっつりプレイしてからのレビュー。

家庭用でこのシリーズをプレイした、見たことのある人はわかると思うが、最新ハードで処理落ちを発生させないと死んじゃう病のスタッフ達なんで、快適プレイを求めるのであればそれなりのスペックは必要になります。
過去作をプレイしたことのある人なら処理落ちしてナンボ、あるいは許容できる人もいるので自分の求める快適さとPCスペックは気にしたほうがいいかもしれないです。
i7 3.4GzのGeForce980Tiでストレスフリーです。処理落ちは感じません。参考になるかわからないですが。

・ゲーム操作
私はキーボードとマウスでの操作が好きなので、使い慣れたキーボードとマウスでのプレイに十分満足。
ゲームパッドを使用するとエイムがガバガバになってしまうので、steam版になったことで見直した武器もあったり。
慣れないマウスよりゲームパッド、という人でも無理に変える必要はないです。他の方のレビューにもありますが、乗り物関係での操作はゲームパッドに軍配が上がります。
具体的には、バイク系の操作をするとき、キーボードでは0or100の入力しかされないけど、アナログスティックなら0～100の入力ができるため、キーボードでは初期のバイク以外はいきなりフルスロットルで回すためまったく走ることができず、ゲームパッドならスティックをゆっくり倒して徐々に速度を上げれば上位のバイクも問題なく乗りこなすことができます。

なので基本は慣れた操作で問題ないし、設定が面倒だけど兵科によって使い分けるのもありだと思います。

・ゲーム内容
敵がワラワラ出てくるんで適当に武器で攻撃するTPSです。
目的は地球を防衛する（敵を倒す）ことであって街や市民を守ることではないので、地球さえ無事なら辺り一面焦土になっても問題ないです。
ただミッションによっては長射程の武器を持っていかないと攻略不能だったり、建物を残したほうが有利になったりもするので、そのあたりはプレイしながら武器を集めたり作戦を練ったりするとゲームとしての楽しみが増えます。

・チャット
定型文チャット、テキストチャット、ボイスチャットがあります。
定型文チャットは、自分が日本語表記であっても言語を英語にしている人には英語で表示されるので言葉の意味は伝わります。
テキストチャットは自分で任意に打つ文なので英語表記の相手に翻訳されて伝わるようなことはありません。
ボイスチャットはデフォルトではONになっており、マイクをONのままにしていると環境音がダダ漏れになるので注意。

オンラインプレイ時、ルームの設定でチャットが「不可」になっているとテキストチャットとボイスチャットができません。

・その他
オンラインでは難易度ごとに使用できる武器やアーマーに制限がかかります。この制限を自分で解除しようとすると、ミッションの達成率を70%にする必要があります。これは、
オンライン全98ミッション × 難易度5段階 × 兵科4種 = 1960
の70%をクリアしろということなので制限解除を目指すと長い道のりになります。

まぁでも楽しんでプレイしてると50%くらいには割りと早く到達するので、ついでに解除できればいいなーくらいに思っておくとちょうどいいと思います。

・購入タイミング
過去シリーズをプレイしていて好きだと言う人は定価即買いでも十分満足できます。
プレイしたことはないけど動画で見て知ってるって人はセールに合わせて買えば満足できます。
まったく知らないって人はフレンド（非売品）と一緒にできるタイミングで買うといいです。

30725229.review:
For those of you longing to return to the golden days of Serious Sam-era shooters this might just be the game for you.

EDF4.1 is a game in which increasingly over-the-top waves of monsters attack and need to be defeated by you and your team of up to 3 other players, doing so will grant you with more powerful weapons and increased health to be used in future missions. As such the game follows a Diablo-esque progression of completing the game on one difficulty to get better gear and max health in order to do it all over again in the next difficulty.

There are 4 classes each with enough variety of gear to fit almost any play style, each one has to be levelled independently though so you are expected to pick a class and stick with it (similar to an RPG).

The game isn't without slight annoyances though like how the first few levels are incredibly boring before things really start to pick up in terms of intensity. The most major complaint by far though is the loot system. In this game every monster has a chance to drop crates which signify either an upgrade in weaponary or in armour. Not picking up these chests sufficiently will render your weapons and armour ineffective for later levels but due to the low movement speed of the characters, combined with the "move to next checkpoint"-nature of some missions, this breaks the flow of the game considerably.

On the technical side of things it's important for some of you to know that the game is a console port and as such is locked to 60FPS, there's also no LAN and disconnecting from the internet or Steam at any point during a mission will instantly kick you out without any rewards or chance at reconnecting.

That being said, the sheer carnage and ludricrousness of it all, combined with excellent class and loadout differentiation makes this truly one of the great co-op games.

30635035.review:
B級映画のノリで宇宙人がやってきて、迎え撃つ人類側もB級ドラマを展開し、すべてがB級映画ムードのゲーム。スターシップトゥルパーズ等の映画のノリが好きな人は遊ばなければならない逸品。　FPSではなくTPS。　続編ものであるが、プレイヤーが知らなければならないのは「以前宇宙人が攻めてきて人類が勝った。しかしまた攻めてきたっぽい」ということだけであり、以前の作品を遊んでないと困ることは一切ない。

本作品はPS2で発売された1作目から、面倒な要素が少なく、好感がもてる。

・弾は一部武器を除いて無制限でいくらでも撃てる（リロードは必要）
・建物やオブジェクトが派手に倒壊、飛散するが、それによるダメージ判定はない
・一般人を誤射、民家を大破壊してもペナルティーが一切ない
・キャラクターの強化はアイテム取得。赤箱がHP上昇、緑箱が武器種増加　シンプル

ゲームに堅苦しいリアリティを求めてない人には全面的に好感がもてる設計になっていると思う。とにかく撃って撃ってうちまくって敵をひたすらプチプチプチプチ潰しまくるだけの簡単なお仕事です。～を守れだとか、～をとってこいとか、そういうめんどくさいお使い系ミッションは一切なし。　ただしゲーム設計はあくまでRPG的で、どんなに技術力があっても装備が弱ければあっさり死ぬ。しっかりアイテムの回収をして強化をしていかないとどこかで行き詰るし、いきなり一人で高難易度がクリアできるわけではないので注意。オンラインの協力プレイは、ステージによって武器やアーマーの持ち込みに制限がある。オフラインはそういった制限がないので強い武器が1つでも入手できるとサクサク攻略が可能となる。面倒抜きにまずは一周攻略したいという人はオフラインから手を付けたほうがいいかもしれない。オンラインでしか遊べないステージが有るためオンラインのほうがステージが多いが、スタッフロールつきのちゃんとしたエンディング見たい派はまずオフラインへどうぞ。オフラインで取得した武器はオンラインにも持ち込めるので無駄にはならない。オフラインモードはPC1台でも箱コンがあれば1Pはキーボードマウス、2Pはコントローラーといった感じで画面分割して2人で遊べるのがGOOD。兵科が4種類あるが、最初はレンジャーかウイングダイバーではじめるのが無難かも。言語はマジ日本語。音声も日本語。英語嫌いな君でもOK。あと開始時のロゴがサクサク飛ばせる親切仕様。ほかのゲームどもも見習いたまえ。


気になった点や不満点は以下の通り。
・ステージによっては長射程兵器必須の場所があり、ショートレンジ武器しかもっていかないとクリア不能。
・敵に蟻や蜘蛛等の虫が多く、昆虫を見るのも嫌だっていう人はあきらめたほうが…
・乗り物の操作がキーボードマウスだと極端に難しく、左右旋回操作等はゲームパッドよりはるかに劣る。
・オンラインで使用する会話プリセットの階層深すぎてどこに何があるか把握困難。
・オンラインモードでルーム作るときにデフォルトでボイスチャットONでイライラ。作るたびにON(´・ω・`)
・オンラインのルーム検索条件設定がいちいちリセットされ再検索時、再設定が面倒

30633086.review:
Dale Gribble's wet dream

EDF 4.1 continues to tell the epic about a small team and their dream to become the greatest exterminators known to man.

An actual serious review(?) below. More of a like, overview, but, whatever. I've mostly played 2025 on ps3 and 4.1 on Ps4. Only recently bought 4.1 on steam.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
EDF 4.1 is a remastered version of 2025 with additional content such as a few extra missions, few new weapons, some new enemies, and the first and second dlcs from 2025 are bundled together as the first dlc of 4.1.
Game runs well, haven't had any crash problems despite the rediculous about of shit you can blow up at the same time. locked at 60fps, idk how to change it if it's possible, personally don't care with a game like this.
If you're expecting a game with an enriching story, this is probably not the game for you. EDF 4.1 is just a game about killing bugs from the aliens and how much damage you can inflict on the city over the insects.
Over the top weapons that start of fairly basic such as gatling guns, rocket launches, rifle, beam rapiers, etc and begin to become more and more insane as you progress at obtaining higher leveled equipment throughout the 5 difficulties.

[h1]4 classes to choose from:[/h1]
[b]-Ranger:[/b] Typical soldier with basic shit. Spine of steel that can now roll through cars and other small obstacles. Easiest to play imo. Easy to pick up and pew pew the insects away. Uses your typical soldier weapons that advance into things such as hand held gatling gun assault rifles and multishot plasma rocket launches that can level a quarter of the city on their own

[b]-Wing Diver:[/b] Aka: Waifu Diver. Flies. Uses energy to reload weapons and to fly. Personally I find them the hardest to start (note: I always play on hard+, hard if i'm starting to get gear for a class or if I'm not very geared with them) cause of them being the weakest armor wise and don't enjoy playing them. Using laser and beam weapons. Amazing if you have an Air Raider to keep you charged up for your high costing, high damaging weapons.

[b]-Air Raider:[/b] Support class. rains air strikes, artillery strikes, satellite lasers, as well as calling in vehicles that he and, 99% of the time, the Ranger can only drive (not including side guns to vehicles). Has healing pods, armor pods, energy walls that seem to always kill me rather than protect me, sticky grenade gun thing that you usually detonate manually. Kinda annoying to start off with if you're solo cause of how their weapons work. Strikes and weapons typically run on a "credit" system which you get by killing enemies. Basically you usually don't reload, you, or your allies, have to kill in order to reload your equipment most of the time. Amazing with other players, love having one seeing as I have a habit of blowing myself up by accident with Fencer.

-[b]Fencer:[/b] Big dude with big guns. Slow. starts with most armor. Slow. Motars, gatling guns, hand held artillery, melee and shields, and lamp post sized cruise missles that 9/10 times ends up causing us to lose because the Air Raider thought it was funny to guide the missle into a bulding and killing all of us. My personal favorite to use since i just find it satisfying to use their weapons. Easy to start off with but harder (i guess? harder than the rest imo due to your typical slowness and the damage ramp up on enemies. As well as the Fencer's weapons don't get as buffed up stat wise as other classes do) to use later on higher difficulties. Slow. Boost canceling makes you move fast, but, you are still slow.

[b]tldr: nonsensical story that doesn't take itself seriously, pick a class you like, blow up most of the city and kill insects while you do it.[/b]

Remember, the aliens can't take over the city if there's no city left standing for them to take.

30501357.review:
Ah where do i begin...This game has little story, you don't really bond with any character or any of that. Its just a absolute carnage fest. 
If you are a type of person who wants to be engaged in the story, this is not for you. But if you are the type of person who just wants to have downright fun. This is for you. This game is really satisfying to play by just the over the top carnage and destruction it holds, like fighting millions of ants charging at you while you just spray dual wielded miniguns at them, or soaring across the sky and causing death from above. Maybe you instead throw in a smoke grenade that causes the entire area to be a killzone of bombardment. Or step into a Pacific Rim Jaeger and just smash smaller alien mechs to pieces and duke it out with Godzilla like dinosaurs. This game continued to give me goosegumps in its sheer fun and awesomeness and frankly it gave me a sense of fun that i haven't felt from a game in a long time. 

For some, the price may be the steep and it may not be the most fun alone, but bring a friend and i promise you that you can get some absolute carnage-fun. 

PROS
- Silly Voice acting that really goes into the spirit of the game
- A massive array of weapons and playstyles
- A massive amount of fun emotes and voice lines
- Very quick to learn controlls, easy to play and get into
- Awesomeness and Fun to be had
- Very fun progression system
-Challenging on higher difficulties
- Very straight forward missions, nothing complicated (Can be a con for some)
CONS
- Some veichle controlls can feel very clunky
- RNG Drop system
- Mission ends before you can loot, causing alot of lost loot (In a earlier title you could spend all the time you wanted and then go to a evac point whenever you were to end the mission) 
- A couple of missions are a tad bit over scripted
-  Obnoxious AI allies talking constantly
- Glitches, amusing but are still a problem
- Steep game price

Verdict
I personally love this game, i like playing it just to wind off and have a fun time without having to deal with a story or emotions or overly complex objectives. I can however see this being offputting for some people who don't really enjoy such straight forward and ignoring story aspects. The game price might also dent some people's wallets as they are not rich, so i do not blame you for not getting this just for that. 

This game may or may not be for you. But i know it is for me

30421686.review:
PC版で EDF4.1 が遊べるなら PS4 を買わなくていい。
こんな素晴らしいことがあっていいのだろうか、と思った。
しかもローディング時間がパソコンのスペックによっては PS4 よりも短縮されるという神仕様。

しかし、オフライン画面分割協力プレイするまでに相当の労力を要した。
XInput対応のコントローラを持っていないと、

"画面分割プレイ"→"2PコントローラでSTARTを押せ"

の状態から先へ進むことができない。

XBox360のPC用コントローラを購入するも、キーコンフィグを設定しなければならない。
デフォルトのままではスタートボタンにはキーボードの Return キーが割り当てられている。
BigGamePicture 上のコントローラ設定画面は、最初は混乱したが慣れれば自分の設定ミスに気づける。
BigGamePicture モードを終了させる方法もわからなかったので、非常にイライラした。
Altキー + Enter キーで終了させることができる。またはスタート画面の電源アイコンを押す。

コントローラに割り当てるキーはキーボード、マウス、ゲームパッドの3種類から選び、
その後、そのデバイス上でどのキーをどのボタンに割り当てるのかを設定する。
Xbox360コントローラのスタートボタンにゲームパッドのスタートボタンを割り当てることによって
初めて画面分割プレイモードへ進むことができる。

D3パブリッシャーも Steam のフォーラム上でサポートコメントを書いていたが
あれじゃ、分かるわけがない。XBox360コントローラ買ってこい。で終わらせるのはいくらなんでも酷い。
せめてその使い方が書いてあるリンクぐらい貼ったらどうなんだ。

30394173.review:
Do you like having fun?

Even want to just have fun?

No concern for a beautiful story, graphics, or any logic, just have fun?

Buy this game.

Jumping on top of a 50ft building to mow down hundreds of giant ants, only to have a swarm of flying ships surround you on all sides, only to get batted down as you boost straife away firing flak and piercing the sky with a pneumatic spear doding all their lasers , pausing briefly to leap 100 feet in the air and mow them down from within with duel miniguns, is some of the most fun I have ever had. And things only get crazier from here.

Ugly graphics are quickly forgotten as you choose the weapons perfect for each level, before jumping into the frey and having a blast. Do anything from playing on easy just to relax, enjoy some chaos, and feel like a god, to playing on inferno for some of the most difficult challenges of your life. Coop only enhances things that much more.

Not necessarily perfect, but I'm not understating anything when I say that it doesn't have to be. This game is just a blast. Have a friend over and play some split screen, play alone and go through the campaign, with each difficulty level adding something new so that replayability is 100%, try all the different classes, each one offering a unique, and awesome experience. 

Just get this game. It's so much fun the most callous of humans would light up with glee by the third level.
