Holy Cow! This is amazing!

But I'm getting ahead of myself. In EDF 4.1 you shoot all the things. Bugs, Robots, Aliens, Spaceships. The lot. The graphics are nothing special, the voice acting can be a bit wrong at times, weapons can be crazy imbalanced and good luck trying the hardest difficulty... Ever.

But then it all comes together. You have 20 guys under your command. You select the singing/chanting voice option, and all of their voices roar next to you. You look up and around you, and feel tiny in this city, and you see the nervous scattering bugs all over the buildings. You grab that weapon they gave you, and target the bugs. Shooting until it keels over, and again, and again. "They just keep coming!" one guy says "I'm gonna shoot them full of bullets" another/the same guy says. (Same voice actor, hell if I know.) Then... The same guy shouts: "I'm out of bullets." and you regret drinking soda. But then, as you feel confident in taking down the GIANT INSECTS, your screen shakes. You look up, and see a massive robot looming behind one of those buildings. As he breaks the building with a cannon, you realize: YOU CAN BREAK EVERY BUILDING IN THIS GOD DAMN GAME! Also... GIANT ROBOTS, GIANT INSECTS, ALIENS SPACESHIPS!

It all comes together when the game turns from "this looks like a PS3 game" to "This is war against aliens and insects and it's fucking AWESOME!"

This is the greatest game of all time!

I joined the EDF way back in 2007 with EDF 2017 on the 360. Ever since then I've had an obsession with this series that has made me yearn for it to have both online multiplayer and a version on the PC. This was an instant day-1 purchase from me.

29712722.review:
What do you do when giant bugs, robots, kaiju, ships, and dragons all threaten to lay waste to every building in sight?

You lay waste to every building in sight.

Oh....yeah....and you destroy the enemy.....I guess...

You take one of the 4 totally fun and unique character classes, pick a few out of the hundred or so weapons to take with you, then set out to destroy anything and everything you can in sight on one of the 5 difficulty levels. It really is that simple.

Cons:
-The voices. My god the sound of everyone screaming in your ear is attrocious
-The graphics. Like seriouly, what year are we in?
-The story. Hahahahahaha......it was no where to be found, like my father.
-The character customization. Might as well not exist.
-The gameplay loop. Kill. Kill. Kill. Kill. Kill. Kill. So ridiculously repetitive.
-The audio. Do the developers not know of the low end of the audio spectrum?

Pros:
+It is perfect <3

   No, seriously. This carries with it that same phenonmenon that Dynasty Warriors does: so bad it is good, except this does it way better. I just do not know how to describe it. This is one of those games that was built around the Gameplay pillar of a game and threw everything else out(story, graphics, quality), so what you get is a game that focuses on only the gameplay, and it all the more fun because of it. It is cheesey. It is repetitive. It is ugly. It is a blast to play.
Let me repeat that last part:
It is a blast to play.

   On top of having 80+ missions to play, 4 character classes to experience, and 5 difficulties to try it all out on, there is also an included online and splitscreen co-op feature that has you playing through the same amazing game together with your buddies. A great component that pushes the replayability is that you only unlock certain weapons at certain difficulty levels. Want a tri-shot plasma cannon that can wipe out a whole city block in one shot? Play on "Hardest" Difficulty, level 53-61. Want an airstrike that will destroy every badguy on screen, every building, your friends, and you? Play on "Inferno" difficulty, level 74. Yes, weapons like that do really exist.

   The classes are also all fun to play as. You have the standard Ranger that has access to standard military gear (minus the vehicles) and access to drive vehicles. You have the Air Raider that has access to auto weapons, remote weapons, team buff utilities, vehicles, and airstrikes. You have the Fencer that has access to powerful swords, shields, gatling guns, shoulder mounted rockets, and gets to hold 4 weapons at once. Lastly, there is the WingDiver that flies and had a bunch of energy based weapons.

This game is not a diamond in the rough, but more like the less valuable oxygen that everyone can appreciate for what it is. I can see how this won't be for everyone. I myself will be dumping many hours into this game, just like I did on my PS4 and X360.

29617577.review:
The first EDF was a darn good game. This? Its epic.

EDF 4.1 is a MASSIVE array of levels (100+) in which you shoot hordes and hordes and hordes of enemies both bug and alien, in ultra-destructible environments, with up to 3 friends assisting. There are 4 classes of character to pick from, each with hundreds of weapons. Think Pacific Rim and Independence Day wrapped inside a solid Starship Troopers case. Literally. The scale is often unbelievable.

Your equipment may be unlocked by collecting weapon crates dropped by enemies, as with armour. You reap these rewards *if* you successfully complete a mission. Once unlocked, the assets are permanently available for that class. Armour collection improves your class`s maximum hit points. Over time, you may then 'farm' improvements to your survivability.

Harder difficulties allow for greater ranges of reward to be dropped. The maximum power level of equipment useable in any given mission also increases with difficulty, which at first and for a while (!) sounds like a lame limitation, but is really only a reasonable governor that does indeed balance finds, fun, and progression.

The interface is slightly wonky - a port of console menus - but solid enough once you fiddle with it a bit.

The story could be described as very "good enough" to propel players into ever-more intense (!) contests. The imagination put into the foes you face is equal to that found in the arsenal. Environments are terrifically destructible. A.I. buddies are effective and consequential. The game only gets better as you progress. EDF 4.1 should win awards... not for the menu interface, but for everything else. Its pull-your-hair-out action fun.

29559462.review:
The EDF series is arguably one of the best co-op games I have ever played. The game is very very simple. You shoot bugs, get loot from them (weapons and armor) then do this repeatedly. Sounds boring right? Not at all.

Me and a friend have played 2017, Insect Armageddon and 2025. This one is the premier of the bunch. If Insect Armageddon was your first I am sorry because that's just a mediocre experience compared to these.

Gameplay:
There are 4 separate classes with all unique attributes and weapons. 

-Fencer is a slow moving armored soldier (if he's too slow look of dash canceling)
-Air Raider which is a supportive type character that can lay down healing beacons, vehicles and call down airstrikes and orbital beams
-Wing Diver is a jump jet trooper that uses the sky to assault. Has laser and plasma based weaponry. Has an interesting functionality where if you shoot your gun or reload it it drains jet pack fuel. So it's something you have to manage well.
-Ranger is a bread and butter basic soldier. Just solid in firepower and movement.

Ammo is infinite for almost every gun and it's balanced by reload times. (Some weapons specify how much you can use it)
Guns range from hilariously bad and niche to wicked godly and just plain cool.

Movement for every character is unique and takes time to master.

Story
Yeah, story is interesting. From playing all the titles on the console at least the most I can tell is that Aliens have sent giant bugs to exterminate humans back in 2017 and they buried themselves underground and have now came back. Something like that. You can tell the series seriously borrows from old B movie type plots especially in the tear inducing dialog that will make you laugh so damn hard. It's fantastic if you love cheesyness and ham levels to the max.

Game engine
This is what makes this game great. The maps are huge, sometimes cycled through its vast amount of levels (80+) and every building is destructible. If something is in the way blow it up. The way the enemies react to explosives are also great. Shoot a rocket or throw a grenade and bugs will go sky high or fly out in bits in a different direction. Just makes it so much more fun.

Graphics are lack luster, however they gotta be. You are fighting sometimes an upwards of 100 units plus firing weapons that sometimes have 100+ projectiles AND your partners if you are playing with them in a vast environment. Settings from the menu as I understand are hardly tweakable. Bout the most you can do is change Anti Aliasing. This game ran fine on a GTX 1070 with an i7 6700k.

There are hundreds of weapons to collect, hundreds of hours to sink in, and hundreds of memories to make with friends.

Well? What are you waiting for? JOIN THE EDF TODAY, AND I BUY THE WHOLE PLATOON STEAKS!

29549086.review:
Power Rangers + Starship Troopers  = EDF 4.1

It's the best trash game there is. Kill thousands of giant insects, robots, flying drones, alien dropships, walking fortresses, transforming motherships, dragons and godzilla-like monsters!

It's what i like: A giant coop action playground of awesomeness. And the game is very self-aware about it!


Features:

-Online coop up to 4 players

-Offline only split-screen for 2 players

-89 awesome missions. Some with arcade-like boss battles (98 Missions in online mode)

-4 different classes, each with their own advantages and disadvantages

-Class progression by collecting weapon boxes on the battlefield for permanently unlocked weapons and armor boxes for a permanently increased HP-pool

-Fully destroyable surroundings (Missed the rocket? Hit a building? See a part of skyline collapse in the background..)

-5 different difficulties for a challange

-Tons of one-liners from HQ and your NPC comrades. Listen live to the struggle of war, new scientific results and theories about the invaders and what is happening at other places around the globe while doing your part

-Lots and lots of weapons/vehicles/tools for different playstyles and synergies between classes


Do you like epic trash, like a good b-movie? Do you like addicting stupid fun action with tactical possibilities and cooperation? If the answer is yes, go and take a look at EDF 4.1!

    PC판이던 이식이던 4.1 처럼 몇년뒤에나 나올수도 있으니 
    후속작만 기다리기보다 해보고 싶어서 구매하겠다면 할인시 구매 추천

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

15년도에 4.1이 PS 플랫폼에서 출시되고 16년 7월 19일에 스팀 PC로 이식된 4.1 입니다.. 
허나 실제 오리진이라고 볼수 있는 지구방위군4 는 13년도 게임으로
실제로 나온것은 13년도 라고 봐도 무방합니다

일단 이유는 잘모르겠으나.. 
아무튼 전작들처럼 외계인들이 지구를 침략한다는 내용의 게임으로
플레이어는 EDF 에 소속된 4가지의 병과 레인저, 윙다이버, 에어레이더, 팬서
중 1병과를 선택하여 게임에 진입, 최대 4인 플레이의 코옵 미션을 진행하는 게임입니다
PS 로 출시된지 좀 지난데다 , 이미 즐길분들은 다 즐겼기 때문인지 
막상 스팀에서 온라인으로 들어가보면 방이 그렇게 많지는 않습니다 (평균 4~ 11개)
이것도 정작 온라인매칭을 하다보면 원산지(?) 인 일본이나 서구권 유저보다 
동남아나 중화권 유저가 많습니다 - 고의 팀킬 비매너는 덤

4가지의 병과를 통틀어서 무기의 종류도 많으며 
에어레이더가 호출하는 탑승장비도 다양하여 게임을 플레이하는데 재미는 있는데 ...

아무래도 일본게임 특유의 굉장한 노가다는 버릴생각이 없는것으로 보입니다

해당게임에서 자랑하는 굉장히 많은 종류의 장비들은 최종난이도인 인페르노
그것도 거의 후반부에 많이 몰려있습니다만
이 인페르노에서 어느정도 여유롭게플레이하기위해서는 
아머(타 게임의 HP) 가 높아야 하는데 이는 미션을 통한 레벨업 방식이 아닌 
게임내의 적을 처치하면 드랍되는 붉은 컨테이너를 습득시 상승하는 구성으로
병과별로 아머를 습득시 상승하는 량은 각각다르며 
이는 특정미션에서 아머파밍을 따로 해야하는 번거로운 파밍을 해야함을 의미합니다
지루한 아머 파밍행위를 조금더 빨리 편하게 끝내고 싶으면  싱글플레이에서 
2p 를 같이 켜두고 허수아비처럼 세워둔다음 
1P를 조종하여 적을 학살&아머 습득 이라는 짓거릴 해야하는데 
PS 에서도 출시되었던 주제에 정작 PS패드는 인식을 못하며 XBox 패드만 인식이 됩니다 
패드를 인식&연결하여 2P 로 스타트를 누르지 않는다면 2P를 난입시킬 방법도 없기때문에 

"내가 제대로 거대생물들과 마더쉽을 인페르노에서도 박살을 낼것이야!" 라거나
"소중한 지구를 침략하는 외계인들을 호되게 당하게 해주겠어!" 같은 생각을 가지신분은 
Xbox 패드의 구입 또한 생각해두심이 좋습니다.

일단 스팀에서 이게임을 구매하시겠다면 현재 시점에선 
60% 이상의 할인이 아닌이상 구매를 보류하시라고 말씀드리고 싶은것이 

올 17년 정유년에 차기작인 5편이 나올예정으로...
물론 차기작인 5편도 PS 플랫폼으로 나온다고 발표는 했지만 
이게 또 PC로도 동시발매할지 아님 4.1 처럼 시간이 좀 지나고 PC이식할지는 모르니까요 :) 
여러분의 지갑은 소중합니다 :)

I recommend the game, the gameplay is awesome. Especially in Coop.

You choose one out of 4 classes that have their own way of playing kinda and do missions in various difficulties. You get new weapons and more max HP as you progress, unlocking more powerful weapons or hilarious prototypes..or both :3 The game also has many different enemies and enemy types, also really big ones which is alot of fun and reminds me of the one or other monster movie :D

Also just about anything is destructible, its all not too fancy and the game is quite glitchy but its nice. Even though the glitches are more annoying overall...Its incredible annoying of how unpolished the game feels, it can be fun at times but usually you got rather gamebreaking bugs like being in a tunnel and they attack through walls for example. Or through buildings /=

However, the game has some issues...As above, the gameplay is great but the grinding is retarded.

I dont mind the grind in itself but some "additions" are making it dumb and annoying, making you feel frustrated.

- You gain armor way too slow as the game progresses or as you play higher difficulties while difficulty has no impact on the armor you get

- R N G / Its all random! its a general problem if you ask me. You can do a mission and dont get much armor or more worse, weapons. Despite that the mission just now was on a higher difficulty and hard.

- Difficulty -> Problem is that if you watch the ranges of the difficulties about the weapon they drop is that you´ll realize the pool is far too big, you often will have lvl 1-30 weapons you dont need, or often weapons you already have while anything that is useful is like lvl 50+ in combination with the RNG you at times barely get something..

So yeah I recommend it because the game is fun but be aware that the grind is tedious and has a pretty retarded system. The game is also rather glitchy/buggy so enjoy dying from that a few times at least. Certain enemies tend to shoot through buildings/walls. [Mostly the spider enemies]

29330166.review:
You have to know what you're getting into: 

An arcade-style shooter with four substancially different-feeling classes with a ton of customization.  There is a light progression system consisting of weapons (Chance drop from loot boxes) and Armor/HP (guaranteed drop from loot boxes). The most impressive aspect of this game is the ridiculous amount of combat variety to play with and the sheer scale of each battle. You always think "This has to be as epic as it can possibly get!!!" and then it one-ups itself time and time again. It's pretty damn addicting and keeps you wanting to see what else is next.

If you're looking for your next hardcore competitive co-op shooter, this is probably not it, but don't mistake this as a purely casual game. Some of the higher difficulties do require teamwork and situational loadout planning, especially on higher difficulties. 

This game is about putting fun first and it never forgets it. It might not have a deep story or memorable characters, but it has a solid arcade-style core that'll keep you playing for countless hours on end. Just buy it!

这个游戏的特点就是简单粗暴，要是有小伙伴一起闯关就有意思多了。这么多好评，然而基友们都不入，太伤心了。所以我特来补一个测评。
这是一个看上去像是突突突割草的游戏，不过大多数时候是你被割。。。。尤其是普通难度以上的时候，就算你有武器也顶不住啊~~
不要在乎建模细节，建模什么不是卖点。关键是炸的虫子满天飞。额不对~~是把城市炸平，这点比较爽~~满足你的破坏欲~~
关于武器的选择，我只能说，武器的好坏不能光看级别，不见得级别低就一定烂。有时候比级别高点的奇葩武器更有效，要好好看武器的介绍。而地狱模式好用的一类武器，在困难模式中也可能因为级别限制的问题并不好用，不得不选择另一类级别更合适的武器。所以，选择合适的武器才是王道。
关于角色选择，我只玩过飞行兵和空袭者。
飞行兵：在天上飞感觉真的很好，可惜是个大脆皮，如果队友都躺了，目测要GEGE。不过只要武器选择得当，输出还是非常出色的，可以有效的突击大型空中目标。
空袭者：唯一一个不是特别受血量制约，可以玩任意难度的职业 ，（前提你抱了大腿刷到好载具）。因为就算你只有100血，当你坐上了顶级的坦克时，仍然可以在高难度关卡里蹭一蹭。不过要当心下车叫空袭，以及炮弹打光了不得不离开载具的情况。不过空袭者呼叫的东西我觉得还是几个职业中最具有娱乐性的。另外要注意的是，刚入坑的新人不要觉得坦克怎么这么难开，炮塔转这么慢什么的。因为高级坦克手感才会好，0级的就将就一下吧。。。
ranger和fencer不好多评价，毕竟只是看着别人打，感觉ranger真的很万金油。武器选好了可以应对任何状况。而fencer则是翻盘神器，当队友全躺了的时候，全靠他拯救大家了。

29202197.review:
[h1][b]BEYOND AWESOME EDF EDF EDF ! ! ![/b][/h1]

That's really the best you'll get out of me when asked to describe this truely brilliant, underplayed and undervalued [b]Team America[/b] meets [b]Starship Troopers[/b] meets [b]overly violent, plotless Japanese nonesense[/b], shooter. I honestly can not remember the last time a game was able to put such an immovable shit eating grin on my face. EDF is just a pure joy, instantly playable (The telling hallmark of all would be classics), instantly impressive and constantly [b]FUN[/b].

Not sure what [b]Sandlot[/b] were thinking when they dreamt this masterpiece into existence, but I for one am sure glad that they did. In a world of proper naff games that take themselves way too seriously, with awesome graphics but drab mechanics and forced plotlines. Along comes this little sparkling gem to remind everyone how it is done. And also to remind everyone that gamers are supposed to be thoroughly entertained and to be getting some level of enjoyment.

EDF delivers this by the bucket load, with a plot so ridiculous and as over the top as the action that is thrown at you, full force from the screen. You take the roll of one of four classes of soldier, determined to thwart the onslaught of an alien invasion. These invaders, although many in variety, really come in just two simple variations. The ones that are many in number and the ones that are massive in size. The size of the enemy waves and the size of their largest units can only be seen to be believed. They are many and simply HUGE. It's unreal the scale of some of these things and the numbers in which they attack. It is literally that impressive.

Luckily you have a huge arsenal of over the top, quite inventive weapons to choose from. [b]800[/b] in all, if [b]Sandlots[/b] spiel is to be believed. You start with a set of basic stuff, but you then unlock various random items after completing each mission. The harder the difficulty you play that mission, will depend on the quality of the rewards at the end. I at the time of writing this, haven't even unlocked a fraction of what's potentially available. And Some of the stuff I have managed to equip is so damn ludicrous, but all necessary for what awaits you in each successive battlefield.

I did read in the review section on here from a fellow Steam user, that EDF was a game where you "[i]level cities to save cities from insects trying to level cities[/i]" (and the rest heh). And that is about as accurate as a description of the general ins and outs of the game as you're going to get. The scale of the destruction that you rain down upon the invading alien army is phenomenal. Watch gobsmacked as entire city blocks from small holdings, homes, to huge towering skyscrapers get utterly demolished in the wake of your defensive measures, as you try to save planet Earth from the onslaught.

Of course such incredible amounts of pixels, bouncing around the screen does come at the cost of graphical quality, at least compared to most games these days. But they are functional enough and despite whatever is lacking, it still looks great. You won't have time to be worried about the lack of polish here and there, when there is so much polish in every other aspect of the game. And with that said, the graphics are very clean cut, bright and cheerful. Setting a real wild contrast against the doom laden scenerios that you will have to face.

EDF also features something of a very rare occurance for PC games, in the form of [b]SPLIT SCREEN CO-OP[/b]. As well as a four player online Co-Op mode and of course, the usual Single Player campaign. All levels are interchangable between each mode and there are plenty in the base game alone to be getting your teeth into (Around 80 I believe). Then there's some great value DLC to go with that. One offering a massive 50 level extention.

In terms of the Multiplayer aspect, it seems a shame that EDF 4.1 does not boast a very large community (or so it seems). With the playerbase split between who has what gear. It does appear that high end veteran players, seem a little reluctant to backtrack and give aid to the noobs, more than likely because of the reward / loot system that's in place. Which does feel like this could be a bit of let down. Especially if you're just starting out in this incredible title. So having a few friends on board to Co-Op with may be a bit of a necessity (to begin with at least).

As with all games that feature some sort ot rudimentary levelling system. The starting gear isn't really all that great for any of the classes. And the first few levels aren't really all that much of an introduction to the fiery Heck that awaits. Giving you just a hint of the shear insanity that's around the corner. Hanging in there will reward you with one "[b]WTF[/b]" moment after another. As you'll stare in wonder and amazement at just how on Earth you are going to win the day through all the bullets, giant insects, giant robots, spiders and all the other mental creations that will inevitabley end up in your crosshairs.

To go along with the scale of the battles that are occuring, this also means that you're going to need a lot of space to move around in. And some of the maps are of quite a decent size in order to incorporate all the action. And the missions themselves will take a decent amount of time to complete, for the most part. 

Besides the possibility of a splitscreen partner or Full Co-Op team, you will never have to fight alone. Not even in Single player, as there will be other EDF soldiers on each level to fight along side you. When prompted by a simple arrow pointer above an individual unit or squad, you can take charge of them. Using a very simple point and click mechanic to issue simple "go there" or "attack that" commands. You can also communicate with your fellow troops through a basic chat wheel. In which your squad mates will more than likely respond. As well as constantly chatting amongst themselves with some brilliantly witty and instantly quotable one liners. Such as :

"[b][i]If you want to eat tonight, you'd better win ![/i][/b]"

As well as the constant shouting of "[b]E D F[/b]" and the hearty singing of the EDF anthem. Which is so cheery and uplifting in the warzones that it just doesn't ever get old. This basic chat wheel, along with a few other options, can also be used to send basic messages, instructions, greetings and warnings to your fellow Co-Op players too. 

[h1][b]So finally ![/b][/h1]
You can just take my word for it, watch some videos on Youtube or ignore this completely. But if you even consider yourself to be a gamer in any respect. You really should not miss out on this wonderful, crazy, beautiful game. Get your hand in your wallet and get this diamond title purchased. Sales are always good (always). But even at full fare, this is one of those rare occasions where it might actually be worth every single penny spent. And will be more than worth every minute wasted on this brash, bright, noisey fun soaked game.

Just get it ! I can't think of any other game of late, that is more deserving of a [b]perfect 10 / 10[/b] than this.

It is quite simply, that fucking great.

That "[b][i]Overwhelmingly Positive[/i][/b]" Steam review score is there for a reason...

Recommended to play with friends. Everyone needs to own the mission packs if you plan on doing those.

29196571.review:
You start off as a member of the military investigating giant like insects that are chasing people and spraying butt juice. You come to find out the earth has been invaded and these aliens are using huge bugs to take down the world. You start off with 4 classes Wing Diver, Ranger, Fencer, and Air Raider. Oh and its 4 player CO OP ONLINE!

This game does something that many games cannot do correctly and that is SCALE! The game makes big fights feel big and big enemies feel tough and sometimes you feel like you are in "OH SHIII" moments. There are a huge amount of bugs and robots and everything. The levels range from Different parts of a City which anything can be destroyed. ANY BUILDING CAN BE BLOWN INTO PIECES! It feels good when you see a bunch of baddies on the radar but there are a huge amount of buildings blocking you. You decide to pull out the Signal for the Airstrike to nuke the area and it does exactly that with a flat battle ground to enjoy. Even underground caverns that are seriously dark and hard to navigate sometimes. You have some levels out in the country which is a nice change of pace. There are vehicles, mechs, airstrikes, missile summons, tanks, Starlight cannons, ect, ect ect, The list can keep going on for ages as there are over 700 weapons to enjoy in this game.

The Ranger is the best starting class as he has a good selection of weapons and can pretty much get any level done with his starting weapons. He has decent speed but to make him go faster you must run and jump at an angle in order to run faster. His weapons range from Machine guns, Sniper Rifles, Rocket Launchers, Grenades, and a bunch of other things. There are different levels of weapons with different affects. They are not random everything is set in stone. 

Wing Diver can FLY! and hey its a woman neat. She uses weapons based on her plasma and she has to balance her plasma for flying and her weapons which can be difficult but satisfying. She has beautiful weapons that light up the area. Electric sniper rifles that blow up into bolts of electricity everywhere once they hit anything. Sniper Rifles that are just lasers. Plasma Launchers that are huge explosive Dragonball z like energy balls that blow up anything in its path.

Air Raider is my personal favorite. He is a support class but he can summon some serious stuff. He can summon some of the strongest weapons in the game and he has the ability to summon vehicles even giant mechs that can beat the crap out of anything. He has totems he can set down to boost damage or defense. He can give the wing diver little boosts to give her more plasma energy. He can make vehicles come down that are medic vans that heal if your teammates get into it. He has not very many close range weapons alone but he makes up with his interest limpet gun that shoots these little light darts and  you can detonate them anytime you wish.

Fencer at first glance Fencer might seem like a horrible class that has a horribly slow speed and is pointless as a character. Well that is okay to think that but you are completely wrong. The Fencer is one of the neatest characters and second fastest to the Wing Diver. He can dash and shield cancel and dash again to go super fast. Now there are other ways to go even faster like the Javelin cannon which any one of you can look up. He can also equip 2 sets of weapons meaning 4 weapons in all! Meaning you can do a quick move setup to move around the map fast and then the second set can be a heavy loadout with cannons and rockets. He is very underused but once people start to realize his true power he will become one of the heaviest used.

The voice acting is on point and the lines will have you rolling sometimes, the explosions are sexy as hell. All in all I think this is one of the best games on steam and I am so happy it made it. The game also has a lot of replayablity as it has a interesting system that makes you collect red boxes that make your max health rise. The Green boxes are loot which are like gold. 

If anyone is curious to see my gameplay here is a video

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9jiDK8RU5kU

29029958.review:
Угловатый графон из 2005 года? Худший ИИ союзников, который вы видели в игре за 900 рублей? Какая-то японщина с неудобным меню?

Да, но не об этом вы будете думать, когда через вас будет перешагивать огромный робот, разрушая по городскому кварталу каждым своим шагом.

Всю игру японцы вам будут пытаться вынести мозг. Насекомые-убийцы? Сделаем их гигантскими и в несметном количестве. Инопланетные роботы? Одна нога будет размером с небоскреб. Вражеские дроны? От их обилия не будешь видеть солнечного света. Босс собрался тебя атаковать? Будет стрелять в тебя из нескольких десятков пушек одновременно.

Никакая другая игра не передаст ощущения, будто ты в фильме "Звездный десант". Когда ты, играя простым рядовым солдатом, смотришь как вдалеке с холмов к тебе тянется туча гигантских муравьев, ты думаешь: "Да вы наверное шутите! Хотите сказать что мне придется сражаться со всеми ними?"

В игре есть 4 класса бойцов. Не очень много для игры, которая постоянно хочет тебя удивить, но каждый из них совершенно не похож на другие. Можно сказать, что это не 4 класса, а 4 режима игры. Либо отстреливаешь врагов как обычный пехотинец. Либо летаешь по всему полю боя и фигачишь энергетическими шарами. Либо ездишь в танках и мехах, периодически вызывая орбитальные удары. Либо ходишь медленным тяжелым солдатом в экзоскелете с миниганом и мортирой (и это только в одной руке).

На первый взгляд кажется, что боевая система реализована лениво и аркадно. Бесконечное количество патронов, разноцветные ящики с лутом, выпадывающие из жуков, невнятная анимация перезарядки, одинаковые модельки оружия для многих пушек. Но когда открывается доступ к новым пушкам, то понимаешь, что имеешь дело с одной из самых хорошо реализованных оружейных систем в играх. Посмотрите например как реализован миниган: отдача, разброс, траектория, огневая мощь, звук - все как надо. А когда стреляешь из ручной пушки, то ощущаешь именно то, что отправляешь в полет несколько тонн стали. Каждое второе оружие здесь - уникальная машина, которой приятно пользоваться, и аналогов которой вы не увидите в других играх.

Большое количество оружия в игре (разработчики заверяют, что около 800) не просто для галочки. Оно именно разнообразное и для разных ситуаций, стилей игры. Ты можешь 2 часа проходить уровень, выбрав не подходящее оружие или пройти за 3 минуты, выбрав нужное.

То же самое с уровнями. Их не просто много (около сотни), но они еще и отличаются разнообразием задач, тактик, сквозь них проходит даже некий сюжет. И если в начале игры вы просто мочите жуков, то в дальнейшем все становится интересней, эпичней и разнообразней.

Каждый уровень - это большой открытый мир, по которому можно ходить, прыгать, летать. Поэтому, хоть задачи у тебя вполне конкретные, ты ощущаешь себя будто бы в опен-ворлд игре, но при этом не начинаешь скучать из-за неопределенности целей.

В игре поощряется кооп. Многие мощные пушки рассчитаны на взаимодействие союзников. Товарищ поможет навести твою ракету, подвезет тебя на танке, установит для тебя энергетический щит, подзарядит энергией. Оживит, в конце концов.

В общем, эпичная игра. Эпичная в своей проработанности и трешовости. Эпичное оружие, эпичные враги, эпичная разрушаемость, эпично неудобное меню, эпичная цена. Хотя с учетом всех плюсов не такая уж и большая.

28996811.review:
[h1]EXPLOSIONS! CHAOS! BUGS! INSANITY![/h1] 

Do you like brutally difficult bulletstorm/bullet hell games? Do you like chaos? Do you like explosions? Do you enjoy killing insects? If you answered yes to any of those, then you'll love EDF.

You take control of a member of the storm team, a group of Soldiers in the Earth Defense Force tasked with protecting the human race from a malevolent alien race known as the ravagers. They have giant ants, spiders, wasps, walkers,  giant spaceships, robots, and even giant spaceships that turn into robots!

Overall it's a really challenging and fun game to play and amazing to play with friends. 

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
[h1]Compared to EDF 2025[/h1]

As someone who has played every one of the EDF games on Xbox, I can say witout a doubt this one is my favorite. I like this so much more than EDF 2025 (The original Xbox 360 game is was ported from), and for many reasons.

1. In the xbox version, your framerate would go to hell as soon as you got anymore than 200 enemies in your immediate vicinity. I have a pretty average PC and I have yet to have any framerate or lag problems in this game.

2. The modified the levels to male it feel like you're actually in a war. Before, there fould only be ground soldiers, and despite the fact that the EDF had access to a wide array of vehicles, only storm team would ever use them. Now, the NPC EDF soldiers have vehicles, which actually makes it feel like the human race is really giving everything they've got to save Earth.

3. NEW WEAPONS! Even some which allow you to REPAIR VEHICLES!

28996668.review:
A wholly unexpected gem, I can see why Earth Defense Force is considered a cult classic.  Though some compare it to Dynasty Warriors, the only real resemblance there is that you are up against a large number of enemies and it is a Japanese-made console port.   I would say this game is something quite unique - what other games are third person shooters involving blowing away giant ants being dropped by UFOs?

Far and away the most unique feature of this game is the satirical flavor.  It is a game where everything is only [i]pretending[/i] to be serious.  And I mean everything.  The dialogue is a neverending calvalcade of perfectly delivered grade-A B-movie shtick.  At first, you might think it is just bad engrish.  No, it's [i]deliberately[/i] running the fine line between just serious enough to pretend they mean it and then obviously not as the show goes on.  The design of the four classes make sense until you realize it does not.  Giant insects and floaty UFOs seem like a great threat until you realize there's no way they could be.  The soldiers can [i]sing and dance[/i]... [b]sing and dance[/b]!  It's all one big work of satire.

However, just because the setting is a joke does not mean the gameplay is worthless.  Actually, the gameplay is more along the lines of Serious Sam in a way: the hordes of enemies exist for you to have fun just blowing them away.  Blow them away you shall.  At times, the sheer amount of things being blown away generates feelings of awe.  The game has bullet hell moments, such as when trying to bring down a mothership or being pursued by dozens of giant hornets firing steel stingers at you.  Something about the way they utilized this engine is just too rarely done: don't overthink it, stop worrying that the polygon count looks over a decade old, it's just plain fun!

There's over 90 fixed scenarios to play, and a lot of replay value because you could try to beat them all with all four classes (a grunt, a vehicle user, a flying suit user, and a heavy suit user) at four different difficulty levels (as easy difficulty does not grant an achievement) and end up with hundreds of hours of play.  Each class has different sets of equipment, and doing missions at higher difficulty unlocks chances to unlock those pieces when collecting weapon crates, so there's more incentive to replay than just achievements.

The PC port of the interface seems to work rather well, both on mouse/keyboard and on gamepad.  It includes two multiplayer modes.  Local split-screen for up to two players and online on the Internet for up to four players, but the two multiplayer modes cannot be activated simultaneousy.  Though standard resolutions are supported, ultrawide is not natively supported, but a hex hack exists to get it to play well at that aspect ratio with minimal artifacts, and the UI scales well to it.

The main downside is that there are some incompatibilities with AMD systems.  I had to turn my NVIDIA settings to "performance" mode to stop it from causing major hitching on my AMD FX-8120 processor, but my Intel-based laptop did not have that problem.  The AMD Phenom reputably suffered the most incompatibilities at release, I do not know if later patches have fixed that.  

Overall, EDF 4.1 just plain fun.  Not the deepest game, but the breadth of content, over-the-top explosions, and constant tongue-in-cheekery more than make up for it.

*The heavy/melee weapons guy(Fencer) 

These class work together nicely as well the one I like the most is the big ass missles the Fencer uses require the Air Raider's laser guidance system to fire for MASSIVE damage compared to what he can use solo. As you'd think you start out weak with low armor and shitty guns, but as you collect weapon and armor crate drops from the enemies you get more health and better guns in a varitey of types, those allow you can handle more hardcore fights.

 The best part is when you get your friends involved and play through the hectic battles as a squad leveling entire cities for the sake of humanity. Unfortunatly online mode seems to have connection issues that are a pain but a game restart seems to fix it, albeit temporarily. 

 The main issue this game has, aside from the connection issues online, is the price point. As 3 year old game 49.99$ plus the 24$ for the 2 mission packs (49 new missions together) is just way too steep so I recommend getting it on sale. 

P.S Listen to the game when It says beat Normal before trying anything harder, you will be r.a.p.e.d

Обычный японский малобюджетный шутер с кучей врагов для истребления. Графон в стиле "выколи глаза" обеспечен. Очевидности диалогов позавидует даже кэп, ибо за первые три миссии про то как летучие бабищи превосходят муравьёв вы услышите раз 25, при этом каждый раз они будут напоминать что "Потому что муравьи не летают". Кэп, тебя обставили, как же так. Если сравнивать игру с предыдущей частью EDF, которая вышла ещё в 2011, то это большой шаг назад. Возможно потому что там старались не японцы, а другая студия. Там всё было серьёзно и враги были нехилой угрозой, здесь же всё выглядит мультяшно и убиваются об жуков только боты, и то если не умрут перед этим от вашего гранатомёта.
В целом игра ощущается как аркадная стрелялка, что по стилистике, что по геймплею. Вам дают оружие, вы убиваете кучи жуков которые не особо то сопротивляются и уворачиваются, зато любят застрять на стене в переулке не зная как спуститься, по ходу вы собираете разные ящики для прокачки брони и открытия оружия, в надежде что они что-нибудь откроют, потому что с ящика охотно падает оружие которое у вас уже есть и ни на что не влияет.
Рекомендую брать исключительно по хорошей скидке, ибо за такую цену лучше купить какой-нибудь устаревший, но хит, или вообще взять другую часть этой игры. Низкобюджетным играм и цена должна быть низкая.

28925697.review:
"[i]Are you just mercenaries? Fighting for scraps?[/i]"

I just wanna say that I tried. I really did.

I tried to like EDF. 96% positive user review score. Steam likes it. Twitch likes it. Mainstream critics like it. Unconventional critics like it. This is going to be my last review of 2016, and I really wish it wasn't. I really wish that I could just ignore what I've seen, and brush off that I didn't like EDF. Just buy another game and move on without saying a word.

But EDF--EDF is an unfathomably pointless, outright [i]dumb[/i] experience. There's no dimension to it, no depth, no purpose. You [i]just[/i] shoot things. The [i]entire[/i] game is shooting things. There's not many enemies, and the game is massively padded to the point where several missions are virtually identical. Most of the time you'll be shooting things from very long distances unless you play the Fencer class, which is the only way the game can get in anyway involving. The gunplay isn't even GOOD. The enemies are utterly massive which gives a great sense of scale, but at the same time it means that you'll [i]never[/i] miss. Some of the soldiers even say "You can close your eyes and still hit em'." Hit indication is limited to a very hard to see tracer effect on the bullets which can barely be seen because of the foliage that constantly covers the maps. In any other game, this would make the gunfights nonfunctional, but because the enemies are so big and so dumb that you will [i]always[/i] hit them, it merely becomes a matter of lacking precision, rather than not knowing where to shoot. The game is so [i]dumb[/i] that even the lack of basic features like this don't even hurt it. 

Because again, you do [i]nothing[/i]. You complete each mission when the enemies die. There's no score. You don't get bonuses for having saved people. There's not even a timer. You're not even guaranteed a reward, you can complete missions and get absolutely nothing because of how the timesink functions. The *point*, to use that word lightly, of EDF, is to obtain better weapons so you can fight stronger enemies to get even better weapons. That is nothing new, there are hundreds of games like that. But where games like Diablo, Warframe, Borderlands, Path of Exile etc. at least have the common decency to [i]disguise[/i] the grating minutiae of what you're doing, EDF provides nothing. This is the game about nothing. Buying a game titled "Timesink" where you continuously scrub dishes to get better cleaning equipment would be even less transparent than what EDF does. You kill insects and robots. The end. 

It's baffling to me. Videogames have existed in recognizable form since 1962, putting this new year as the 55th year that this medium's existed. We've got games where you can feel like Indiana Jones. We've got games where you can make your own story. We've got games that people question if they're even games because they're that arcane. But EDF makes it's mark, because what we [i]don't[/i] have yet is...a game where you kill ants. Is this it? Is this a $50 game? Is this something people buy and think "Oh, wow, I can call an air strike on spiders!" and that's a marvel? That is the accepted emblem of an "overwhemlingly" good game, that acceptance of the most unbelievably banal? This is exactly the type of game that these obnoxious PC elitists would bash as being infantile console trash in the early 2000s, but here we are on the edge of 2017, and this is the Hot New Thing. The first [i]Borderlands[/i] was more daring than EDF. Fucking [i]Borderlands[/i] of all games.

But I get it. It's got four classes. It's got arcady sound effects. It doesn't try to be homogynous and overly balanced. The (intentionally?) terrible voice acting brings to mind the arcade hits of the early 2000s. There are times, brief moments, where you are surrounded by what seems like infinite enemies, and you feel that sense of scale, that primal sense of danger, that the rest of the game so painfully fails to invoke because you can shoot blindfolded and still win each mission. It's like Starship Troopers! Everyone like Starship Troopers right?

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TGe6017JwPw

28847092.review:
Imagine Dynasty Warriors with guns and bugs, and you have a good idea what this game is about. The first hour of playing was by far the hardest part, as I got used to all four character play styles, the map icons, and that sort of thing. There are roughly 100 missions, with four difficulties. All the missions are relatively straight forward: kill all enemies or do enough damage to unkillable enemy. Tons of fun, especially when played with others.

There are a few issues, of which I will highlight the two most frustrating for me, just as a word of warning.

Multiplayer system: It is far from seamless. Regardless of where you are in the game, if you accept an invite, before joining, you have to return to the main menu. Setting a game as private doesn't exactly work as intended. Instead of reserving all spots, you need to leave spots open to the public that will then be filled by your friends that you invite. If you buy the game (and you should), you will see what I am talking about.

Collision detection: Collision detection for the player is pretty good. However, the enemies have zero collection detection at all. They can shoot you through enemy bodies, but it doesn't work the other way around. So you will massacre dozens of bugs, and have a huge pile of corpses, with one or two survivors hiding in the bodies. On certain maps, enemies can shoot you through the ground.

Those annoying issues aside, this game is loads of fun. Now get out there and do your duty: Save Earth from bugs.

Do you like killing ants IRL? 
Do you patrol your property seeking ants to destroy during the summer/spring months?
Do you light ants on fire with a lighter upon noticing them?
Do you long for the day you can utilize a satellite orbital death ray to destroy ant mounds in your back yard?

Incredibly fun and addicting 3rd person shooter where you can choose between 4 classes and hundreds of types of unlockable weapons to use against various giant insects, space ships, giant robots, and more. 

Weapons are earned and health is increased by picking up various drops that you get from killing enemies. I've had some of the most fun I've had gaming in a few years playing this game, therefor I Highly recommend it.

28742250.review:
Un excellent jeu à faire en coop. on pourait bien passer 1000 heure à débloquer tout les achievements.
-graphismes qui paraissent très en dessous mais qui ont le merite de pouvoir afficher des vagues d'enemis toujours plus grandes (d'afficher les cadavres aussi^^) et surtout de pouvoir raser des villes entières, sans pour autant avoir un PC de compète, le tout à 60fps constant. Dit comme ça ya pas grand nombre de jeu qui en est capable.
-plusieurs classes differentes, plein de vehicules et d'armes à utiliser.
-accessible des la premiere minute manette en main (parfait pour les amis qui connaissent pas manque plus que les chips et la bierre).
-Fou rire garanti. On dit merci au tire allié et aux explosions gigantesques qui vous mettra dans les situations les plus cocasses (qui n'a jamais eu envie de cacher une mine sur le tank de son ami...)
-Quelques bonnes idées dans le gameplay, comme pouvoir "customiser" ses vehicules en y ajoutant des tourelles automatiques ou mêmes des boucliers ou autre power up, ce qui permet des strategies encore plus tordues (ajouter des tourelle à un hellico, c'est possible... des bouclier sur mon robot géant... pas de probleme!)
Les difficultées superieures (tres dure et armageddon) sont très exigentes et vous demanderont du skill et de planifier une bonne tactique. Les hardcore gamers auront  un vrais defis ici pour finir cette difficultée en solo. Arachnophobes et âmes sensibles s'abstenir!!!

Ce qui pourait à mon sens etre amélioré (si possible pour EDF5):
-themes des map pouraient etre un peu plus varié.
-Pouvoir sprinter ne serait pas du luxe ou augmenter les mouvement d'environt 40% de plus (sera dans EDF5 logiquement)
-Ameliorer le pilotage des hellicos (il manque une touche pour descendre/aterrir)
-remplacer le grind d'armure par quelque chose d'un peu plus subtile et interressant (comme des tenues/équipements qui changent l'apparence de votre personnage et doneraient une vrai raison de farmer: collectionner)
-ameliorer l'interface pour ameliorer l'érgonomie et la clartée (c'est surtout un problème pour la version PC)
-Avoir les même mecaniques de destruction que l'on avait sur Red Faction Guerilla (on peu rêver mais ce serai vraiment au top)
-Utiliser 2 save differentes en partie splitée (que le joueur 2 puisse avoir sa propre progression)
-retirer ce mode "facile" que l'on est obligé de compléter pour le 100% (ou ne pas l'inclure dans celui-ci) et y ajouter des achievement plus originaux/interressants.
-plus de types d'insecte géant (papillon, millepattes, moustiques, scarabé/cafards....Il y avait une mante religeuse si je me souvient bien dans les anciens)
-Avoir des Npc un peu plus utiles/ resistants. Leur donner des ordres simples comme garder une position, divers styles de formations pour ne pas qu'ils se retrouvent dans votre ligne de mire...
-dommage qu'une bonne parties des armes sont des copies d'une autre. Même si on peu trouver quelques trucs originaux, ça manque clairement d'un brin de folie qui pourait grandement augmenter la qualité du jeu.

This game places you right in the middle of a Japanese B-grade monster movie as the most expendable unit(s) on the  playing field...only there's no Godzilla-like creature backing you up! 

The pace comes in waves of frenetic action and enormous scales. Choose your character and weapons wisely though as there are different terrains (including, cities, countryside, open plains, and underground tunnels and lairs) and a multitude of different enemies clambering over the lifeless corpses of their fellow comrades just to get to you and your squad.

The sheer joy of this game comes from its multiplayer mode. Team up with your mates and lay waste to the invaders. It's pure, unadulterated, arcade-style FPS action that would not be out of place at a real gaming arcade.

At first the game looked very dated, the controls felt clunky and the movement speed quite slow(I started with the Fencer class). But I gave the game a chance and pushed through, even though the fights felt quite repetitive too. 

It escalates on a curve. A very lenghty curve. But I eventually tried the other classes and found the Wing Diver to be more bearable and mobile for solo play. She has great big guns too, and I'm not talking about just her boobs here! 

But then I tried the lame looking engineer class, "Air Raider", who deploys healing items, explosives and artillery strikes etc. He has a vehicle call ability too, and starts out with a selection of a battle tank & troop transport, both equipped with the same gun. 

And then he upgrades into GIANT MECHAS! Of various sizes and uses!! And the game gets to a point where GIANT ROBOTS AND KAIJUS appear and you get to PUNCH them with your GIANT MECHA! 

And this all can be played in CO-OP mode!! 

The city environments in this game are fully destructible too. Your cannons, artillery strikes, and GIANT MECHAS level entire cities as you fight against the alien invaders that are trying to level entire cities!! Oh yeah!! 

The game is totally worth it's current price(35% off), especially so if you manage to convince some friends to play it with you!

okay, cheesy joke aside, EDF is a blast if you can play it co-op in some form. like, for real. the game is a bit buggy at times in the more proper sense of the term, but nothing game breaking unless your computer isn't up to the sheer amount of things EDF will toss at it. i do reccomend the use of a controller if you have a buddy who likes to come over.

the game's arsenal is... surprisingly diverse. ARs that shoot bouncing bullets, homing rocket launchers that clearly take a page off Macross Missle Massacre, shotguns that shoot in a flat cone rather than a circular one, Limpet Guns which act a lot like stickybomb launchers except reloading disarms the bombs, deployables of all kinds, vehichles from tanks to mechs to helicopters, air strikes of all sorts, a bunch of weapons that if i didn't know better i would say were lifted off Monster Hunter, and even laser targeting sights, allowing those with homing launchers to lock onto bugs and other foes too far or are otherwise incapable of locking onto, and so on and so forth. seriously, other game devs need to play EDF before they can think about "weapon diversity". and you'll want the finest arsenal to fight back the giant insects and the ravagers.

mission wise it'll be the same thing for the most part: kill all enemies. to thier credit they do mix it up by not using bugs all the time. there's some mechanized troops, theres flying units with seemingly generic AI, but one thing unifies the enemies. they are all big, and they all outnumber you when you start the mission.

Voice acting is endearingly both good at times and others just bad enough that you have to chuckle, and it has a "Starship Troopers" vibe to the games story. like, it's cheesy at best, but it's ironically "so bad it's good" at other times. most of the time the story plays absolutely 0 role in the gameplay and is just there to set up the background of the missions or to preface what is happening in said missions.

overall, if you just want an excuse to kill big bugs and lots of them... you really can't go wrong with EDF. unless you don't have friends. in which case you might want to look elsewhere. EDF really sucks as a singleplayer game and it'll show when you're on the wrong end of a horde of ants.

The EDF deploys. are you and your buds rad enough to save the earth? Storm Team only takes the finest.

28701321.review:
This game is Fun. I may have only put in about 16 hours so far, but those 16 hours have been over like, a day and a half, to two days. That's how engagingly fun the gameplay is. Another point in favor of the game (at least to my eyes) is the fact that there's an actual text chat supported. It has a hilariously small character limit, but the fact that you can type your own message in and send it is more than you'll see in most console ported games. What shines (at least it has for me so far) is the mic support. That is to say that it actually works just fine in game. Now, you'll have to turn down the back ground music and sound effects to hear people over the gunfire, explosions, and giant monsters you're fighting, but the voice chat itself works properly. Unlike a number of games I've played, it doesn't drop your voice, cut out, or have issues transmitting that seems to plague most in game voice options that I've utilized. And being able to yell about hectors on the horizon and where is incredibly useful when your hands are busy keeping your guy moving and shooting. 

The game is not without faults. Some of the dlc is patently ridiculous (human decoy blow up dolls?) the graphics are kind of old looking, and sometimes the equipment menu will lag for mysterious and unknown reasons. But the trade off on those graphics is that you'll be fighting actual armies of giant insects, robots, and flying menaces. It isn't a game where you are sent to fight an army and there's like 4 guys on screen at once for you to do battle with. Swarms look like swarms because they Are and having a full team of four mixed units can really turn the tide of battles, as each class has a different point at which it can shine in missions. Even if you don't get this game on sale, it's worth the price. When it comes to the DLC, however, your milage may vary. The weapon dlcs are very handy for getting a head start with low level weaponry for each of the classes. As a Fencer, I've found the Bloodstorm to be particularly handy even in higher weapon level missions just because of the way that it target locks, tracks targets, and drops a cluster of explosions nearby (or even in mid air against flying units). The vast majority of the weapons in the game, however, drop from missions and none of the dlc weapons are above maybe level 3? (for reference, 50 missions in the cap on weapons you can use in those mission is like, 13? 14?). 

Also, there's an entire EDF song that you can sing through the chat menu (with the arrow keys under shout> Sing) set to the tune of Glory, Glory, Hallelujah. The best part about it is that when you have npcs following you, they will sing the next verse back to you. So you sing 1-1, and they sing back 1-2, sing 1-3, and they go to 1-4. It's a nice touch.

연출이 낫지 않았을까 한다.

떡하니 길막까지 하는 시체가 시간 지나서 갑자기 뿅 사라지는

그런것도 굉장히 부자연스럽게 느껴지기 때문이다.

그리고 탑승물에 한해서는 소환 가능직업을 에어레이더에게만

몰아넣은것도 아쉬운 점이라고 생각한다.

이 부분은 5.0에서 바뀌는 요소가 되기에 참 다행이라 보지만

여튼 그렇다곤 해도 콜한 탑승물을 다른 사람도 탈수 있으니

꼭 나쁜 문제만은 아닌듯도 싶다.

평가를 마무리 하자면 정말 돈값하는 즐거운 게임이기에 

멀티플레이에 굶주리신 분이나 적당한 중2병을 느끼고 싶은 분

또는 즐겜유저, 하드유저 모두에게 걸맞는 겜이라고 보며

개인적으로 강력 추천하는 게임이다.

28534253.review:
It’s a chaotic, challenging game with a fun gameplay, bizarre story, highly destructible environments and criminally low sales. You definitely should buy it if you are into: fight with a whole alien army, along hordes of fully dissectible giant insects, slaying the dragons, bringing an AT-AT style quadruped fortress to its knees, blowing up a Death Star inspired alien mothership out of the sky, punching “Godzilla” in the face, stir up the 50-story hornet nest and then evaporate it with a satellite blaster strike, performing a regicide of Queen of the Ants right in her chambers, challenging King of Spiders, Death Queen, and Dragon King, sometimes all at the same time.
 
 
EDF is one of the best games for co-op play out there, it shines the most with 4 friends playing and coordinating their actions. You definitely should buy it, if you are into killing thousands of giant insects (solo or with friends) that want to conquer the Earth and destroy humanity. 
 
You can de describe this game as "Destroy the Earth to stop aliens from destroying the Earth!"
Gameplay has a very simple formula: you're a soldier (solo or part of co-op squad) and your task is to kill every alien invader on the map.

But with fully destructible city environment, fully dissectible insects (given enough firepower) and means of destruction like plasma cannons, laser lances and laser chainsaws, thunderbolt shotguns, bazookas, rotary grenade launchers, high-caliber sniper rifles, powerful shoguns, rocket turrets, landmines, carpet bombings, artillery strikes, ballistic missiles, self-propelled railguns, mechs of various sizes, and a possibility to call an orbital blaster strike, you can't help yourself but smile with each new gib flying around and each piece of city’s' architectural heritage tumbling down. And if you like to get close and  personal, put on the power frame and double-wield Gatling guns, or arm cannons, put a martyr or a guided missile launchers on your shoulders,  slide through hordes of your enemies on the wave from your vibro-hammer, slice them expertly with a force-field blade and deflect their attacks right into their faces with a trusty shield, all while dashing on your rocket boosters like crazy (dash cancelling technique required).
 
There are four available classes in the game:
Wing diver — very low armor, fast speed, high damage, can fly, but dies fast. She is swift and deadly glass cannon, emergency support, that can fly from one side of a map to another in a moment or die in a second if you don't know what you're doing;
Ranger — medium armor, medium speed, medium damage, can't fly, but can drive vehicles. Effective in almost any battle situation;
Air raider — medium armor, medium speed. It's difficult for him to fight regular enemies due to lack of proper equipment, but he gives hell to powerful ones. Can call for devastating support strikes and order vehicles for delivery to battlefield. Can drive. Dies fast if you don't know what to do or if your teammates don't care about you;
Fencer — heavy armor, either fast as bullet (with dash cancelling) or slow as a sloth taking a shit (without dash cancelling). Also heavy damage. His main purpose is to get really close and personal with an overwhelming / overpowering enemy, he also usually has enough armor capacity to recover fallen team members over and over (not from the start of the game, though). The only class capable of melee combat;
 
The game also has a story, which takes it's inspiration from classic alien invasion / monster rampage movies. It's delivered properly, without taking you off of gameplay and doesn't overstay it's welcome. This story mainly supports quick pacing escalation: from small packs of your regular giant enemy ants, to the alien long-range artillery robots covering overwhelming swarms of whatever alien genetic and technical engineers came up with this time. They can get really creative at times.
 
EDF offers 98 online (or 89 offline) missions in main campaign, and 22 + 23 missions via DLCs, so you'll have plenty of gameplay to experience most part of alien invasion situations you have imagined.

Forget the zombie apocalypse; it’s time to repel an alien invasion!
 
P.S. For more awesome hidden gems, follow the steam [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/10722089/]CRIMINALLY Low Sales[/url] curator.

28145090.review:
To save our mother Earth from any alien attack!

The Ravagers, a futuristic alien race, are invading Earth with their army of giant bugs and robot death machines. The Earth Defense Force, a special military force devoted to eliminating alien threats, is our planet's only hope of survival. Grab a gun (or three) and help with the world's largest extermination!

Before games had long cutscenes and fancy graphics, they were [i]fun[/i]. EDF captures the fun of gaming. Yes, the voice acting is incredibly cheesy. Yes, the framerate can dip into the 20s when there are a million giant spiders hopping around on the screen (arachnaphobes, you have been warned). And yes, the grind for better gear can be very tedious. But, when you get some friends together and are all chanting the EDF theme song as you blow up a ridiculous number of bugs and robots with every weapon imaginable and then some, you will understand what it means to have fun in video games.

I'd been eyeing this game for a while for it's couch coop, but I held off because it looked a little unpolished and I was hesitant to sink money into another lousy console port. Finally pulled the trigger this week and I'm so glad I did. Definitely the best couch multiplayer pc game on Steam (and I've been through a lot of them). So much fun, so much replayability, so off brand godzilla-esque.
No protracted, terribly written story: first mission BAM giant ants eating your face.
No forced cutscreens: option to disable all of them.
No over simplified gameplay to appeal to the widest possible audience: the game has nuance and the different classes actually feel different.

Best couch coop game on Steam.

Hoping they bring the new one to PC, with online split screen.

I play Co-op with friends or even whoever, and I love it. It's a silly, third person shooter with a lot of "charm". The UI is kind of terrible, but that's part of the charm? They're weird and jenky, but not necessarily nonsensical. Sensical in a weird way.

Even so, nothing takes too long. You get to pick two to four weapons, depending on your class. Ranger is pretty solid all around,  so new players should stick to that for a little.

There's a bunch of campaign levels, four difficulty levels (and then easy, but that doesn't count), four classes with distinct play styles, and hundreds of weapons. I love it.

28011832.review:
There are two series of games that have instantly enthralled me with their character. Those series are [i]Monster Hunter[/i] and [i]EDF[/i]

Now I know what you must be thinking:
"This game is $50 and it's how old? What a rip off! I could get so many tendies with that kind of money!"

I know, I thought the same thing. But a few hours of gameplay in and a few nights without tendies taught me that an old game can actually still be worth $50.

[h1]Performance [/h1]
With most PC games you can usually run a game with minimal issues even if you don't meet the minimum requirements.
[b]Not with this game you can't[/b]
EDF isn't famous for destroying consoles for no good reason, the horizon will be [b]blanketed[/b] with enemies, and explosions will [b]crush[/b] weaker machines. I tried to play this game on my laptop and if I was lucky I could get into a game, only for it to crash when shit really hit the fan.
[b]MAKE SURE YOU CAN RUN THE GAME AND YOU'LL BE FINE[/b]
I have a GTX780 with 16GB of RAM and consistantly run it at 60FPS.
My buddies who have weaker PCs than me also have consistant frame rates.

[h1]Gameplay (multiplayer)[/h1]
Amazing.
If you have friends willing to play this with you It's pretty much a [b]must buy.[/b]
The weapon variety and synergy between the 4 classes bring about a lot of amazing moments in the multiplayer, and even if everyone wants to play the same class, you can make that work too. The scale is huge, the destructability is reminiscent of Mercenaries 2, and every aspect is just over the top. Ever want to drive a baneblade that gets sent backwards through buildings everytime it fires? Well this game has that and a whole bunch more crazy stuff.
Also the voice acting is hilarious. Every time an NPC says something me and my friends always can't help but snicker.
I should probably also mention that the game is done in "missions" that each can take anywhere from a few minutes to roughly a half hour, giving both plenty of missions for drop in quickplay or long hardfought battles.

[h1]Gameplay (singleplayer)[/h1]
It depends how much you value the style of the game.
If you love crazy B-movie story/voice acting/fights a lot then I would say this game is still worth, even if one of the classes aren't very good for singleplayer (Air Raider). 
However if you're looking for an in-depth third-person shooter with gripping singleplayer then this isn't the game for you, at least not at full price. This game is best played with other people, and there are plenty of pubs.

[h1]Story[/h1]
How much you enjoy the story depends on how much you can appreciate the cheesey style of an alien invasion. The game mixes a lot of cheesey comedy with actual dark themes, such as [spoiler] having everyone die.[/spoiler] Which is a perfect mix for me. However if you want a very dark and edgy story of doom and gloom then this isn't really for you.

[h1]Japanese menus[/h1]
Holy shit the menus are bad.
I'm not kidding, they are by far the only downside to this game. It's very clear the developers are new to PC ports.
You will have to get used to using the arrow keys a fair bit, as they are really the easiest way to navigate the menu screens without considering taking a 9mm asprin.

[h1]Conclusion/TL;DR[/h1]
[olist]
    [*]Great multiplayer gameplay
    [*]Alright singleplayer
    [*]Charming character and theme that may or may not be for you. (So bad, it's good!)
    [*]Awful menus. Menu autists stay away.
[/olist]

Did you ever grab some friends, a ton of popcorn/beer and a really cheap B-movie, planning to watch it then tear it to pieces afterwards while you laugh at how horrible it was? But then you've finished it and you all agree that this was actually the best movie you've seen all year, and you wonder what the hell just happened?

This is that feeling in game format.

One moment you play a game with dated console graphics, voice acting so cheesy you can practically smell it, sometimes broken physics and repetitive gameplay.
The next you'll stand in a line with 3 friends and 10 NPCs all of you chanting "EDF!EDF!" over and over while you mow down hundreds of GIANT INSECTS with gatling guns, shout "did you guys see that?!" when an enemy mech brushes past your tank and launches you 500m into the air, laugh maniacally as you punch godzilla knockoffs while you sit in a 100m tall mecha and clear underground nests full of spiders with flamethrowers and napalm grenades.

Play it with friends and you're almost guaranteed to have a blast just because of the over the top ridiculousness of it all.

 →基本的に敵を全部倒せばクリアなので、その過程で建物壊そうが味方を撃とうがOKなスタンス
 ・最初から高難易度に挑める
 →ミッションが進むほど、難易度が高いほど強い武器が出るので、オフで詰まっても前のステージの難易度を上げて高ランク武器を掘ればクリアできる
 ・オンが野良でも楽しい
 →ラグもそれほど感じられず、会話も定型でほとんどなんとかなるので、安心してオンに殴り込める

よくなかったとこ
 ・ストーリーが長い
  →ぶっ続けでやってると極限まで薄めたカルピスをひたすら飲んでいる感覚に陥る
 ・達成度埋めが拷問
 →上の難易度をクリアしたら下も全部埋まる、という事にはならないので、一々簡単なのをやる必要がある
 ・移動がタルい
 →他の兵種には移動を補うテクニックがあるが、レンジャー単体だと転がる以上の事ができないのでFF11もびっくりな移動ゲーにたまになる
 ・アイテム集めがめんどい
 →回復はともかく武器とアーマーまで拾わないといけない
 ・アーマー（最大HP）集めがしんどい
 →一々拾わないといけないのに上昇値が雀の涙な上、増加は拾った兵種のみ
 ・オンでのレベル制限
 →プロマシアもびっくり

結論
 ・オンで敵味方を吹っ飛ばしてEDFできるバカゲーなので買い

宇宙人ども撃滅度、満点！

伝説のアクションシューティング「THE 地球防衛軍」シリーズ第4弾の「地球防衛軍4」の[b]完成版[/b]。
「地球防衛軍3」から8年後…絶滅したはずの巨大生物が突如として出現。人類とフォーリナーの壮絶な戦いが再び始まろうとしていた…！

「地球防衛軍4」はPS3版において深刻なパフォーマンス上の問題を始めとして多くの問題を抱えていたが「4.1」ではその多くを改善している！
[olist]
[*]次世代機パワーにより地球防衛軍シリーズの代名詞とも言えるほどだった「処理落ち」はほとんどなくなった ＼イヤッホー！／
[*]一部の敵が硬すぎたり、武器の威力が低かったりといった、ゲームバランスの問題が改善されてEDF4よりはマトモに遊べるようになった ＼勲章ものだ！／
[*]宇宙怪獣と巨大ロボでバトルできるぞ ＼各機、バトルオペレーション！／
[*]新しい武器、乗り物！ ＼歩兵万歳！／
[*]数多くのミッションからなる圧倒的ボリューム！ ＼まだいるのか！なんて大群だ！／
[/olist]

ただやはり根本的には「4」なのでだめな部分はやはりだめ。それでも大目に見てやれば素晴らしいゲームだ！
1人で遊ぶのもいいけど、このゲームの真価は[strike]残念ながら[/strike]オンライン協力プレイにある。協力して地球を守れ！画面分割でのローカル2人協力プレイもあるぞ！

PS4版と比べて違うところ...
[list]
[*]オンラインモードを遊ぶのにPS+に加入する必要がない（金がかからない）
[*]オンラインモードで地域の隔離を受けない
[*]特典DLCを購入できる
[*]キーボード+マウスで遊べる（WASDはアナログに入力できないので一部の乗り物の操縦が難しいと言われています）
[*]より高い解像度
[*]英語音声も楽しめる
[/list]

[b]地球防衛軍5のPC版も出してくれ、出してくれーーー！！[/b]

27769130.review:
I'll be perfectly honest - so far as story goes, Earth Defense Force isn't going to wow you. The voice acting is ham-fisted, and the dialogue is written poorly. But, as far as I can tell, it was meant to be that way: over-the-top, comedic in how dramatic it is, all the while trying so desperately to take itself seriously. In a way, it's like the Godzilla movies of the past.

And that's part of what makes it so amazing.

Despite how ridiculous the premise of the game really is, and despite how much of a grindfest it can be if you're a completionist like myself, the game is simply.. fun. You'll start to get into tracking down the last few bugs scrambling along the alleyways between buildings in the city. You'll save every pedestrian or soldier caught in the spider webs. You'll feel your heart sink as the edge of the mini-map fills with red dots, signaling a literal tide of giant insects and Ravagers appearing on the horizon. And you'll feel the adrenaline and sense of pride when your fellow soldiers start to sing between skirmishes.

[i]Our soilders are prepared for any alien threats
The Navy launches ships, the Air Force sends their jets
And nothing can withstand our fixed bayonettes
THE E.D.F DEPLOYS![/i]

27751595.review:
This game series was one of my favorite as I was growing up and it all starting with EDF 2017 back on the Xbox 360. That was one my favorite co-op games to play with my little brother and have since beat that game on all difficulty modes and got the Genocide Gun to top off messing around with literally the most powerful weapon in the game.

I only played Insect Armageddon on the 360 for so long before despising it for a number of reasons while admittedly it having good segments and enemies to fight and concepts, overally it proved far too short, shoddy in grind, boring, and even with somewhat a unique take on EDF in a lot of ways was instead just feeling too much of a rushed project with difficulty in landing the EDF mark and feelings I was expecting to get from this game.

Focusing back onto this now, EDF 4.1, I'd have to say it massively improves the lot of its replayability in the usual large amounts of missions, 5 difficulty modes, now with 4 classes to try and master with additionally leveling in the form of better gear and grinding for armour, but overall a fun time to be had! (EDF, EDF, EDF!)

While I do love the game very much, let alone the additional mission packs (avoid the DLC guns and such, that stuff is crap and useful for only Easy/Normal really) add a layer of more to be done, sadly I feel the game lacks in playing alone simply because it can feel very sluggish to get going when on your own and not as much of an experience to me honestly. I mean, it is a wonderful game, even for the lot of its simplicity and cheesy humourous cliche nature, but it is not as noticed when alone when you survive the Ravager Alien Invasion.

Lets try to break this down to make it easier to digest:

Singleplayer and its Classes - While fun at first, it is sluggish and not as fun I guess one might say, particularly if solo-ing as a Ranger or Air Raider class since these two don't get going until later on when they get better gear while Wing Divers and Fencers get to enjoy the additional features that are spectacular to their class earlier and are also more effective in a number of ways solo.

Of course, this can be obviously overlooked when working with allies, one in each class, but this is for singleplayer play and their things will be noticeably taking time to accomplish. If anything, one will have to play in bursts to avoid getting burnt out, but if one can keep themselves entertained between beating missions and the rediculous and hilarious story and character dialogue then all power to you.

Missions and Difficulty - One thing I loved EDF 2017 as I do here is the fact of 5 difficulty modes and nearly 100 missions to play through (over 100 if you count DLC missions that, again, add to the game a lot). My memories of 2017 may be hazy and full of nostalgia but if anything Easy was still its own difficulty with enough weapons to be found to keep things interesting and keep you on a powerful spree of destruction against the Ravager alien threat.

However, Easy Mode in this game should NEVER be played in all reality, Normal gives you the exact same progression only with the Ravagers being somewhat more difficult to fight against but even then it is still relatively easy and capable of one's self to get through it without a sweat.

For achievement hunters/completionists/etc., avoid doing it as well as the only thing this mode gives is a Medal towards beating the missions on Easy but no Achievement (do it still if you desire but I fell in thinking it to be like 2017 but didn't and am dissappointed when I got to Normal and saw nearly no difference between the two modes for weapon drops, enemy difficulty, and so forth).

Co-op, Multiplayer, and the Community - Fair to say that this game is MEANT for co-op/multiplayer play, otherwise it will get more stale then you and I would believe (being said from someone who enjoyed, again, the hell out of 2017). It is a fun time, you will feel that EDF HYPE when you get to mowing with your buds together, coordinating attacks, yelling out "FOR THE PRIDE OF EDF!" or even singing out the lyrics of the EDF song that will just get you going even more!

Additionally, with that, playing again through the game makes it all the more fun, and immersive I guess one might say, and always will be one of the definitive features of playing an EDF game. Just be careful though, unless you don't mind this for whatever your reasons, there are those that will tamper forcefully with your savefile in such a way to make you gain everything in the game and whatever else.

If you want to avoid this sad drawback from the online gaming experience, be sure to keep and update a backup save of your progress somewhere so if you need to, you can restore it before it happened, and continue playing. You will have to do this manually and I recommend searching into it.

The playerbase is small, no doubt for its rather niche nature and the likes, but if you can get some personal friends of yours in on this then it can be very much negligible a problem as co-op offline or online is nonetheless a way to play this game.

The DLC Content - Coming back to a lot of mention of DLC, there is such, thankfully to a degree the first mission pack funny enough is made up of the DLC 1 and 2 Packs from the console version, a free 2-in-1 deal sort with Pack 3 made then into Pack 2, and making it somewhat cheaper to get it all. I feel it is definitely worth getting it if you have money to spare and want more challenges and awesome unexpected fights to go through, solo or with friends/online co-op!

Just, please, avoid any and all DLC gear/weapons/vehicles/etc, it is NOT worth whatever it offers and is simply cash grabs, even if minor in price, it is useless these items past Easy/Normal and will make you loathe about spending that money on such rather than say the cards to get yourself maybe a nice Award Medal thing for your Steam Page to show your EDF Pride!

Atmosphere, Music, Locations, and All Else - Needless to say, the game, like earlier, is cliche, very much, but it does it with great pride and enjoyment in the easy-going nature of it and makes it more fun and kick-ass than serious and moody (as perhaps a real invasion of such an alien threat might as well be). Of course it is given by the characters of such but it is so cliche you can't help but just go along with it for the sake of hilariousness and act along with the rediculous way it is like.

The music of the soundtrack will be repeated in missions throughout, no way of avoiding it, but doubt there is much to really say against it since the game is very simple in design and such to where perhaps it is hard to complain of it (or that I don't bother too much with it since a lot of the time the music is used to give idea of cliche moments/missions/locations that will fit to what is going on). I don't know really, guess I didn't pay attention enough, or just went with what it had to offer in this regard.

Locations, damn man, yes, you may complain how there is but a small, small handful of areas that are used in the game, and are HEAVILY reused over and over again except in different starting positions of each mission. One may fairly gripe about this but it gave what it had to offer and did somewhat improve in how destructible some buildings are versus others. A lot of these negatives could perhaps be attributed to its maybe small budget as a small series of games and instead it focusing more on the player having a good time with the variety of ever-newly-gained weapons throughout missions and difficulty modes and spend it with other people too even.

Conclusion - Take what I said as you will, research it too as while I might enjoy the simple EDF career of what I got and its minor improvements and drawbacks, it is still what I wanted in the end to be honest but can always be better. Get it on sale at least though, it will take past 2 hours get to the good stuff in the game+DLC.
