25416877.review:
If you are a pretentious snob who thinks video games are supposed to be pieces of art, full of cutscenes, cinematics that rival Kwaiden and a plot that attempts to rival Citezen Kane, go away. This game might be too fun to be good. Go play another walking simulator. 

For normal people who play video games for entertainment this is one of the best video games to come out in at least the last decade. Earth Defense Force 2025 (A.K.A 4.1) is an unpretentious, pure, and wonderfully absurd third person shooter that pits the EDF against an evil alien threat hell-bent on conquering earth with an army of giant insects and building-sized alien robots. It's a game that combines Starship Troopers, classic Toho films, with a dash of  a (more or less)Power Rangers vibe. From it's gameplay to it's gleefully cheesy dialouge EDF never once forgets that it's a entertainment product first and foremost. 

EDF if you have never played it before, is about fighting large waves of enemies using a vast array of destructive weapons, in a fully destructible 3D envoirnment. Essentially the closest you can get to a modern 3D equivalent of Robotron 2084. And there are a lot of weapons. Different character classes can carry a different number into battle, for example a Ranger can carry two weapons, and you choose them before starting a mission. Weapons range from assault rifles, to missile launchers, even rocket launchers that can annihillate an entire city block with one shot.  The game has 4 character classes each with it's own strengths.

-The Ranger- He is your generic soldier whom is mostly unremarkable, but the most well balanced class. He has decent move speed, and a dodge roll. He has access to the more conventional weapons and is the best class to start playing the game at until you unlock better missions for armor/weapon farming for the other classes.

-The Wing diver- She is the most mobile but the least armored. She can fly around the battlefield and rain death from above. Unfortuanately the Wing Diver has a an energy meter that decreases as she flies, and this meter is also used to reload many of her weapons

-The Fencer-Initially starts out near useless because of his starting weapons and abnoxiously slow move speed. He needs to utilize jump jets to get around at an acceptable level. The trade off? He can get some of the most powerful weapons in the game. He also has the quickest armor gain.

Air Raider- A support oriented class, not as good in direct combat, but he is the only one who can call in vehicles.

A lot of missions have minor updates and there are a couple of new missions. They added the Kaiju and "Walking Fortresses" from 2017. A few new vehicles as well, and a mech.

There's only two issues witht the game I have.

1.Most weapons are blatantly better than others.

2.Unlike in 2017 you can NOT use vehicles unless you are a Air Raider, or are playing co-op and have an Air raider to request vehicles. It would have been nice if they could have added pre-placed unpiloted vehicles in single player to use if you are playing as a Ranger, and there is only one mission that I know of where you can pilot a vehicle. And that one be one of the several new missions, there is one that you get to use the new mech.

Easily recomennded to anyone who enjoys japanese monster movies, cheesy movies in general, fast paced arcade action, and games that are fun above all else.

So I've played EDF 2025 on ps3 all the way through on my own, and it was pretty fun. I wasn't planning on getting EDF 4.1, but my friend did me an egg and bought it for me so we could co-op.

If you've ever played an EDF game, you know what you're getting into, but if you haven't, don't go in with the expectation of it being a perfect game. It's not a AAA title, it's not polished at all. It's frustrating, the difficulty can spike randomly for certain levels, it doesn't look good, the AI is dumb. But don't worry about all that because above all the game is FUN. It's like a B movie. For all it's flaws it has a certain charm. Some days you might throw a controller because you just can't stop getting grabbed by ants, but other days that won't matter because "HOLY SHIT DID YOU SEE THE SIZE OF THE MISSILE I JUST DROPPED ON THAT THING, THAT WAS AWESOME".

YMMV, but certainly be prepared to give the series a chance, because you might love it, not only in spite of, but because of all it's flaws

25408073.review:
This is the best EDF game to date.  I have played the majority of the EDF games on the consoles including EDF 4.1 on the PS4 and they all suffer from slowdown... horrible slowdown.  This version of the game does not!  I cannot even begin to explain the joy of seeing a franchise actually reach its' potential on the PC over consoles.

Anywho, The gameplay is as it looks in the screenshots, aliens and bugs controlled by aliens are attacking and you and up to three others must deploy to stop them!

The only flaws are: 
- The lobby system is kind of a mess
- alien attacks can clip thru buildings to hit you (A major pain when dealing with large spiders)
- weapons do not scale down - meaning if you have a lvl 90 explode all things gun and you go back to a easy lvl that caps weapons at 5, you have to switch to a different weapon between lvl 0-5.
- no quick way to disable voice chat.  If you restrict chat it does turn off voice chat but also disables keyboard inputs. Outside of that you have to select the player in the lobby and mute their mic (steam auto enables mics for games with no disable feature)
- A big flaw of the game is no joining on the fly, new players have to wait until the game returns to lobby for a repeat or next level.  They can set items/chat however, they cannot join in.  So sometimes you will see a bunch of people join and quit as you go thru a match.


Should you own this game?
If you love B movie cheese and sifi goodness then YES.  They have rounded out the character classes in this version and you can now summon tanks, aircraft, mechs, bombing runs, arty strikes .... it can turn the game into a Micheal Bay wet dream of explosions!!!! and depending on your system, all in glorious 60FPS+.

Now I know about insects more than I'd like.

The trailers should already give you a good idea of what to expect.
You just go out there and shoot a buttload of bugs. Everything is super campy and fun.

What I probably like the most is the growing sense of scale and epicness.
Right on the first stage, you have to deal with a huge ant swarm. Then with each passing mission it slowly but surely ramps up on the things you have to deal with, until your whole screen is filled with nothing but bugs. You feel like a badass for completing it, until it gets a lot worse on the next mission.

The game also gets exponentially better if you have friends to play with you, so get as much people as you can to play this game!

So yes, I highly recommend buying it. At the very least, we may convince Sandlot / D3 to release more EDF games here on Steam in the future.

25397096.review:
Update:

This is why the game is at overwhlemingly positive, because anyone who posts a negative review is downvoted to oblivion for their opinion. It's a shame because no real discussion can occur on the quality of the game when there's a huge mob mentality like this.

If you disagree, then comment and we can discuss it.

--

This is not the kind of game you will be playing for the story, the characters or the environments.

This is the kind of game you will be playing for the thrill of facing overwhelming hordes of insects and gunning them down with a massive variety of weapons. 

During the times where it feels like a literal wave of insects is about to overwhelm you, as they climb across buildings and charge towards you in massive groups, EDF is at its best. It is in these moments where you will experience a rush of adrenaline and feel a strange mix of desperation and euphoria as you work to fight off enemies in their hundreds. Never have I played a game like this where all of the most common individual adversaries are at least ten times bigger than the player character. It is that mix of scale and sheer enemy numbers that contribute to the unique feeling mentioned earlier.

However.
This is not the kind of game for you if you do not enjoy constant grinding.
This is not the kind of game for you if you want balanced classes.
This is not the kind of game for you if you care about detailed levels or passable AI.

In addition, while the PC port is acceptable, one detail I do not understand is how or why menus can only be navigated with the keyboard alone. There is no mouse support until you load in to an actual level.

This is the kind of game where you zone out and blast hordes of insects, and while that certainly has its moments of euphoria in the most intense engagements, everything else begins to feel like a chore as you work hard towards that next big moment.

To address the common retort to any criticism of this game, no, playing for hours up to "Mission 26" or "Mission 28" or wherever the community commonly states it becomes amazing at, is not a valid defence.

I do see the appeal of this game, and priced less I would certainly recommend it to others with some choice warnings to heed. However, at the current price, this will be a no from me.

25364638.review:
コンシューマー発のTPSゲーム。
オーソドックスだが汎用性があるレンジャー、空中を飛行し近距離で火力を発揮するウィングダイバー、
硬いアーマーと武器を四つ装備できるフェンサー、ビークルを操り空爆等の範囲攻撃を得意とするエアレイダーの
四種類の兵科で銃火器を敵を殲滅していくという内容。

難易度が五段階あり、EASYやNORMAL等は暴れているだけでもクリア出来るが、
難易度が上昇しHARD辺りからは兵科に合った動きや戦略が必要になってくる。

キャラクターの強化は武器と体力（アーマーポイント）のみで、
敵を撃破した際にドロップするアイテムで体力を強化し、武器を集めていくシステムだ。
難易度によって敵の攻撃力も相応に上がっていくので、段階を踏んで次の難易度に挑んでいく必要がある。

やり込み要素としては前述した五種類の難易度制覇、そしてEDFシリーズ恒例の武器収集がある。
武器は説明にも有るとおり800種類程あり、全てランダムドロップ。
強い武器の入手はやはり難易度の高いステージに行く必要がある。

理不尽とも思える物量作戦で敵が押し寄せてくる為、
一気に吹き飛ばそうと思ってもTKありのシステムなので留意する必要があるし、
サポート装備もあるが有効に使うには味方に伝えないと難しい。
色々な面で連携が必要になる。

AIMはある程度あれば問題無いと思われるが、
難易度が上がると敵の動きが早くなるので狙撃等を行う際は注意。
苦手ならば範囲攻撃武器等で補おう。

友人とのプレイにはうってつけのCOOPゲームと言える。
野良はVCをしない人が多いが、その分ラジオチャットが賑やかなので割とノリで楽しめる筈だ。
また、ソロでも十分楽しめるのでソロゲーとして買っても良いかも知れない。
ソロオンリーの人も多い筈。

ネックなのは値段であり、元々コンシューマーのフルプライスとはいえ5000円はSteamでは割と高い部類に入る。
セールが来るかは今後分からないが、値段相応の楽しさはあるので買って損はしないと思う。

25362293.review:
[h1]TLDR - EDF!! EDF!!![/h1]

EDF4.1 is a very fun game that doesn't trip over itself in attempt to offer the world (or, well, a more serious/immersive experience). Despite the premise and title of the game, it is usually quite lighthearted. This is due to a mixture of enjoyably eye-rolling NPC banter, and mission scenes/commentary that would be right at home in a budget alien invasion movie. The shadow of new despair, yet most EDF soldiers appear to be overly content and upbeat, often discussing meals and marriages on the battlefield.

The gameplay is pretty simple - mainly made up of you shooting things, or calling in things that will assist you in your bid to shoot things, and/or helping others in their struggle to shoot various things. The result? Explosions, pretty lasers, crumblings buildings, and flying bodies are all a common sight here - so you'll likely be finding yourself reviving people a lot, or in need of some medical attention yourself. Especially on the harder difficulties, which can genuinely be a challenge, many of the most sedate-seeming missions are a bullet-hell environment on Hardest/Inferno difficulties. Generally more enemies with higher health is a bad way to increase difficulty, but it works in EDF. The enemy behaviours do change slighty, they become more aggressive and dangerous, but you can also make yourself expontially more dangerous too through the equpping of unlocked weapons (and blood doping too).

The game is separated into Online and Singleplayer modes - with singleplayer mode offering split-screen co-op. There are 4 very unique classes to play as, with separate pools of collectible weapons and armour (health). To level up your classes, you pickup armour/weapon drop boxes in-game (red/green drops). Higher difficulties and later missions generally tend to give better weapon loot. There are 4 difficulties to play as, and progress is tracked independantly for each of the 4 classes, and missions progress is also kept separate from online and singleplayer modes - however armour and weapon loot is shared between the 2 modes.

There is a large range of weapons/equipment to obtain - these will help you shoot things and increase the enjoyability of shooting those things. It also makes for some collecting to be done - and if you want to 100% the missions, you need to play each one 16 times! Yes that sounds like a chore, but the beauty of the game isn't in chores, but in it's gameplay - which is fun in singleplayer, and exactly 3 times more fun in multiplayer. Although in singleplayer you can player the easier difficultyies without a weapon level limit, making for some really brutal insect fumigation.

Improvement areas do exist with EDF4.1, despite all my positive feedback. My personal annoyances mainly revolve around the ranger's general lack of movement options - the fastest way to move being to roll at 45-degree angels, and yes this means literally looking away from where you want to move. I tell a lie, actually you could launch yourself into the sky with a high-powered sniper rifle, so there's that.. All my other personal annoyances are tied into the UI, being general UI layout/limitations and some UI related bugs. The gameplay is largely robust though which is good, i've only ran into 2 gameplay bugs that required us to restart the mission. Unlike some games, you don't have to linger in the menus for long.

25360813.review:
Schnell einzusteigen und 98 Missionen zu spielen mit zusammenhängenden Plot. Dazu 5 Schwierigkeitsgrade und Levellimits damit man anderen nicht den Spaß verdirbt. Verbunden mit 4 Klassen ergibt das 98x5x4= ~2.000 Missionen zu spielen, wer 100 % completion haben will. 

Das Game ist einfach gehalten aber es ist gerade diese Einfachheit die dafür sorgt, dass man einfach Spaß hat. Es ist zwar schade, dass es das Spiel nicht auf deutsch gibt, aber das english ist leicht zu verstehen.  Etwas überteuert würde das Spiel mir holen, wenn es so im Bereich 20-25€ ist. DLC weapons sind eher optional (low level waffen), die DLC Missions sind für leute die die 2.000 Missionenmarke fast erreicht haben. 
Achja: Offline und Online modus sind separat, wer will kann also ~4.000 Missionen einmalig absolvieren^^

25349055.review:
From EDF 2017 to now, the game has only improved. However, as where I liked EDF 2017 for the 360 I have to say...

THIS GAME IS WORTH ITS PRICE. 

That is something I rarely say, so hear me out.

Pros:
CONTENT! There is a lot to do, especially if you are looking for 100% and even if you aren't there are so many missions and difficulties to do and the anticipation of new weapons can easily keep you going and make harder levels worthwhile.

ENEMIES! There is a good amount of variety in the enemy types. To even throwing in some Mutant enemies on Inferno difficulty, This makes the game a blast to play, but at the same time, the start is limited in enemy types to help the player get into the game.

DIFFICULTY! The Difficulty is handled VERY WELL in this game. Some levels are against massive hordes while some are against special targets or bosses. On each difficulty setting, the enemies' health and damage scale really nicely as to give you a good margin of error on normal and easy, but to punish you for getting hit on the harder difficulties.

COOP! This is a big thing I like. Playing with others. If a game can have an amazing single-player game, then if they can do it right, they can have a far superior Multiplayer experience. EDF 4.1 NAILED IT! You can bring your friends in to help you clear the game in a multiplayer lobby. And it runs really well! There are also items that work well in conjunction with one another for much more of an advantage against the waves of enemies!

CONS:

UNSTABLE! This is really the only bad thing I have to say about it. Sometimes in multiplayer lobbies, when loading a mission the game will get stuck on connecting with the other players, dropping everyone out of the lobby. Probably just a small coding oversight but it can get annoying. Even if it doesn't happen all that often.




_______________

All in all, EDF 4.1 stays true to the series, a run&gun third person shooter with a lot of variety of weapons for dispatching HUNDREDS of enemies in a very well done atmosphere that gives a sense of urgency!

Will you pick up your weapons and join the Earth Defense force?

25326204.review:
I'll start this by saying that when it comes to video games, I'm a very transient person. Typically I'm the person that'll play a game for a couple dozen hours, drop it, and typically not pick it back up. A few games that have managed to hook me in the past/present were/are Counter Strike:Source, Diablo 2, Path of Exile, World of Tanks, Dragon's Dogma, Warframe (Pre-Pushover DE), Dungeon Siege 2, KOTOR, SWAT 4... And a couple more I can't remember.
Long story short, it's very rare that a game grabs me and keeps me in, and I've played many hundreds of games over the years. Many very good games, too. Many games that claimed great replayability.
But this one hits all the right notes in all the right ways, and I can firmly say is WORTH the hefty price tag.
---------------
Now, let's get into an actual review. There are 4 classes for you to choose from: Ranger, Wing Diver, Air Raider, and Fencer. I'll say that Wing Diver is my least favorite class to play... But it's still a blast to play Wing Diver. Each class in this game has its niche and play style, and such a varied arsenal that you just want to play each class just to see what they can get.
----- Classes -----
Ranger is your standard foot-soldier type class, with a very variable arsenal, their weapon classes as such: Assault Rifles, Shotguns, Sniper Rifles, Rocket Launchers, Missile Launchers, Grenade Launchers, and other miscellaneous weapons/tools. This would including healing tools, flamethrowers, and other weapons that don't quite fit into the other categories.
Ranger's specific attributes entail that he can jump, roll (through light obstacles), has the 2nd-place armor scaling, has two weapon slots, can pilot vehicles, and has the fastest normal recovery time to get up off the ground after being knocked down.
-----
Wing Diver is the class I know the least about, but I still know enough to give a decent overview.
Wing Diver has a flight-frame that runs on a power-pack that'll allow you to fly around at a good clip for a decent bit of time, however, a good deal of their weapons draw from the very same power pool, so one has to be mindful of their energy consumption. Their arsenal's theme is very high-tech weaponry, such as laser, electronic, and mind-guided missiles.
Wing Divers have access to the following in their arsenal: Short-Range lasers, Mid-Range lasers, Mid-Range Electric, Particle Cannons, Sniping Weapons, Other Ranged Attacks (Such as plasma-bombers and grenades,) Homing Weapons, and other Special Weapons that don't fit in the rest. This class has weapons that can cover just about any range, but I'd say they're more-so specialized for Close Quarters and are proficient up to mid range, however they have powerful tools for long range as well.
Their specific attributes are that they can fly, have the least armor scaling of the 4 classes, can use a bit of power to burn their thrusters and recover from a ragdoll knockup/knockdown, has two weapon slots, can NOT pilot vehicles, and probably some other stuff I don't know.
-----
Air Raider, my personal favorite class, is the support class of this game. While he doesn't have much in the way of direct-attack, (being limited to "Limpet Guns" which are basically remote-trigger grenade launchers,) He has access to a powerful arsenal of air/sea support and vehicles to draw from.
Air Raider's arsenal goes as such: Guidance Equipment (Such as laser-designators for homing weapons,) Calling for Support, Support Equipment (Such as buffs, heals, and power-rechargers for Wing Divers,) Limpet Guns, Stationary Weapons (Such as C4, Sentry Guns, Claymores, AA Mines, etc,) and other Special Weapons such as razor-wire launchers, decoys, and electromagnetic shield systems.
They also have an equipment slot for a vehicle of choice, which can range from tanks, to AFVs, to SPGs, to Helicopters, to Hard-Suits, to a giant rock'em-sock'em robot.
Air-Raider's particular attributes are that they can pilot vehicles, have 3rd-place armor-scaling, and have laser-designator tools that grant/assist functionality of the other classes homing weapons.
-----
Fencer has a super-heavy exo-suit which allows them to use heavy-weaponry, and at that, dual-wield them. It's also the most technical/skill demanding class of the game, having many mechanics and caveats.
Their arsenal goes as such: CQB Striking weapons (Hammers, Swords, etc,) CQB Piercing weapons (Spears, auto-spears, etc,) Shields, Automatic Artillery, Artillery, and Missile Launchers.
While they have the least weapon categories, don't let that fool you. What goes under "Auto Arty/Arty" is a very diverse cast of weaponry, such as autocannons, gatling guns, heavy machine guns, cannon-shot, mortars, etc. Missile Launchers, while some of them are personally usable, the heavier ones are crew-served, requiring an Air Raider to designate targets to grant them functionality.
Fencer is the only class that has access to shields, which are what makes them able to be tanky. Shields come in different flavors, such as ones that are focused on re-directing ranged attacks, focused on giving you wide-angle protection, focused on high damage-reduction, etc.
Fencer's particular attributes are that they can carry two sets of two weapons, can bull-doze through obstacles, and have a very tricky to master ability to use the thrusters some weapons grant them to recover from knockdowns.
Something important to bare in mind about Fencers, is that due to the heavy-weight of their ranged weaponry, they are very unweildy and have slow, dragged out aiming. Dual weilding ranged weapons amplifies this effect, making it very difficult to use them proficiently, but still very possible with practice.
----- Gameplay -----
I'll say that I'm only on mission 47 of the standard online campaign, but it's to my understanding that, DLC not-withstanding, there are... I believe 90+ missions, with 5 different difficulties, so there's PLENTY of game time and replayability to be had.
This is a Third-Person shooter game, with an arcade-y feel, and a big focus on co-op gameplay, supporting sessions of up to 4 players, with a solo-mode as well. Enemy health scales with the amount of players ingame.
Let me tell you, that the difficulties aren't just what you'd expect them to be. You actually need to come prepared with a respectable arsenal from the lower difficulties first. The higher the difficulty, the more health your enemies have, the more deadly their attacks (Both in damage dealt, and in functionality,) and the faster they are. This game does difficulty very well, and doesn't just give them more and more HP... It adds a progressively more challenging gameplay that requires you to be prepared, both as a player with skills and logistics, and with your classes' weaponry.
The missions you play in vary, from wide-open mountains and/or fields, to cityscape, to underground tunnels and caves. It's to be noted that Air Raider's Support doesn't work underground, and only particular vehicles can be called in.
This game has a way of really imersing you into the atmosphere; from the battle-banter of your NPC allies (A+ for having NPCs under your command singing along with you and responding to your emotes,) commander, and mission handler on the comms; really making you feel tiny as you behold your gigantic enemies, in the hundreds and hundreds that you're tasked with eradicating in each and every mission; and the way the lighting plays with the underground environments is something I have never seen in any other game before... It's both beautiful and distressing at the same time.
---------------
I could go into details about some other junk that doesn't really matter, such as graphics, sound, controls, yadda yadda, but I'll simply say that this game does it all RIGHT. It hits all the right notes, and the controls perform exactly as you'd expect them to.
All said and done, this game gets a resounding 10/10 from me.

25319347.review:
Do you like the idea of a game where you don't have to think too much, but just get to blast away at hordes of huge enemies with anything from lasers to explosive plasma blasts to lightning guns?
Where you can wreck the environment, causing more explosions and turning more skyscrapers into rubble than a Michael Bay movie?

Then this game is for you.

The basics of the games is this: Earth is being invaded by giant insects, arachnoids, alien spaceships, giant robots and more. Are these things connected? Who cares? Just let HQ worry about that while you mop up the enemy forces to the sound of your fellow soldiers singing songs about the EDF.

Graphics are not exactly top notch, but I suppose that's the tradeoff for having such huge scale battles. There's a city map, for example, with skyscrapers tall enough to make me want to avoid the edge just because the height makes my self-preservation reflexes kick in XD

There are 4 classes to play and 5 difficulties. Normal starts off relatively easy, but ramps up quite a bit during the midgame missions. It's what I played through the entire game at, though I did have to go back to some earlier missions on higher difficulties to get the weapon drops I needed to overcome certain levels.

It took me about 24 hours to go through all the missions on Normal difficulty (not counting DLC missions) with the flying Wing Diver class, which was a ton of fun. I expect I'll try one of the other classes soon to see how they play.
I also spent something like 2 hours in multiplayer with a friend. The multiplayer lobby system is a bit clunky, but once you're in a game together it seems to work just fine.

Music is overall fine, though it seemed a bit uneven in volume depending on where you were in relation to the action (could be someting with my system, I guess). The voice acting feels just cheesy enough to fit in a game like this. The ragdolling can be quite hilarious depending on what weapons are used, but seeing a ~8 meters tall robot flying off in 4 different direction after an airstrike hardly ever gets old :)

TLDR: It's like an 80s/90s B-movie - the game. Starship Troopers meets Independence Day, only turned up to 11.

25244293.review:
EDF is a game that takes its story and characters and puts them off to the side for the sake of dropping you right in and letting you have fun in your bug blasting, building toppling mayhem simulator.

The story feels like a very intentionally crafted Sci-Fi b-movie you'd find on at 11pm on a Wednesday night which works perfectly since the story really only exists to offer up some reactions to "Oh no, there's spiders now!"

The playstyle is incredibly arcadey and really shines once you start piling up your hoard of weapons. You'll start off with basic stuff like rifles and rocket launchers that feel really tame, but by the end that rifle will shoot in a V shape with bouncing bullets reflecting all over a small tunnel that turns into a tornado of ant death while your friend is summoning the not-Megazord to punch not-Godzilla in the mouth.

The only real negative I can give this game is that as a single player experience it feels somewhat lacking. The gameplay doesn't change in any way, the missions don't gain or lose anything nor do you (unless you're playing the Fencer class that has a few weapons that require an Air Raider present), but the game just feels -right- as a co-op experience. The satisfaction of coordinating your efforts to land that PERFECT hit on a group of enemies just feels so rewarding that going back to playing solo almost feels dull by comparison.

Ideally, get a few friends together, kick back and enjoy the ride that EDF has to offer. If you can't talk your friends into it, jump into a game online and go nuts. It's a game worth picking up even at full price, you'll get more time out of your money than many other games will give you.

25236497.review:
Если вкратце - неплохая стрелялка про то как на людишек понабежало всякого типа огромных муравьев, пауков, мегароботов пришельцев и тп. Даже местный аналог годзиллы пожаловал в гости. И вот нам предстоит гонять всю эту нечисть в течении скольки-то там миссий.

Огромный корабль пришельцев сносящий своим мегалазером по десятку домов за раз пока толпа муравьев переростков вместе со злобными летучими роботами гоняет тебя по подворотням - это EDF. Разрушаемость имеется, кое где начиная бой в городе со временем этот самый город превращается в ровную площадку с кучками цемента ;) Как и обещано в стимовской аннотации есть четыре класса доступных для игры: просто солдат, тип призывающий всякую технику и авиаудары, тип в мегаброне и с огромными пушками и летающая девочка. Ворох всяких пушек, ракетниц и непонятной фигни для уничтожения всего подряд (включая союзников, френдлифаер чтоб его) присутствует. Стартуем миссию и валим врагов пачками, вот такое вот простое и в тоже время затягивающее развлечение. А еще присутствует кооператив на четырех игроков. Это вообще лютый режим, вражины прут толпами, кто-то суммонит огромный танк, кто-то стреляет из ракетницы как из пулемёта, взрывы всюду и над всем этим безобразием парит та самая летающая девочка.

С точки зрения графики игра так себе (но и не отвратно, вполне себе даже, просто современные хиты планку графония задрали прилично), тяжелое приставочное прошлое сказывается. В принципе смотрим скрины и делаем для себя выводы. Но зато все без единого намека на тормоза даже когда взрывы на весь экран. Кооператив по старинке сделан, создаем лобби и ждем когда кто-то туда подсоединится или сами к кому подсоединяемя. Собрались, тыкнули готов и вперед воевать. Никаких систем автоматически собирающих игроков по четыре не обнаружено. 

Вкратце - если хотите бодренькую стрелялку, то берите. Что может быть лучше чем взорвать десяток муравьев-мутантов залпом плазмапушки или лично дать годзилле по его наглой роже.

THIS IS RAVAGER EXPERT OHARA, I WILL LEND YOU MY EXPERTISE IN GIANT INSECTS.

Do you want more missiles than you have any need for? Of course you do.

5 Difficulties that change the damage, health, behaviour values and abilities of the enemies, and adding extra variants and more waves to the same mission.

A crapton of missions with tons of replayability, you will be fighting bugs, dragons, mechs, spaceships, mechs, discount macross space fortresses, super giant dragons, mechs, super giant bugs, space doomsday flying saucers that cover up the sky, mechs, discount war of the worlds walkers, flying dooblidoos and probably more things.

Buildings are also evil and we must deal with them.

AVOID ALL THE WEAPON AND VEHICLES DLC, AS IT CAN BE ACQUIRED INGAME IN THE FORM OF UPGRADED AND MORE USEFUL VERSIONS OF THE EXACT SAME THING.

8.5/10

Cons: 
Team Ai will make you want to strangle someone.
Team fire can not be turned off. So be careful who you play with.
levels give you little to no time to pick up loot after completing. 
PS2 graphics, gameplay and physics (though the physics are amazingly funny)
You'll need some processing power to get through some levels
Possible Seizure warning. 
Annoying controls on some of the machines. 
Sub-par story. 

Pros:
Multiplayer (and split screen)
Way longer than expected. 
Tons of weapons for all four classes, most of which have their own behaviors.
All four classes are unique in their own way. 
The game can range between Massively easy and stupidly unforgiving.
Better rewards for finishing on more difficult settings. 
Grand scale fights (several hundred maybe thousands on some maps).
Old school run and gun combat with new processing power.

First off let me say that I was completely blown away by this game. I managed to get it on sale a few months back (and didn't realise it was on sale), and thought that it was going to be a fun little time killer, but when i started racking up 20+ hours into it and it showed no sign of stopping and the levels slowly became less and less forgiving. I knew I had picked up a jem. The progress menu doesn't even display how many different types of enemies there are in the game until you encounter them. 

The game's graphics are underpar but it'll still give your computer a little work out with just how many enemies that you'll run into constantly. After playing through each class I found that the air raider could "summon" mech type machines, and from there the game turned into a "starship troopers, meets godzilla and war of the world's vs me and my mini mechwarrior."  

The multiplayer can be a little finicky at times but having four people in game with you is a nonstop blast (puns for days) and with the highest difficulty setting the game seems to ramp even higher with the more people you have. 

By the end of the game I felt like a true war hero that saves the day from a world ending event. Definitely a game that i will keep installed just to have a bloody good time.

25199221.review:
Before I start, I gotta mention some caveats here that may dissuade some from buying. Mind you this game is stupid fun and quite frankly, I think a lot of these actually adds quite a bit to the charm. However I must, because I know people tend to hate these things, which is not  unreasonable.

1) It is janky, physics, some controls, animations,ect.
2) Menus don't have mouse support (but really it's not that bad to navigate), and multiplayer menus have some optimization issues.
3) Load times are somewhat (though not ridiculously) long
4) There is a grinding element. Though I'm fine with it because you grind weapons and HP directly, not XP, not credits, or anything like that, just weapons and armor from drops. Though to be perfectly honest other than maybe health, it's not really required and you'll more than likely get what you need for the next difficulty level after you finish the one you are on.
5) Mics are ALWAYS on! (though you can set it to "Off" in the lobby, bear in mind this disables text chat but not quick-chat)
6) Check your system specs, some people have reported problems with certain hardware configurations. To my knowledge the dev's know about this. (Me personally, Audio gets a little messed up in some firefights)

Ok that's out of the way, lets get to it! (EDIT: Wasn't terribly happy about the first review I pushed up here, decided to trim it down a bit and structure it better)

The premise: A Japanese game development studio one night watched too many B-Movies and Kaiju films and decided to make a game out of it, and this is the result. It also contains, to my knowledge, the greatest gaming moment ever.

That moment is leading your squad in the EDF fight song*, which is a hillarious rewrite of the Battle Hymn of the Republic, while mowing down swarms of bugs, robots, and whatever the heck these aliens feel like throwing down at you, and you do this with some of gaming's most ridiculous weaponry. That is what makes EDF awesome in a nutshell.

There's also hillariously unrealistic physics (Try rocket jumping with a Ranger), intentionally bad localization and Voice acting ("Progress faster than science is impossible!" among MANY more like that), city blocks being leveled in order to save the city, and LOTS of content! 800 weapons almost 100 Missions, and that's WITHOUT DLC

Now sing the EDF Fight song with me! (*Unless you are a wing diver, apparently they are forbidden to sing, I assume so the ravagers cannot hear them while they silently drop upon their foes)

1-1 To save our Mother Earth from any alien attack!

25140891.review:
Awesome.

Single player gameplay can be a little shallow, as each stage is usually either very easy, or impossible. It's uncommon (but occasional) to find a stage where you can avoid defeat through skill and practice. However, the gameplay has a pure entertainment value in its point-and-shoot gameplay and doesn't depend on its challenge factor.

The loot system feels limited, as you get a flood of new weapons when you can begin to manage finishing levels at the next difficulty setting; then you have a long stretch of getting no new weapons until the next difficulty setting is feasible.

100% completion seems to be having each mission completed with each character class (x4) at each difficulty level (x5). The Easy difficulty just seems like a waste of time in this regard.

Multiplayer is decent; and offers a chance to use character classes and weapons that look interesting/fun but aren't optimal in single player. It could have a bit more incentive/depth, and better matchmaking.

25125396.review:
PREREQUISITES 
(1) A friend or two or three
(2) A healthy sense of humour and taste for the absurd 
(3) A juvenile appreciation of titanic explosions, godzilla-scale destruction and B-movies

EDF is one of the most entrancing yet mystifying series in all of video games. A mechanical analysis of the game would center around its most prominent 'flaws': 
- 80 missions with no coherent context, featuring similar city-scape sandboxes and nonsensical underground burrows
- Glitchy physics where giant bugs are propelled across the sky by your explosive weapons
- Hundreds of unlockable weapons and vehicles, many of which are broken to the point of being useless 
- Voice tracks of screaming soldiers and moronic scientists that have no correlation to what's happening on screen 
An analysis of systems and function would pronounce this game a dismal failure, and leave it there. 

But only someone with no joy in their soul could miss the forrest for the trees and misdiagnose this game as anything other than a spectacular success. Every glitchy giant ant that you propel into the stratosphere is cause for mad giggling. Every weapon unlock is a thrilling lottery - you might find an orbital ion cannon painter that vaporises swarms of bugs, or you might be gifted a hilariously useless assault rifle that sprays two lines in a horizontal V pattern. Your vehicle unlock could be a colossal megazord mech that punches the freak out of elastic Michelin man alien robots, or it could be a motorbike with a side-car featuring the worst turning of anything ever coded. But in the spirit of mad experimentation, you'll jump into it anyway with your friends, and barrel into swarms of hopping tarantulas, cackling like maniacs. 

Somehow you'll survive, with the city you've been entrusted to save now just flattened rubble. All civilians massacred. Your commanders over radio will declare your mission an unqualified triumph, and you will be whisked off to your next mission. Alien orb motherships loom ominously in the sky, dropships spew streams of ants, moronic attack drone swarms bumble and richochet off buildings as they attempt to strafe you with lazer globs. But you will hang your head high, knowing that you have nothing to fear. You are the EDF - the finest Earth has to offer against the alien menace. And you will emerge victorious. 

Play this fucking game.

25123312.review:
I grew with my family in Alamogordo New Mexico which was close to where Atomic bombs used to be tested in the 50's and 60's.  There were a few movies based on the nuclear fallout that caused mutations in insects - ants in particular.

As a kid growing up near the place where these A-bomb tests took place, my parents would sometimes tell me as we were driving through the desert that those hills were where those giant ants came from and that the would come and get me if I wasn't a good boy.  I remember cowering in fear in the rear seat, peeking over the door ever so slightly hoping that I wouldn't see a silhouette of an ant in the distance.  To this day, I have a fear of giant ants and also Colonel Sanders, but that is a story for a different review.

Earth Defense Force is about taking my childhood fears and dropping my own A-bomb or whatever I choose to use in my arsenal of collectable weapons to wipe out those hauting memories of giant ants, spiders or whatever else my parents might have conjured up to keep me in check.  While you're at it, take out half of Tokyo pretending you're a small scale WMD or just a walking Godzilla who uses guns and rocket launchers.  

I'm a good boy mommy, I really am.  Don't let those giant ants get me...  

Oh and there are tons of missions and different classes to interact and play as, something about an action shooter game in there as well.

25105880.review:
從第一代開始玩，包括psv版本都全收，終於可以在電腦上到，感動！
已擁有PS4版，今次PC版優化非常好，全開最高畫質穩定FPS60
PS4版本在大爆破會非常卡，PC版則完全沒問題，縱使已擁有PS4版也值得入手

四個兵種，四種挑戰
陸戰兵：適合初手，武器種類豐富，對付大部份任務沒難度；可以帶兵，吃藥會變成集體補血，善用團體戰
飛行兵：機動性第一，hit & run，火力強但需要控制能量消耗，可惜第四代的homing武器變廢了
工程兵：各種載具，小車子至大機械人，團戰向，單打會遇到不擅長應付的任務
重裝兵：看似笨重，善用組合衝刺其實非常敏捷，盾只是用來跑路用，重點還是重火力，高手向

總之，買下去就沒錯啦，可享受屠殺小蟲快感，又可以享受被兇蟲咬屁屁的歡愉！

提供一個小心得：關卡：14 上陸阻止作戰　難度：INFERNO

一開始立即跑到最後方（樹林那邊），讓NPC先擊落所有敵軍（若有遠程武器也可以待空軍全滅後幫打一下機械人），第二波來襲時退回己軍後方，等他們了結敵人，途中盡快拾武器盒，這樣可以在最初拿到LV50級左右的武器，對攻略很有幫助。不過拿幾件武器就好了，否則很沒趣的～

25105208.review:
I've forever been envious of people playing this game... And now it's finally on steam. It is everything I had hoped and more, with the co-op feature I hadn't known about. Co-op works flawlessly, overlooking a bug that slows down the game while in equipment select (but is easily fixed by backing out of the room and reentering after a long play session) and there are no issues with unnatural lag or desync.

Highly recommended for playing with a partner or a group of friends up to 4 players, the reason following: Air Raider and Fencer classes in particular I feel benefit the most from playing with friends, having the most extreme strengths and weaknesses that are best rounded out with a friend than the other classes. The Wing Divers seem to be the strongest class to solo the game with, and so at first one might think you should go and do that, I feel like you miss most of the experience of the game while in the air; Coop'ing with friends as a Wing Diver actually leads to a uniquely fun situation where you get to be the shining savior for your friends on the ground as they struggling with the stages in the way they were intended.

In all cases, playing alone or playing with friends, I recommend playing on Hard difficulty for your first run. It is highly challenging, but is completely possible and the struggle is worth it.

ノーマル以下なら脳死プレイでも敵をサクサク倒してクリアできる程度の難易度

インフェルノ（最高難易度）は動画に上がっているような縛りプレイなしにしても、例えれば中途半端な備えでは歯ごたえがありすぎて筋肉痛になるか、噛んだものが硬すぎて自分の歯が粉々になるような、クリア出来るかできないかの難易度調整です
腕前とＰＣスペックに自信があるあなたはぜひ挑戦を
普通にこの難易度に挑戦してクリアして、物足りなくなったあなたは体力縛りも加えてドウゾ

小ネタも面白いです
そこら辺にある単なる自販機や、コンビニの広告、それらに種類があり、倍率がある武器で見てみるとなかなか面白い広告があったりします。男ならクロだろ。

ストーリーはミッション中盤～終盤にかけて、絶望感が半端なくなっていきます
この絶望感を例えるとするなら、会社をクビにされ妻は息子を連れて実家に帰るぐらいの圧倒的な絶望感です
是非ご体験ください


欠点があるとすれば、オンラインの機能が微妙に不満足
ミッション中に急に人が来たりすると自動でミッションに援護にしに来てくれたりしそうですが、フォーリナーのせいか、はたまた本部のせいかはわかりませんが、ミッションの途中参加はできないのです

それと解像度の変更だけでなく、テクスチャのクオリティが少しでも下げられれば嬉しかったです
（因みにゲーム映像を見ていただければわかりますが、このゲーム、湧いてくる敵のテクスチャ解像度が高く、なおかつビルの倒壊エフェクト、爆破エフェクト、さらに（無駄に）建物の一つ一つが内装まで作り込まれていたり、処理では敵やオブジェクトの当たり判定が非常に細かく設定されてたり、一度に数十匹湧いてくる敵ＡＩ、味方（ﾎﾟﾝｺﾂ）ＡＩで非常にＰＣに負荷をかけるゲームになります）

この部分さえよくなってくれればうれしい限りです

それと要望があるのですが、個人的には地球防衛軍シリーズ最高難易度といわれる地球防衛軍２、ストーリーが一番好きな地球防衛軍３のsteem発売を心待ちにしている次第であります

そうそう、ＥＤＦ４からは何というか最近の戦隊ものの雰囲気が強いゲーム、それ以前のナンバリングは昭和臭がする（特に２）感じがします(*´ω｀*)

25049679.review:
地球防衛軍シリーズ初プレイ、オンライン未プレイの感想です。

・ゲームパート


単純に見えて非常に奥が深いゲームで、ノーマル難易度くらいだと大量の巨大蟻や蜘蛛などを吹き飛ばしてストレス解消！みたいなノリでプレイ出来るのですが、難易度が上がってくるとステージに相応しい武器選択などの綿密な戦略を求められるようになるので、コアゲーマーからカジュアルゲーマーまで楽しめるゲームです。
例えば、ノーマルだとロケットランチャー等の爆発物で大量の敵を爽快に吹き飛ばせて、スナイパーライフルのような地味な武器は余り使う機会が無かったのですが、逆に高難易度では爆発物は攻撃力不足のために有用性が下がり（自爆ダメージ増加も大きな要因）、スナイパーライフルのような地味でも確実に敵の数を減らせる武器が有用になったりと、難易度によっての戦略も大きく違います。
兵科ごとの操作感も大きく違い、普通のTPSの感覚で操作出来る歩兵のレンジャーや、空を飛んだりするのが少しトリッキーなものの、まだ普通の感覚で操作出来るウィングダイバーの二兵科は比較的とっつきやすいですが、残りのフェンサーとエアレイダーはクセが強く、使いこなすのは結構大変です。
エアレイダーは砲撃や爆撃支援、乗り物を要請したりして戦う支援タイプ（回復も可能）で、操縦に習熟し、制約の多い支援の使い所を見極める必要があります。
フェンサーはさらにクセが強く、近接武器やシールド、照準に妙な慣性がつく射撃武器、使いこなせば素早く移動出来るスラスターなど、操作面に難があります。
そのため、初心者向けのレンジャーで一通りプレイした後でも、別の兵科では新鮮なプレイ感覚でプレイすることが出来ると思います。

やり込み要素も異様なくらいに用意されており、その気になれば１０００時間プレイしても終わらないレベルです。
成長要素としてはアーマー値と武器があり、ステージ中でアーマー値を上昇させるアイテムと武器を拾えるのですが、武器は難易度が高いほど良い物が拾えます。
アーマーの初期値は１５０～２５０ですが上限は実質無しで、アーマー上昇アイテム２～３個でアーマー値が１上昇し、最高難易度のインフェルノに挑戦するには最低でも１０００は必要です。
兵科ごとにアーマー値は独立しており、プレイ中の兵科の武器しか拾えないので、最高難易度に挑戦する準備だけでも兵科ごとに１０時間以上かかります。
偉大な先人たちによって効率の高い稼ぎ方は確率されていますが、それでも武器取得は運が大きく絡むし、そもそも強い武器を手に入れるためにはインフェルノに挑戦する必要があるので、稼ぎのための準備も必要です。
そこまでして初めてインフェルノに挑戦出来るようになり、それでもインフェルノの攻略は一筋縄ではいかないので、コアゲーマーでも長く楽しめると思います。
DLC無しでもステージ数が８９（オンライン専用ミッション除く）あり、兵科ごとに戦略も変わります。
勿論、インフェルノに挑戦するかしないかは自由で、インフェルノでないとプレイ出来ないステージなどは無く、ノーマルで４兵科をプレイするだけでも５０時間は余裕で遊ぶことが可能で、２５時間程のプレイの時点で感想を書いていますが、レンジャー以外の３兵科は軽く試してみただけの状態です。


・ストーリーパート

本作に複雑なストーリーは無く、単に宇宙人に地球を侵略されたので宇宙人共をやっつけろ！というだけの単純明快なストーリーで、極限状態での人間ドラマとか、滅亡に瀕しても一致団結できない人間の醜さみたいなかったるい展開はありません。
それでも、宇宙人にどんどん追いつめられていく雰囲気や、絶望的な状況で戦い続けることによるヒロイックな気分はしっかりと味わうことが出来ます。
全体的に漂うB級なノリも面白く、ソロプレイでも横でガンガン死亡フラグを立てまくる味方NPCや司令部がプレイを盛り上げてくれました。


・まとめ

やりこみ要素が異常なまでに盛り沢山のゲームですが、同時にカジュアルゲーマーでも気軽に楽しめるようになっています。
４種類の兵科のプレイフィールが全く違うので、一通りの兵科でプレイするだけでも長く遊ぶことが出来ます。
そこから更に踏み込むと、４兵科分の武器収集やキャラ育成、そして鬼畜難度のステージ攻略と、非常に奥が深いゲームでした。

一つのステージは10分～20分くらいでしょうか、
笑い要素が多々ありますしテンションあがります。
リロード無制限の武器もあり、武器の種類も多く肩肘はらずプレイできると思います。
敵の種類は昆虫が巨大化したものが多く、洋ゲーのゾンビやグロが苦手な人は良いんじゃないでしょうか。
グラフィックは最近のものほどリアルではないです、
私のPC環境のせいだと思いますが、仲間が一斉にしゃべったり一般人が沢山いたりするとごく稀にですが、一瞬重たくなります。
そこそこのPCスペックは必要。
ローカルプレイは画面分割で2人までプレイ可能です。
コントローラーもばっちり対応してます。
とにかく細かいところは気にせずバンバン撃って大量に湧く敵を蹴散らすのがEDFの醍醐味だと思います。

Practically perfect in every way.

合わせてくれる方が多いので、士気も上がります。

ミッションによっては画面を埋め尽くす敵の大軍団との
激闘になります。

大奮闘できます。


気に入らなかった所は
・ステージが単調
マップと敵の種類は多い方ではないため、
似たようなミッションが多々あり

その他気になったこと
・敵が虫っぽい
大量の虫に襲われる可能性があるため、
虫が苦手な人にはお勧めできません。


全体の感想になりますが、
大軍団に少数精鋭で立ち向かう
シチュエーションが好きな方にお勧めします。
ただし、B級感のあるSFが苦手な方には
お勧めできません。


以上です。
ご高覧頂きありがとうございます。

24836793.review:
EDF is a Japanese alien invasion B-movie, basically transposed into a series of games.  Most of the gameplay is comprised of ridiculous ragdolling, getting swarmed by spiders and shouting "EDF!" Uncontrollably.  In general production values are a bit low, but the games tend to be scenario-driven stage to stage, intentionally ridiculous and quite visceral.

Local co-op has always been one of the main draws of the series, but this time the Online Multiplayer is quite good as well.  With four different classes that play quite differently (including one that's almost entirely team-oriented), there's enough variety that not everyone will necessarily call the same roles.  Multiplayer is the majority of the fun, as you collaborate while trying to parse how your friend is wearing a tank as a hat, why most of the city is missing or why half of the vehicles are out and out terrible.

You collect weapons that generally all have a strength and weakness, but gradually become stronger over time.  Not unlike diablo, the higher difficulties allow stronger weapons and let you obtain them through crate drops from enemies.  You end up getting a trickle of interesting guns and death machines, but if you need to get a shiny new toy every mission, this might not work out for you.  On the flip side, there are a lot of missions, so that may appeal to you instead.

All in all, unless you're really dedicated to so-bad-it's-incredible bug squashing on your own, or plan to play split-screen co-op, make sure you can convince some friends to get their own copies and play with you.  If you can't, I definitely can't recommend this enough, but if you can- you're all going to have a really good time.

24832529.review:
This game is 20,000 times better in multiplayer than it is in single player. At first I could only get myself to play till about level 10, then I died and was like "I need help to beat this"

Then I played it with friends.... Stayed up until 4 am, was in tears laughing multiple times. The chat wheel is the cherry on top of this masterpiece of a game. We sang the entire EDF anthem across multiple missions with out soldiers singing every other verse.

At first the weapons seem pretty straight forward. The ranger gets realistic military weapons, the more sifi classes get sifi weapons. But then we started getting things like giant energy swords and practically shoulder mounted nukes for the fencer, triple rocket launchers and laser guns that shoot 900 bullets once you pull the trigger once, hand held mini nukes and lightning crossbows for the wing diver and giant spiders and attack helecopters for the air raider.

THEN we found a level we could beat on hard, pretty far into the game. Laser Chainsaws, 20m radius air strikes from 150mm cannons that recharge almost instantly if you kill something with it, acid squirtguns. Sadly I didnt find anything too whacky for the fencer, but it's already pretty out there when you dual weild massive artillery cannons.

The game starts off pretty simple. Go here and kill some giant ants. The difficulty and level design get pretty advanced pretty quickly. There's actually alot of enemies that you have to play very differently against. The level design is actually amazing. How much could you possibly do with giant ants? quite alot actually. My favoite level so far was just quite literally 3 anthills under some forcefields.

This game was my childhood a long time ago. Playing this game split screen on inferno trying to abuse all of the levels until we found a way to beat it was so fun. Now that I'm actually 'good' at video games (somewhat) I'd say I can actually beat them straight up. But I took one glimpse at harder and I was like "How can you possibly beat this". Looking forward to working my way up there though haha.

24829144.review:
PS3の4をプレイして以来久しぶりにEDF隊員として復帰

オンノーマルを全兵種でクリアしたのでレビュー。

一見巨大な敵を蹴散らす大味なゲームに見えるが本当は実に練りこまれたゲームである。

確かに序盤は適当な武器で目の前の敵を撃っているだけでクリアできるが
後半になるとこれがどうしてなかなかの戦略性を求められるのである。

レンジャー、ウイングダイバー、エアレイダー、フェンサーと兵種は4つに別れていて兵種ごとの特徴が良く出ている。
どの兵種も独自の使用感があり、得手不得手もハッキリしているのでいろんな兵種を試したくなる。

また敵に手をだす順番によっては地獄をみたりちゃんと考えてやればすんなりクリア出来たりもするのである。

そしてオンラインでは使用可能な武器のレベルが制限されておりどのステージでどの武器を使うかを悩むのも楽しい
意外な武器が活躍するステージがあったりするのも良い物である

何より楽しいのがオンラインでの共闘がバッチリ決まったときだろう
ラジオチャットでコミュニケーションを取りつつ役割分担している時などは間違いなく脳汁が出ているだろう。


もともとのゲームとしての基本システムはもうかなり昔のままであり不満がまったく無いわけではない

アイテム回収が面倒だったりいわゆるHPにあたるアーマー値を上げるのも時間がかかったり
あえて操作性を悪くする所でゲームバランスをとっていたりする所がある

しかし単純さと奥深さを併せ持ったゲームであることは間違いないので是非一度プレイしてみてほしい。

我がEDFでは新規隊員を募集している。

EDF!EDF!

24796522.review:
This game is pure, (almost) mindless FUN. It's easy and quick to install, it has 5 difficulty levels ("I'm too young to die!" all the way to "I'm too pretty to live") each with different weapon drop tables, over 90 missions as well as DLC mission packs, the corniest dialogue, four different classes to play as with unique play styles, and GIANT INSECTS FROM OUTER SPACE.

Ever wanted to panic slightly as you see a wave of ants flood over a distant mountain, keep coming, and keep getting closer, while you have a forest and a harbor in between you two? Ever wanted to fight Godzilla on foot as some dude with a machine gun? Ever wanted to soar above those silly giant insects because they can't fly? Ever watch Pacific Rim and think it was cool?

Might wanna get this game then.

24795437.review:
EDFッ!EDFッ!
ゲーム自体は過去作をPS等でプレイしたことがあったので内容は大体把握しておりました。
評価も高いのでゲームの内容自体には不安もなく購入。
実際にプレイしてみても期待通りで大変満足しております。

ですが１点のみ
FPSやMMOで3D酔いをされる方は注意です。
私は普段特に最近では他のゲームで酔うと言った事はほぼなかったのですが過去にゲームによっては3D酔いを経験した事がございます。(私が所持しているライブラリ内の他のゲームでは酔ったことがございません。)
そしてこのゲームは久々に格別酔いました。
相性等があるので一概に全ての方に当てはまるとは思えませんが最初ゲームをプレイした日は3時間ほどのプレイで3日程頭痛と眩暈が続きました。
その後もゲームを起動し画面を見る度に軽い眩暈、長時間のプレイ後は頭痛眩暈に悩まされております。
特にウイングダイバーを使用していてアイテム回収等を行っている際に酔いが激しいです。
マイノリティな意見かと思いますが過去に3D酔いを経験された事がある方は参考までにどうぞ。

上記のような経験がない方は文句なしにおすすめです。
私はまだNormalを1周と少ししただけですがステージも多くプレイ人口も多く難易度もそこそこ難しいので長く遊べるかと思います。
ただシリーズ通してですが似たようなマップが多いのと敵種が少ないので少しだれます。

24789068.review:
This is the only game i've ever played where farming for weapons is actually fun and not tedious.

When I first bought this game I thought it was just "pretty cool".  My gf and I were playing it together.  We both thought it was aight for the first bit.  5 hours later we both were absolutely addicted.  We keep going back to older levels trying to beat the harder difficulty settings.  The replayability in this game is amazing.  You actually want to go back to old levels and try them harder.  

The weapons are incredibly varied, fun to use,  and completely change how you approach certain levels and difficulties.

When you play this game on Normal (and sometimes even Hard) it's pretty mindless.  On these difficulties you can easily have a conversation and breeze through a level.  On Hardest and Insane however you better focus like a muh fug because poop's about to get real.  My GF and I (and some time local with my roomate)  have already sank 16 hours into this and we are only on level 17 because of how much we go back and play the higher difficulties.

This game is so sick it's ****ing disgusting.

Oh and I did play Insect Armageddon on the PS3 and this is WAAAAAY better.

If you like fast paced action, and are looking for an amazing Local Co-op game then get this.  (I have yet to play the online.  I will in the future).

9.25/10 (So far)

Want some story?
Want Edge of the field Graphics?
How about some fantastic AI?

Don't get this game

Do you want almost endless progression with hundreds of pieces of gear each for all 4 classes?
Do you want great variety between each playstyle?

Just buy it, Get your mates and buy it- The gameplay draws you in, You stay for the insanity and leave in a banquet of explosions and giant mech punching your friend into a skyscraper.

Go on, buy it.

24763811.review: It's good and you should buy it.

24759412.review:
I've been playing the EDF series since the very first game in 2003.
EDF 4.1 is one of the best games ever made when it comes to pure fun, and now it's even better on the PC with a incessant 60 frames per second, a first for the series.

If you're new to the series, here's a quick rundown:
Giant alien insects and robots/aircraft are invading the earth to exterminate all human life.
They are all several magnitudes larger than a tank, and there are an insane number of them. Seriously, there are anywhere between 30 to over 100 enemies in a group at a time.
It's up to you, faceless soldier, to destroy them all. It's essentially B-Movie, the game.

You've got 98 missions, 800 weapons, 4 classes, and 5 difficulties.
About 20 different enemy types including giant ants, spiders, hornets, 30ft tall robots, 50ft tall tripods, and a 300ft tall transformer robot, the Motherships, alien aircraft, and so on.

Don't listen to other people when they say the game is a 'mindless shooter.'
Sure, it can be on the lower difficulties, and that's fine.
But once you try Hardest/Inferno with 4 players online, EDF is far from mindless. Only players with peak reaction speed, communication, situational awareness and tactical planning will succeed.

One word of warning, the first 10 missions of the game are slow and not representative of the whole game.
The progression starts off small with giant ants and boring weapons. 
To really understand what EDF is like, you're likely going to have to play way past the 2-hour refund mark to have access to orbital satellite strikes, fight Godzilla, pilot Pacific Rim Jaegers, use laser snipers, napalm grenades and a whole slew of bad-ass content.
It is well worth it.

EDF is a testament to the fact that most of the time, the simplest games are the best ones.
Nothing since Doom has demonstrated that better than EDF. It's a beloved series, and if you're even slightly interested, you simply owe it to yourself to give it a try.

Get this game. There is HUNDREDS of hours of entertainment, especially online with 4 players.
Just ask any newcomer to the series and 99% of the time, you'll see their unbridled, quickly attained burning love for it.

24758147.review:
私は科学者のオハラだ。　EDFの諸君に伝えたい。
このレビューは
地球防衛軍１　地球防衛軍３　地球防衛軍4(XBOX) 　地球防衛軍4.1(PS4)を遊んだ上での感想だ。
PS４版はPS4本体ごと買ったが後悔はしていない。
なぜならCPUスペックさえあれば処理落ちから完全に開放されるEDFが遊びたいからだ。
ヘクトルが爆発しても、シールドベアラーに武器が当たっても、爆撃があっても安心してプレイできるからだ。

PC版になり、巨大生物の挙動も強化された。強化されたのは巨大生物だけじゃない。
EDFの隊員の誘導も強化された。つまり迷子が減ったというわけだ。
ロード時間はPS4に輪をかけて早くなり、ほぼストレスフリーになった。
アイテム収集が非効率になるくらいの勢いだ。アイテムを探して時間を費やすなら同じステージをもう一回やったほうが効率がいいのだ。
これは本作が妙にアップテンポになる原因でもある。
PS4版をやったやつは英語モードでやることをお勧めする。　言ってることは日本語版と変わらないが、違う意味で熱くてよろしい。
一週目は日本語で遊んでも、ぜひとも英語でやっていっただきたい。

操作はXBOX360コントローラーで遊ぶとほとんど同じだ。
他のレビューでも指摘されているが、BACKは効かないから気を付けてほしい。

このゲームをプレイするとあっという間にIQが削られていくが、IQが削られたまま放っておくとあっという間に巨大生物に囲まれる。
立ち回りに気を付けながら戦うのだ。
そして最後にプレイの時は近所迷惑に気を付けてほしい。　
では叫ぼうではないか。

EDF！　EDF！　EDF!

24753389.review:
Earth Defense Force 4.1: Shadow of New Despair, shade of recent melancholy, Umbrella of Sadness is pretty cool I guess. 

You play as a member of the Earth Defense Force, a military organization so hype they could probably win the war with fists alone. The planet Earth is once again attacked by the Ravagers, an alien force with a unexplained love for Japanese Kaiju B-movies. Now the planet is overrun with giant insects, flying dragons, huge killer robots, and UFOs.

Just like my sex life. 

I'm going to just go ahead and say that this game is radical. Planet Fight Guys is one of those games that revels in it's simplicity in the best way. Each mission is about exterminating an enemy army or destroying a specific target, which sounds boring if it wasn't for the overwhelming flood of enemies they send to chew on your tender spicy butthole. 

You have four classes to choose from in Terra Kerfuffle Men. You can play as shoot guy, flying shoot girl, angry radio man, and  Harambe the Gorilla. Each class has their own weapons and special abilities like how Harambe can deflect enemy attacks and dash cancel, Flying shooty girl can fly, Angry Radio Man can call in mechs and mechs and why would you use anything other than a mech? And Shooty Guy can get punched in the face and not cry for 30 minutes. 

Killing enemies can get you an assortment of drops, ranging from stronger weapons, weaker that you don't need, mostly weaker weapons, armor drops, health, assorted anime, a pillow to deal with your crippling loneliness, and video games. 

Sphere Boxing Gang is arcadey fun at it's finest. The guns are weighty and crunchy, and the amount of enemies rushing you at any given time makes me feel like I don't scrounge for thrown away games in the EB games dumpster.  

The game is not for everyone however, but neither is freedom or the embrace of a loved one. Even so, I do have some problems with the game.  You spend a lot of time in the game looking up, which can get disorientating at times, And your view can be completely obstructed if you get swarmed like the kid in class with gum. Your allies also seem to be so prepared to die for the EDF that they'll jump into your rockets at point blank just to prove it. 

But should you play Dirt Guardian Guys? 


Yes. 

Going to be honest, I love EDF since I played it on an Xbox 360 back in 1985. It's a simple series with a simple premise, lots of enemies on screen, go kill them. I'm biased when it comes to the series because I'm a stinky idiot who likes bright colors and flashy lights. If you're new to the series, I would recommend waiting for a price drop, but if you aren't then. Well. You probably already have EDF. 

Land Combat Army gets 4 EDF soldier's singing out of a possible 2. 

A worker ant can withstand pressures up to 5000 times greater than it's own body weight. But it can't feel true love. 
The Curator: http://steamcommunity.com/groups/Dickbuttexperience#curation

24744310.review:
[h1]Das Spiel[/h1]
Bei Earth Defense Force 4.1 The Shadow of New Despair (später nur noch EDF genannt) spielt man einen von 4 verschiedenen Charakteren in third Person ansicht und verteidigt die Welt von Aliens und Rieseninsekten.

[h1]Die Charaktere[/h1]
Ranger:
Eine Klasse die zu Fuß unterwegs ist und mit 2 Waffen ausgestattet ist. Diese Klasse ist eine Angriffsklasse welche überall gut ist und ebsonders für Einsteiger geeignet ist. Wird meist mit 1 Maschinengeweghr oder Shotgun und einem Raketenwerfer gespielt

Fencer:
Eine Art Tank, sehr langsam aber mit starken Waffen ausgestattet welche zusätzlich je 2 Modis haben können

Air Raider:
Eine Klasse die weniger durch ihre Angriffskraft glänzt, eher durch seine Fähigkeit Luftunterstützung zu Rufen, z.B indem er sich einen Panzer oder Hubschrauber oder anderes droppen lässt.

Wingdiver:
Eine Klasse mit einem Jetpack welche sich das Schlachtfeld auch von weit oben betrchten kann. Der perfekte Kundschafter und eine sehr schnelle Klasse. Meineserachtens wenn man mit ihr umgehen kann eine der stärksten, jedoch nicht für Anfänger geeignet da man mit dem jetpack umgehen können muss und die Klasse das geringste Leben ebsitz


[h1]Gegner[/h1]
Die Gegner langen von großen Ameisen und Bienen, Spinnen und Raumschiffen bis hin zu riesigen Godzillaähnlichen Kampfmonstern und Maschinen.

[h1]Allgemeines[/h1]
EDF ist ein Spiel das einem gefällt oder man hasst es. Die Grafaik ist gut aber nicht überragend, Strategie braucht man eher nur in den letzten Leveln wirklich gut, Viele Level werden in mehreren Missionen wiederverwertet und vieles andere. Was macht das Spiel denn für mich nun empfehlenswert?
Ganz einfach, es ist ein verdammt spassiges unterfangen mit 3 anderen Leuten gegen eine unzählige Masse an Rieseninsekten in einer Stadt anzutreten, alle zusammen singen zu lassen, EDF zu schreihen und sich ins getümmel zu stürzen. In einen riesigen Kampfrobotter einzusteigen und gegen einen Godzilla ähnlichen Gegner anzutreten, an einem Stradt gegen Riesige kampfmaschinen anzutreten und zu sehen wie durch Luftschläge und eigene Raketen Bombardements der ganze Horizont in Flammen steht. EDF ist zwar keine spieltechnische Meisterleistung jedoch im hinblick auf Grösse, Masse, Action und Waffenvielfalt ist es so ziemlich unschlagbar.
Es bietet über 800 Waffen für 4 absolut Unterschiedliche Klassen und im online Modus 98 Missionen für welche man beim ersten durchspielen gut 20h einplanen kann. Wenn man alles erreichen will bietet das Spiel mehrere Hundert Stunden Spielspass.


[h1]Fazit[/h1]
Wer schon immer mal große Gegnermengen in schier unglaublicher Grösse erledigen wollte sollte dieses Spiel nicht verpassen. Für Spieler die eher absolut taktisches vorgehen lieben wie bei Splinter Cell oder Metal Gear Solid wird dieses Spiel vermutlich eher nichts sein.

24711159.review:
STATS
4 Very Different Classes
90+ Unique Missions
800~ Weapons
5 Difficulty Levels
20+ Enemy Varieties (Including recolors)
100+ Hours of Gameplay

Originally EDF 2025 for the X-Box 360, then EDF 4.1 for the PS4, EDF 4.1: Shadow of New Despair is a port of a remaster of an already excellent game.  The 4.1 update includes several fantastic additions, from excellent class gameplay tweaks, to more weapons, to more missions, to more enemies, better lighting, etc. etc. etc.

To put it simply, Earth Defense Force 4.1 is a B-Movie that you play.  While it doesn't include Bruce Campbell (waiting on that DLC, Sandlot), it DOES include big, fake-looking bugs and robots, as well as hilariously bad voice acting (don't worry, it doesn't get annoying quickly), and more explosions than Michael Bay's wet dreams.

However, the smarmy B-movie charm isn't the main draw:  that would be the incredibly tight gameplay.  The series has been fine-tuning itself over the years, and while the ill-fated American-made Insect Armageddon may have flopped, it did introduce to the series class-based gameplay (although earlier versions did have two playable characters) and teammate reviving (I wish sprinting would've made its way over, too).  Each class has a very different set of weapons and moves very differently from one another, so even if you play through all 90+ Missions on all 5 Difficulty settings with a single class, you've only completed 20% of the game.

Apparently, there are some problems with certain processors and troubles with cheating, but I have not encountered either of these.

If you don't care about story or presentation or set pieces (basically everything that's killing video games today), then EDF is the game for you.

24666194.review:
I was worried that the last good EDF experience I was going to have would be 2017 back on the Xbox 360.  With the garbage fire that was Insect Armageddon I thought the series was going to run into issues with outsourcing that would leave it dead and ruined.  Once 2025 hit I had hope that maybe that wouldn't be the case after all but issues surrouding screen tearing and frame rate drops made me hold off on picking it up.  Now we have the port of the remaster of that title and it's just as good as what I remember playing back in the day.

For those that haven't played the series imagine a 1950s sci-fi movie combined with an arcade game and you basically have what gives EDF its appeal.  You're placed smack dab in the middle of an alien invasion by robots, insects, kaiju, and space ships and it's as amazing as it sounds.  Nothing beats the feeling of trying to murder giant ants while you "accidentally" level an entire city.

With 89 levels, 4 classes, 5 difficulties, 100s of weapons, online and split screen co-op this is the type of game that will end up eating a lot of your time.  I've already put in 20 hours (15 in single player and 5 in online multiplayer) and I'm nowhere near being worn out on it.  I know that some may feel hesitant about picking up a title like this based on the way it looks coupled with the price it is asking but I'd recommend watching some gameplay videos of it on Youtube to help get the idea of what it really is offering.

For those that played 2017 and loved it this follows in its footsteps faithfully.  Tons of fun and well worth the price.  There have been some having issues with running it on certain hardware configurations so I'd also recommend looking on the forums first to see if you'll encounter those issues, what workarounds exist, and when the devs have had a chance to fix any of the problems.  I'm using an i5 and 970 and the game has run flawlessly for me..

24655875.review:
As Spinal Tap said, there’s a thin line between clever and stupid.

It is not clear which side of the line Earth Defense Force falls, or whether it deftly straddles the line before falling on it’s head. EDF has the beating, unconvincing latex and ketchup heart of a B movie, and every component of the game is below par. The graphics would have been primitive ten years ago, and the animation truly needs to be seen to believed – a jumbled mess of spazzy death animations and clipping errors, assuming the enemies get that far and don’t just vibrate repeatedly against a poorly rendered tree for the whole battle. To the game’s credit, nearly every structure in the game can be destroyed, and the buildings fall apart with all the force, dynamism and realism of a Styrofoam jenga tower.

And yet, it all works. The extraordinary level of jank on display is entirely in keeping with its B-movie inspirations. The terrible voice acting is absolutely spot on in both languages – every actor sounds like they’re reading their lines for the first time with a mixture of confusion and disbelief, and every line has only the most tangential relation to the last. It sounds like a conversation between two concussion victims, and it is glorious.

The game itself has been described as Dynasty Warriors with giant insects, and that’s a pretty on point comparison. Whatever the mission claims to be, you have one objective – kill all the red blobs on the radar. There is a surprisingly excellent variety in enemies, even with the inevitable palette swaps, and despite the jank the controls are responsive and tight. The four classes have admirable variety as well, from the nimble jetpack enabled wingdiver (taking to the air sans breastplate and trousers, ostensibly to reduce weight) to the vehicle summoning support class air raider. There’s a huge variety of weapons available to each class as well, and in co-op building a balanced team is key to survival.

Whether or not I can recommend EDF to you will depend on your circumstances. As a single player, EDF is enjoyable but repetitive and lonely, and the difficulty is very uneven with some enemies being a breeze for one class whilst being a nightmare for others. It’s obviously built for co-op, and this is where it’s manic gameplay shines – getting one shot by a superlaser 90% through a mission is annoying but hilarious when a friend can drive over and revive you, but utterly infuriating in single player. The class based gameplay and ridiculous excess are at their best when enjoyed with inebriated friends, a playable Mystery Science Theatre where the enjoyment comes both because of and in spite of its budget and limitations.

Unfortunately on the PC version at least, the game is plagued by cheating, and cheating players can permanently screw up your save file. The cheating is so ubiquitous that I cannot recommend playing with randoms if this is your only multiplayer avenue. With a friend or three and a suitable level of intoxication/brain damage however, the game is a blast and absolutely worth the surprisingly hefty outlay – but this is not a situation that everyone is lucky enough to be in.

24654651.review:
＼サンダー！！／　　＼みんな糸にまかれて死ぬんだよ！／　＼EDF!　EDF!／

といった名言を世に送り出した地球防衛軍シリーズの直系の続編。
操作感の全く違う４クラスで、800種類の武器を使いつつ
襲い来る大型昆虫たちをぶっ殺していきます。

・大満足なボリューム
　ステージは１００近くあり、難易度も５段階あります。
　最下段のEASYは練習用といったところですが、それを除いた４段階に関しては
　そう簡単に飛び級できないようになっています。
　強力な武器を集め、こつこつ最大体力を上げないと、正攻法ではクリアできません。

・新人隊員も伝説級の隊員も大満足
　NORMALとか一つ上のHARDくらいまではある程度適当にごり押ししても
　順当に強化していればクリアできるかと思います。ライトな隊員はこれだけでも十分楽しめます。
　やりこみたい人はさらに上、HARDESTやINFERNOに挑戦することになります。
　このあたりになると、一筋縄ではいかず戦略や戦術を練ってプレイすることになります。
　過去シリーズをプレイしていた伝説の隊員も大満足です。

・オンラインプレイ
　（現状では日本だけ？）の隊員と簡単にマッチングできます。
　また、どの隊員も酸に頭をやられているのか、
　定型ラジオチャットの「EDF!　EDF!」で9割程度意思の疎通が可能です。

・本部の罠
　非常にゲームとして楽しいEDF4.1ですが、本部の罠とでも言うべき短所もあります。
　１．武器とアーマーをいちいち回収しなければならずテンポが悪くなる
　　敵を倒すとその場に「武器」「アーマー（HPの最大値UP）」「回復アイテム」を落とします。
　　これを拾うことで隊員を強化するのですが、逆にこれを拾わないと隊員は一切強化されません。
　　機動力にたけたクラスでさえ回収がめんどくさい。SIMPLEシリーズ当時からこの仕様でしたが、
　　別にここにこだわらなくてもと思います。

　２．マルチプレイ時、接続が断たれることがままある
　　マッチングし、いざミッション開始、というタイミングで中断され、
　　タイトル画面に戻らざるを得ないことがままあります。
　　これ、再現性がなくて忘れたころに再発するので、後述のマッチングシステムと相まって
　　ストレス要素です。

　３．マルチプレイの設定に不満アリ
　　まず、このゲームは最大４人で遊べます。ただ、4人集まるのを待つのも退屈なので、
　　たいてい２～３人集まった段階でスタートする部屋が多いかと思われます。
　　そうすると「部屋の空きがあるがプレイがスタートしている」状態になるのですが、
　　この状態で新たに入室した隊員は、プレイ中の隊員がステージの成果を無に帰して退却をするか、
　　クリアをして次のステージに進むまでプレイできません。
　　さらに、部屋に入るまでミッションがスタートしているかどうか解りません。
　　さらにさらに、それがいつ終わるのか全く見当がつけられません。
　　「挨拶したら退却」みたいな文化も細々とあるそうですが、システムでどうにかすべきところでしょう。ここ。

　４．設定項目が少なすぎる
　　海外でも多く要望が出ているFOVの調整や、操作キーのコンフィグの少なさや、
　　「カメラ操作のリバース／ノーマル」が「マウスとコントローラーの右スティック」両方にいっぺんにしか
　　適用できない。なんてのもあります。個人的にはコントローラはリバース、マウスはノーマルなので、
　　画面分割プレイするときに不便です。かなり。
　　他、マルチプレイの「招待オンリー部屋」の作り方が若干わかりづらいのも問題。
　　一部プレイヤーの頭が酸に侵されているのか、これが分からないようで
　　「フレンド以外が入ったらキックします」なんて部屋がずらりと並んでいます。邪魔です。
　　プレイヤーの学習能力には期待できないのでシステムで分かり易くすべき所かと。

24628873.review:
I don't want to rave too much about this game, because some of you are going to hate it, but it's an amazing blend of Starship Troopers, Dynasty Warriors, Kaiju, Anime, and bad science fiction movies. The story is almost non-existent, but the gameplay is top-notch. The range of difficulty is awesome, and really accomodates whatever play style you're feeling. Want a more tactical/intense experience? Go harder. Just wanna lay waste to the bug hordes? Dial it down. 

I really think the rest of the gaming industry could learn a lot from these guys, and I'd love to see them continue to support this title and do more releases for the PC market.

24610839.review:
If you have even the smallest interest in this series, you should get it. The price tag is not too high at all for the contents you get. You get 4 different classes to play with. They play differently, so you basically get 4 in 1 games. The game is fun, and enjoyable both Offline, and Online. Still, there are something that you should know:

[h1]Grinding, and Mindless Shooter?[/h1]
Is 4.1 a grindy, mindless shooter? It depends. IMO, it is 'not' the grinding game, but can be play as one. The mindless part maybe true, but it is the mindless shooter on lower difficulties especially for Offline Missions. Online missions, on higher difficulties are not.

Back to the grinding, each class has its own progressions (missions on 5 difficulties), armors and weapons (loot drops). These loot drops can be earned as you progress through missions on each difficulty. They are limited to missions, and difficulties

However, these missions can be played in any order as long as you have unlocked it, by playing through them once as any class on any difficulty. This is where the grinding is. 

Players, that want to get strong fast, and easy, will be playing certain missions on certain difficulty over and over to grind for armor, weapon drops. That is very BORING, and killed the very objective of the game, progressions.

These players, apart from their equipments, often lack the skills/knowledges they need to play with others especially on higher difficulty. Some are series vet, which is fine for me as they are fun to play with, and know their parts, but there are lots of new players playing this way. These guys are annoying. They don't communicate, and make things harder than it should be.

I have been playing from Normal, and almost onto the Hardest for my Wing Diver. I have done zero farming. I haven't replay any mission unless, got wiped > restart. I don't have any problem with current armors / weapons that cannot finish the Online Missions with my friends who do similar thing. (Online missions are harder than offline.)

[h1]Relentless Cheaters[/h1]
There are these idiots. They can ruin your fun. They can give you any amount of armors, and weapons by manipulating with loot drops picked up amount.

There are also some harmless hack (to your save) likes God Mode, No Reload, etc.

So if you are looking to play Online, you should be playing with friends than the randoms. There are good randoms too, but from the cheaters I encountered so far, it doesn't worth playing with randoms in my region.

[h1]TL;DR[/h1]
The game is fun to play, and can be played at your own paces. For Online plays, you should be aware of cheaters that they can ruin your save. Bring friends if possible.

Downvote still stands because of the stupid fucking font system they use and the equally-as-fucking-stupid 'can only join a mission if it's still in the lobby, not if it's in progress' "multiplayer" system they use.

However after 20+ hours, I have to change the downvote to an upvote for ONE MAJOR reason:  its multiplayer loot system.  
-if you hate fighting your allies for the 'good loot drops' (cough Borderlands and any MMO ever cough), then you'll love this game's loot system.  See a loot drop but an ally picks it up before you get there?  No problem!  All 4 of you get it, with the exception of health boxes.  Hate running all over to get all the good boxes?  Split up!  It's amazing!

24602221.review:
One of the few games where spamming vocal cues is welcomed.
I mean, nothing sounds more satisfying that a bunch of guys (Wing Divers don't sing it in English, I don't know if they do in Japanese) singing an anthem after blowing up anything that's remotely near an alien.
Or just shouting their organization initials.
A lot.
I mean that's all you need to know about the game.
A bunch of people repetedly shouting their organizations' initials in different inflections even though they're the technically the same.
And shooting anything alien-like like large insects or robots or (not) Godzilla.
With a plethora of guns. At least it would be if they didn't get outclassed based on difficulty.
It's just mindless fun at the end of the day. And that's what makes it good. If you can decide to not think and shoot anything. And spam EDF. A lot.

24601609.review:
The game will seem like mindless fun at first glance, but it requires more strategy than it lets on, especially on higher difficulties. Im basing myself on the countless hours I've spent on level 27 Crimson, level 31, level 41 and many others. Those hours held  much frustration, but also juvelation when you find the right strategy to succeed and reap the  rewards (high-powered weapons). I like to think of this game as B-movie themed third-person ARPG with more depth. Indeed, it has:

-The length: By the time of this review, I'm 27 hours in and Ive barely succeeded a third of the levels.
-The classes: There are 4 classes with very different play styles and difficulties.
-The build-up: Your class gets better equipment as you play. But so do the enemies.
-The action: Explosions! Explosions  everywhere!

The price is a little steep for my taste. But you could say they've cornered the market with this kind of game.

24601480.review: Writing a review for this game is like trying to tell you why the chainsaw is an awesome, mindless, and messy weapon. The game is set in the "save the world" genre of games, and an excuse of a plot in it. There are plot holes, and there is some bad ai chat, but what sets this game from the rest and why it is fun, is the mindless yet intense battles that happen in it. Each mission is literally kill all of the things, and that's it. Each weapon can be useful in their own rights, in each class, which are all also useful in certain situations. And the loot system urges you to kill and get into the thick of it in order to get good rewards. And i refuse to go any furhter into this review, otherwise I would be over-analyzing the game. It's fun with friends, it's a good pass time, if you like to kill things, this is the game for you.
