24596593.review:
Earth Defense Force 4.1 is a B-movie-lover's dream game. Giant bugs, robots, UFO's, massive firepower, cheesy one-liners, action-packed... it's all here, baby, and it's bloody glorious!

Earth Defense Force 4.1 has the giant monsters of B-movies and the cheesy humour along with it. House-sized bees and spiders, 10-story robots, groups of soldiers singing while moving from one objective to the next, dozens of trails left in the sky after rockets find their target, large UFOs slowly crashing into a fireball of destruction, monster ants flinging NPCs or my character for miles with arms and legs flailing as we somersault through the air awaiting our final landing spot: it all just puts a giant grin on my face.

The 4 classes in Earth Defense Force 4.1 were all fun to play, some a little more than others, but your mileage may vary. For e.g. the Wing Diver has a jet pack and is great at hit and run tactics and collecting loot sprawled all over the battlefield, but she has the lowest armor of all classes making her more of a glass cannon. Want a little more beef and fire power? Play the Fencer who wears Fallout-style power armor and has the capability of wielding tank-like cannons in each arm.

I was a big fan of the fact each class comes with their own set of weapons I needed to find and unlock, half of the fun was experimenting with each new weapon, experiencing its strengths, weaknesses, and quirks. After getting a good feel for each weapon, it was fun playing with optimal weapon pairings for each mission!

All of this fun can be shared with 3 other players in online co-op. I found myself thinking back and laughing at the fantastic memories and stories generated by Earth Defense Force 4.1 based on the experiences I had with friends and random players online. The game produces so many epic “wow” and “what the f*&$! is that?!” moments it makes it difficult not to recall them.

Imagine building-sized robots stomping towards you while massive alien motherships drop 100's of giant ants, all while dodging a barrage of lasers and alien bee stingers.

One of my favourite memories so far was the surprise mech called in by a teammate during a mission where giant red ants storm the beach we were tasked to defend. During all the carnage, one of our online teammates stops firing and says, “Don't worry guys, I got this.” I looked up to the sky to find a huge Pacific Rim sized Mech Warrior being choppered to the beach, lands with such force the sand kicks up, momentarily blinding my view of the impending ant swarm. Then my teammate enters the mech and starts stomping the ants like a slow moving angry child throwing a 1000 ton temper tantrum. All the while, the ants swarm the mech, crawling all over and up and down the hulking armored body. I took the opportunity to pull out my rocket launcher and start firing at the ants, watching them fall off the mech in droves. This was such an incredible moment.

I don't kid myself, Earth Defense Force 4.1 has many glaring issues, the menu UI, lack of VoIP control options, sluggish vehicle movement, slight frame drops during gigantic explosions with 100's of enemies on screen, less-than-impactful weapon sounds, and a host of other bugs (not of the insect kind!). Yet, it remains one of the most fun games I've played in 2016, slowly creeping up the ladder of my top 5 games of all time. It's the type of blissful, mesmerizing fun I have not had in a long, long time.

EDF!! EDF!!

Full review: http://discoverplayshare.com/review/the-edf-deploys-mindless-blissful-fun/

24595732.review:
In a market saturated with videogames that try to take themselves seriously (Not that I have a problem with that), EDF4.1 is a pleasant break. Combine massive swarms of massive enemies, hundreds of devastating weapons and 4 unique classes with unique playstyles, and sprinkle in cheese dialog and 'B-Grade' story and you get Earth Defense Force 4.1. The only thing that could make it better is some kind of modding support so I can create truly bizarre and devastating weapons that make the stock ones seem sane. And even then the publisher has released a statement that implies that some kind of modding support interests them. The developers clearly had fun when making this game, and it shows.

For a port, it performs splendidly and the control scheme is very comfortable with a keyboard and mouse. I was expecting extreme lag issues, but it works just fine on my slightly old computer. While the developers and publishers have been pretty silent on issues and questions in general, one must consider the language barrier as they are based in Japan. It does not appear they have a professional translator able to relay every report sent their way yet.

24595725.review:
Игра доставляет не то, что на свои деньги, я бы к ней купил и полноценное DLC. Ну если все будет также качественно как в оригинальной игре. Итак на выбор не только рубка разных пришельцев, но и полноценный фансервис. 
Как всегда япошки задрочили.  Кампания из 99 миссий. Города с полностью разрушаемыми домками и прочей инфраструктурой, что в общем-то доставляет массу удовольствия - можно снести уровень под 0. Но и сам дизайн видно сделан аккуратно с любовью - между небоскребами бегать приятно, приятно летать и смотреть как все это рушится и взрывается. 
По геймплею - на выбор 4 класса персонажей. Рейнджер с автоматами, ракетницами и лечилками. Винд Дайвер - летающая девка с лазерами и молниями, Эйр Райдер - инженер с турелями, вертолетами, мехами и танками, а также вохжушной поддержкой и Фенсер - экзоскелет, который может стрелять с 2х рук с большими пулеметами, ракетами и силовыми мечами.  У каждого просто огромное кол-во разнообразного оружия. Не всегда полезного, и зачастую нефига не сбалансированого, но все же. Оружие рандомно выбивается с миссии, как и броня (кол-во хп) - единственная прокачка самих персов. Броня ограничена только задротсовм, ну может еще хаком, если вы нечестный игрок, а что до оружия - его, пишут что 800 разных штук. Столько не видел, т.к. выше 45 ур у  меня оружия пока нет, но пишут что макс ур - 80. 

На выбор одиночкная компания, в ней нам предстоит в обществе ботов -лоботрясов гасить толпы прешельцев,  что в общем-то довольно унылло, т.к. боты не садятся стрелдками в танки и мехи и тупо бегут напорлом пока не передохнут, предоставляя полною инициативу игроку. И мультиплеер - ну тут все понятно. Вас четверо задротов-геймеров (тоже с ботами) и против вас 100миллионов пришельцев. Рубаем пауков, гигантских мехов, треножников, космические корабли, в общем все красные кружочки на карте.  В сопровождение  нам постоянно кидают подкрепление, помогают эйрстрайками, звучат закадровые диалоги в эфире, коментирующие общий ход боевых действий в стиле японских фильмов про годзиллу. Кстати, годзилла в игре тоже есть. И не в одной миссии - встретите, вспомните старые фильмы, подрадуетесь. 
Из реплик по умолчанию на кнопке контрол, можно кричать EDF! и лажевыми голосами петь солдафонский гимн. Радует и музон в стиле олдскульного аниме, что добавялет в игру особенно пафосного шапкозакидательства. 

В общем сделано не то что хорошо, почти что наотлично. 
Из минусов - совершенно неиграбельная и унылая одиночная компания.  несмотря на то, что карты те же, уна она просто из-за неадекватности ботов. В игре написано что ими можно управлять, но меня они что-то не слушаются. Уныла она еще потому что в одиночку приходится сражаться с гигантскими кол-вами врагов предназначеными на 4х, а потом лутать по всей карте. Игру вытягивает только мультиплеер.
Второй большой минус - местами просто зашкаливающий дисбаланс. Например у тех же бронированых рейлганоа башни двигаются настолько медленно что ими быват реально очень трудно куда-то попасть. Танк титан 12р почти бесполезен из за своей тормознутости.  Также есть проблемы с движением техники. Например броневички и мотоциклы очень тяжело управляемы из-за заносов. Из курсовых пушек вертолетов мажут почти все. Положение выручают только автонаводящееся вооружение.  Почти бесполезно все лечние кроме рейнджера. Прокачаные персонажи влет высасывают все медикаменты из медицинских машин, лайф диспенсеров на миссию можно взять всего 3 и восстанавливаю здоровье они пипец медленно.

Также нет субттров. Не, я понимаю что в бою читать тяжело, но я вот довольно тяжко воспринимаю быструю английскую речь чтобы целиком и полностью понимать закадровые диалоги, а они являются довольно существенной составляющей атмосферы глобальной войны с пришельцами, где мы являемся одним из подразделений сражащихся за будущее земли, именно через них подается сюжет. 
В общем это тот момент где все-таки несмотря на полную бездарность отечественных локализаторов все-таки хотлось бы чтобы был руссий язык. 

Также из минусов - тупые мини длс. Не берите их, разве что если хоитте нацепить на танки анимешные скины. Оружие  же ифрит и т.д. просто бесполезно. Я тестил, оформил возврат, оно не стоит даже 29 рублей.

24593849.review:
You'll see a lot of reviews revelling in the B-movie voice acting, absurd weapons, and silly enemies. These things are all great, but here's a big secret about EDF.

The gameplay is actually [i]really[/i] good.

No, seriously, you'll find yourself balancing your loadout, coordinating what to take with friends over voice chat, figuring out strategies and improvising when inevitably the wheels fall off. The weapons have a nice variety and all feel quite impactful to use. The vehicles are (intentionally?) awkward to drive but rewarding when you get into the groove of them.

My only real complaint is I do think £30 is a bit much for something like this, drop it to £20 and offer a 4-pack for £45-50 and I think it would be fairer. As it stands wait for a sale, then crack open a few beers, pop on your headset, and remember EDF Pride.

24589191.review:
EDF is like the old Godzilla -- you can clearly see the zipper on the suit, it's obviously made of rubber, and none of the joints bend in the right ways, and all of those things are what make it timeless and endearing. EDF purposefully doesn't try to get everything right in its presentation, but it isn't a parody of bugginess like Goat Simulator. Instead, it's found genuine charm in imperfection, and it knows its rock solid and hectic gunplay will overcome the strangeness of seeing a giant ant stuck inside a lamp post now and then. EDF is confident that it's fun, and knows that that trumps all else.

Beyond the thematic and technical camp, EDF has a well tuned difficulty curve and some extremely thoughtful challenges requiring both tactics and proper gearing. Co-op is wacky fun as well -- picture playing L4D against Power Rangers villains and you'll have a fairly good idea of what you're in for.

Definitely recommended.

24586604.review:
気が付けば１００時間以上ほどプレイしても全体の数％ほどのクリア率
というところで一旦レビューいたします。
例のごとく前半簡単なレビュー（PS版との差などを含む）、後半初心者さんへのアドバイスとなります。


--------------レビュー概要--------------
ゲーム性はシリーズ伝統の
どんちゃん騒ぎのTPSとなっております。
武器のLOOT要素や多数のステージ
武器・兵科・ステージ数ともに前作より増えており、ボリュームもあるものとなっております。
PS版と比較し画質が格段に上昇しており、展開の熱さに拍車がかかっております。
またPS版では深刻な問題だった『処理落ち』が改善されておりストレスフリーな環境でプレイが可能です。（GeFo770使用）
そういった魅力込みで既プレイの方も是非購入を検討してみてはいかがでしょうか？

それでは今日も元気に虫退治とまいりましょう！
[b]『EDFッ!!EDFッ!!』[/b]




--------------初心者さんへよりゲームを楽しむためのアドバイス--------------

☆難易度はどれを選べばいい？Inferno?
　やめましょう。
　高難易度の方が『良い武器』を入手できますが
　おとなしくまずは『Easy・Normal』でさくさくミッションをこなし、
　ストーリーを楽しむことをオススメします。
　またマルチプレイよりソロプレイの方が『難易度によるドロップするアイテムが変わらない』
　さらに『ソロプレイの方が格段に難易度が低い』
　ということを頭に入れておくと良いかと思われます。
　なおミッションの進捗は『ソロとマルチ独立している』ため注意が必要です。
　まぁマルチプレイで大騒ぎしつつプレイするのもこのゲームの魅力の一つなのですがね。

☆マルチプレイはFFとかあって怖いなぁ・・・
　低難易度でしたら多少ダメージが入っても軽減されますのでご安心を。
　ちょっとのFFでしたら『EDF!!』ってさけんで救出しておけば許されるでしょう。
　ただ高難易度になるにつれ『武器もFFダメージの倍率』も強化されるため気を付けましょう。

☆結局どの兵科が最強なの？
　ステージにより一長一短です。以下簡単にですが各兵科の特徴を記載いたします。詳細はWikiにてご参照ください。
　
　・シンプルイズベスト！『レンジャー』　難易度中
　　雑魚処理から遠距離からの戦艦破壊までそつなくこなす、使いやすい兵科です。
　・紅一点！『ウィングダイバー』　難易度低
　　高機動力、近中距離で高火力を発揮する兵科です。
　　個人的には２のペイルウィングの方が可愛かったと思います。
　・重戦車に巨大ロボ！男のロマン『エアレイダー』　難易度中
　　主に強力な車両やロボにて戦闘を行いたい方向けの兵科です。
　・全身武器の移動要塞！『フェンサー』　難易度高
　　チームの盾になったり、
　　移動力を犠牲にし多数の武器を搭載したい方はこの兵科をオススメします。
　　※と見せかけて『あるテクニック』を使用すると全兵科中最速で移動することが可能です。
　　　気になる方は『edf フェンサー テクニック』ででもググってみましょう。

最後にこちらのゲーム、アーマー（体力）の上限を増やす方法が少々面倒です。
自動で稼ぎたいなど抵抗のない方は[spoiler]『edf 稼ぎ』[/spoiler]などでググってみるとよりかと思われます。

24585802.review:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZH4FFt4IS2I

I didn't think I'd enjoy this game as much as I do when I first started hearing about it. I just wasn't sure mindlessly killing bugs with Michael-Bay-inspired exmplosions and gunfire was something that I'd enjoy past a level or two.

And yet, here we are, with me recommending this. It's glorious stupidity. It's America by way of Japan. It's Starship Troopers: The Third-Person Shooter. 

You destroy bugs with missiles, miniguns, and mecha. It's great, dumb fun. However, it's not without some frustrations.

The graphics options aren't as customizable as most games, which can be frustrating if you want to turn things up or down.

The UI can be wonky to navigate, as you use WASD instead of the mouse or arrow keys.

I WILL say that the game is much more entertaining with other people, but that's almost a non-issue with how easily you can find randoms to play with online. 

However, buddies always make it more fun. As I said frequently when playing this:

"OH, GOD, IT GOT ME! OH GOD!"

24585703.review:
I've played the game enough now to have a solid opinion on it.  I recommend this to anyone who loves run and gun, asymmetrical class archetypes and general destruction and decimation of entire city blocks.  It has fantastic(and active) co-op campaigns with plenty of replayable challenge modes to try.

Pros:
-Replayable
-Upwards of a hundred missions with many different enemies to fight
-Challenging in a good way
-Asymmetrical class gameplay where every class brings something good to the table
-Highly Destructible environments, buildings and vehicles go up in flames and crumbles
-Fast paced, hectic gameplay with most missions averaging between 5-20 minutes
-Hundreds of guns to choose from
-Runs well
-Co-op and splitscreen work flawlessly

Cons:
-The menu and UI are controlled via wasd and the mouse has a weird draw on the selection(move your mouse and you may select the wrong thing)
-Limited options menu.  Basically all you can change are vsync, AA and ratio/fullscreen and windowed.  No borderless here.  There are key rebindings but some seemed to be missing, but that could have just been me missing them.
-Controller is sometimes fussy with splitscreen, even using a proprietary xbox controller
-Dated graphics, though great taken as a whole are pretty much PS3 level of quality.  This REALLY shouldn't deter you, though.
-The picking up of items and armor isn't completely intuitive.  If you kill the last enemy and haven't managed to grab everything(especially difficult for air raider and mostly ranger due to their limited mobility) you're pretty much SoL for whatever dropped.
-Many items are fun but just aren't useful.  There are literally hundreds of guns to pick from but many are just so unwieldy that they're immediately outclassed.  This isn't surprising given the sheer number of available loadouts  but it's still a con.

In summary I think this is a great game but it's definitely not for everyone.  I love looting and killing things in interesting ways and this game has that in spades.  The classes are all unique and fun to play in their own way.  You can always bring something useful to the team and your loadout can heavily determine your success in a particular mission.  The game doesn't swamp you with bulletsponges but rather enemies that are legitimately dangerous.  Their health DOES go up with difficulty but it's hardly ever an unreal amount that can't be overcome by using the right weapons and strategy.

This game basically took the premise [b]"Wouldn't it be cool if....?"[/b] and ran with it.

If you want to see a few of the earlier missions played in hardmode; my friend and I did a first impressions video!
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZH4FFt4IS2I&feature=youtu.be

24583020.review:
I love this game.

Unadultared arcade fun. Straight to the point with no fluff.

For how janky the game might seem, it is deceivingly well-designed with a lot of minute detail. One of my favorite aspects of this game is how it manages to mask its arcadey nature - guns at first might seem not the best way to mow down hordes of giant insects and yet the flow of combat and difficulty feel just right. When you play as a Fencer (power-armor class) you'd imagine that the game would turn into Crackdown or Saints Row 4 in terms of having super abilities. And yet, in this game of eradicating giant bugs, the Fencer feels hefty and like you're really carrying all that weight on him, having to learn how to dash properly and then that grows into learning tricks like dash-cancels and so forth. Even vehicles operate too realistically from what you should expect from this game, but yet again, they fill in their gap just right without feeling over or underpowered.

Weapons are unlocked through a loot-box system, crates which you pick up during the mission and unlock after successfully completing it. Often times you will get already-unlocked guns but once you get something new it truly feels rewarding. Weapons themselves don't progress liniarly as some stats might be better over the previous weapon but it may have quirks which can make it even more useful or a gun for a very specific task. This game is a much better Borderlands than Borderlands itself in terms of whacky gun drops. And replaying old missions with newly acquired arms is always fun.

Four distinct classes, plenty of missions and a lot of detail which you wouldn't expect to be there nor would you have ever cared even if was absent.

I can just keep gushing over this game, it's just so good and filled with many damn fun moments, solo or in co-op.

It is a port, blatantly obvious port, but fairly stable for such.

Grab your AF14, sodlier - it's time to save the Earf, once more.

24582681.review: Like [i]Onechanbara Z2[/i], this PC port of a former PS4 exclusive came pretty much out of nowhere. [u]Un[/u]like [i]Onechanbara Z2[/i], however, this PC port is remarkably solid. Barebones, sure, as is (sadly) to be expected from a Japanese budget game, but other than suffering from a severe allergy to AMD processors, as well as the usual interface laziness, it comes without too many hiccups. It also runs fairly well on lower-end hardware (as it rightly should, given the lo-fi visuals, but that hasn't stopped a lot of last-gen port from far more prolific publishers that shall not be named to run worse than the bowel contents of a constipated sandworm). The game itself doesn't need much in terms of description. The series has a cult following for good reason, and [i]EDF 4.1[/i] is arguably the best game in the series so far. By releasing it on PC hardware, Sandlot have made a lot of folks happy, including myself. The price tag may be a bit steep - I got it as a surprise gift from a friend, so I really can't complain - but I'm quite sure there will be enough sales to make the mandatory acquisition of this glorious masterpiss of craftsman$hit only a matter of time for anyone interested. When I think of what I want out of every new console generation, I think of many things: more allies, hordes of enemies, bigger maps, and huge things (vehicles, ships, buildings, explosions, etc.). Take that game, set the graphics back about 10 years, and you have EDF 4.1

90+ (not 80+) levels, and enough maps that they'll only repeat a few times each (and they're large enough that that you won't play the same map the same way twice because you went through a different route nowhere near the first one)
800+ weapons (100+ weapons, some vehicles, and another 20-odd utility devices and each's 5+ upgraded versions)
20+ varied enemy types to use said weapons against, from ants, to bees, to bigger ants, to spiderrs, to tarantulas, to... Space... Godzilla?... to... Slinky Robots? Dragons? UFO's? THE SKY??!?!?!!?
5 difficulties (Easy, Normal, Hard, Multiplayer Normal No Really Don't Try This Alone, and Multiplayer Hard Why Are You In Singleplayer But Still Trying To Play This)
4 Classes (Mobile Infantry, Token Girl, Pathetic Nerd, Well-Armed Snail) armed with everything from an M16, to a souped-up grenade launcher, to a shoulder-mounted ICBM that requires another player with a laser designator just to fire, even to three skyscrapers in a trenchcoat trrying to sneak into the EDF.
Writing and monster design on par with a 1950's Japanese horror movie
The phrase "EDF! EDF!"

It's the Starship Troopers game that we did get but nobody remembers it

Alright, now that's out of my system, a brief review.
EDF is quintessentially the lovechild of Starship Troopers and War of the Worlds with a glorious amount of visually satisfying explosions and guns. Take your own army into battle against giant insects and ravagers that descend from space once again. Command your troops to sing on command as you cram a rocket launcher down a giant spider's stupid face. Roll constantly as a Ranger to Dark Souls your way to the enemy, whiz around as a Wing Diver like a magical girl out of an anime, bombard the aliens using artillery as an Air Raider, and be the dual minigun wielding badass Fencer that you want to be. 

All in all, this game is pretty neat to play on your own, but really shines when you play with friends. I give this an EDF out of 10. Make the Earth great again.

24562671.review:
Lots of explosions, lots of gear to unlock, many hours of play, and multiple characters to play through with. This game takes quite a bit of time to play through. I have only done a little over half of the missions on normal and some on hard with just the ranger (thats 1 of 4 classes). Multiplay has even more missions than the solo game. Each difficulty will give you better, more powerful, crazy weapons to cause mass distruction with.  Each class has its own unique gameplay.

-Rangers are the basic ground troop, best class to start with to learn the game. Their weapons consists of rifel, shotguns, and rocket launchers.

-Fencer is the melee/tank class. The deliver destructive close combat damage and heavy weapon support. Chain guns, cannons, shields, melee weapons and rocket launchers are their weapons.

-Wing diver is the fast flying class. They have little armor, but can engage enemies from above the battle field. High explosive plasma weapons, sniper rifles, and close quarter energy lances are their weapons of choice.

-Air raider is the support class. This is a co-op recomended class cause their abilities come from your team killing the enemies. They can call in airstrikes and other support attacks. They can also get vehicles air dropped in that they and the rangers can drive.

All in all this is a fun frantic game. I see myself playing with all the characters through multiple play throughs. 

10/10

24556725.review:
Представьте себе такую ситуацию — идете вы такие по побережью, никого не трогаете. Вдруг, «БАЦ!» — из моря вылезают десять Годзилл и начинают наступление в сторону города. Однако Силы Обороны Земли (Earth Defense Force, EDF) не теряются и быстро отправляют им навстречу десять огромных роботов с небольшим отрядом пехотинцев в качестве поддержки. Роботы и Годзиллы подходят друг к другу и начинают колошматить со всей дури, а тут командование сообщает «Тут гигантские жуки идут гадить роботам, сами по себе они от них не избавятся, быстро им на подмогу!».

И ТУТ ПОНЕСЛАСЬ! ВЫ НЕСЕТЕСЬ КАК УГОРЕЛЫЕ МЕЖДУ [strike]МОЛОТОМ И НАКОВАЛЬНЕЙ[/strike] РОБОТАМИ И ГОДЗИЛЛАМИ, СТАРАЯСЬ НЕ ДОПУСКАТЬ К НИМ ГИГАНТСКИХ МУРАВЬЕВ, ПОПУТНО ПАНИЧЕСКИ СЛЕДЯ ЗА ТЕМ, ЧТОБЫ И ТЕ, И ДРУГИЕ ВО ВСЕМ ЭТОМ УГАРЕ СЛУЧАЙНО ВАС В ЛЕПЕШКУ НЕ РАЗДАВИЛИ, ИЛИ НЕ ДАЙ БОГ РАЗОЗЛИТЬ ГОДЗИЛЛУ И ПЕРЕКЛЮЧИТЬ ЕГО ВНИМАНИЕ НА ВАС.

ЖУКОВ ПОМЕЛЬЧЕ МЕНЬШЕ НЕ СТАНОВИТСЯ И ТУТ К ГОДЗИЛЛАМ ПРИХОДЯТ НА ПОДМОГУ ЕЩЕ ДЕСЯТЬ ШТУК ГОДЗИЛЛ, А ПОКА КОМАНДОВАНИЕ ТЯНЕТ С ПОДКРЕПЛЕНИЕМ, ВАМ УЖЕ НЕ ДО ПОМОЩИ РОБОТАМ — ВЫ САМИ УЛЕПЕТЫВАЕТЕ ОТ ОПАСНЫХ КРАСНЫХ МУРАВЬЕВ, ПЫТАЯСЬ НАЙТИ В ЭТОМ ХАОСЕ АПТЕЧКУ. И НЕ УСПЕЛИ ЕЩЕ ДЕСЯТЬ РОБОТОВ ПРИБЫТЬ, ТАК НА НИХ СРАЗУ ЖЕ НАЛЕТАЮТ ГИГАНТСКИЕ ПЧЕЛЫ И НАЧИНАЮТ ОБСТРЕЛ ГИГАНТСКИМИ ИГЛАМИ.

И КОГДА КАЗАЛОСЬ БЫ, ЧТО ХУЖЕ БЫТЬ УЖЕ НЕ МОЖЕТ, ИЗ МОРЯ ВЫЛЕЗАЕТ КРУТОЙ МУТИРОВАВШИЙ ГОДЗИЛЛА И НАЧИНАЕТ МУТУЗИТЬ ВСЕХ ОСТАВШИХСЯ РОБОТОВ. ЧТО ТО ИСКРИТ ЧТО ТО ВЗРЫВАЕТСЯ ОТ МЕРЦАНИЯ НА ЭКРАНЕ УЖЕ НАЧИНАЮТ БОЛЕТЬ ГЛАЗА ВСЕ ИСТОШНО МОЛЯТ О ПОМОЩИ ОТ ВОЛНЕНИЯ ВЫ УЖЕ ЗАБЫВАЕТЕ О ЗНАКАХ ПРЕПИНАНИЯ. И ТУТ КОМАНДОВАНИЕ ТАКИЕ «ЭТО НАШ ПОСЛЕДНИЙ РОБОТ БЫСТРО НА БОРТ И МЧИСЬ ОСТАВШИМСЯ НА ПОМОЩЬ!!1». 

ПАНИЧЕСКИ КУВЫРКАЯСЬ ПОЧИЩЕ КАКИХ НИБУДЬ ДАРКСОУЛСОВ ВЫ ДОСТИГАЕТЕ РОБОТА ПРИНИМАЕТЕ УПРАВЛЕНИЕ ОГРОМНЫМ РОБОТОМ НА СЕБЯ И НЕЗАМЕДЛИТЕЛЬНО НАЧИНАЕТЕ ДВИЖЕНИЕ В СТОРОНУ КРУТОЙ МУТИРОВАВШЕЙ ГОДЗИЛЛЫ. ТОТ НАВАЛИВАЕТСЯ НА ВАС НО ВЫ ВСТАЕТЕ И ВРЕЗАЕТЕ ЕМУ ОГРОМНЫМ КУЛАКОМ В ЧЕЛЮСТЬ ОН КАРТИННО ГРОХАЕТСЯ НА ЗЕМЛЮ ТУТ ПОСПЕВАЮТ ОСТАВШИЕСЯ РОБОТЫ И ПОД ЭПИЧНУЮ МУЗЫКУ ВЫ ВЫБИВАЕТЕ ВСЮ ДУРЬ ИЗ ЭТОЙ ЯЩЕРИЦЫ. НА РАДОСТЯХ ОТ ПОБЕДЫ ВАС ПЕРЕПОЛНЯЮТ ЭМОЦИИ И ВЫ В РЕАЛЕ ОРЕТЕ «E-D-F!!! E-D-F!!1».

А если серьезно, то Earth Defense Force 4.1 — это настолько веселая (и местами хардкорная) игра, что уже на подсознательном уровне начинаешь не обращать внимание на такие вещи, как устаревшую графику и донельзя примитивные диалоги типа «За эти годы жуки эволюционировали, прогресс обогнал науку, это невозможно!». Вы просто торопитесь взять оружие помощнее , прыгнуть в орду врагов и начать палить во все стороны, наслаждаясь всей этой нездоровой атмосферой. И к тому же игра довольно разнообразна и помимо разнообразия видов врагов игра может похвастаться обширным арсеналом — можно не просто пострелять из футуристичных пушек, но и поиграть в аркадный симулятор военной техники, залланки с ранцем и мобайл-сьюта. Рекомендую всем любителям спинно-мозговых экшенов типа Alien Shooter.

И да, игра вам серьезно противопоказана, если вы страдаете боязнью пауков или пчел. Вы рискуете получить самый омерзительный хоррор в вашей жизни.

24552566.review:
Hallo und willkommen zu einem Review von Earth Defense Force 4.1 für den PC.
Earth Defense Force oder kurz EDF  ist ein Third Person Coop oder Singleplayer Shooter aus dem Hause Sandlot und ist eigentlich ehr im Asiatischen Raum bekannt.

Nichts destotrotz ist EDF ein purer Geheimtipp auch wenn man es erst nicht vermuten mag, weil dieser Titel Grafisch & Technisch gesehen schlechter abschneiden würde als Helena Fischer bei einem Hip Hop Konzert.
Also was macht dann EDF zu einem wirklichen Geheimtipp fragt ihr euch Mitsicherheit, na dann hört mal ganz gespannt zu !

Kurz gesagt ist das Spiel selbst die reinste Homage an so wirklich jedem Klischee eines  Invasions Film den jemals gab.
So werdet ihr schnell den Bezug zu Stormship Troopers, Independents Day oder Godzilla  entdecken, ebenso  die passenden Gegner Horden von Stormship Troopers geparrt mit Aliens und vielem mehr.

Um der Invasion auf den Pelz zu rücken habt ihr die Möglichkeit verschiedene Waffenkisten aus den Missionen zu bergen, diese Enthalten nach dem Abschluss der Mission für eure Klasse diverse Zufällige Waffen aus einem Sortiment von Rund 800 Waffen.

Das Gameplay an und für sich ist dabei recht Monoton aber durch und durch Unterhaltsam durch die Brachiale Art der puren Waffengewalt sowie den 4 spielbaren Klassen und dem grandiosen physikalischen banalen Zerstörungssystem. 

Alles in allem fügt sich letztendlich ein ganz Spezielles Bild zusammen welches man einfach mal Erlebt haben muss. 

Wer also ein Grafisches sowie Technisches Meisterwerk erwartet der sollte von EDF  eindeutig die Finger lassen.

Wer allerdings einen Spaßigen Solo sowie Coop Shooter sucht der Banaler und Lustiger nicht sein könnte der wird mit diesem Titel genau auf seine Kosten kommen ! 

Zudem gibt es genug Schwierigkeitsgräde um für jeden Spieler seine richtige Härte zu finden mit genügend Spielzeit. 
 
Wie immer ist EDF also ein klarer Geheimtipp !

Video zum Review: 

https://youtu.be/dcOfQ5VRh60

24550961.review:
You lower your head and something black minding it's own business on the sidewalk.  It's a 3 section insect that is carrying something in it's mouth.  Something it's probably going to bring back home to eat.  Curious, you extend your hand down, index and thumb outstretched and pick it up.  It starts panicing...it's trying to get flee.  A sadistic smirk forms as you take your other hand and rip one of it's legs off.  It's panicing gets more frantic which you reply back with tightning your grip on it.  You flip it over and rip it's other front leg off and flick it away with jubilance.  You lower yourself to the ground and place it on the middle of the sidewalk and watch as it struggles to move.  You could be merciful...  You could end it's misery, but you continue to stare at it.  The food it was going to bring back home long forgotten, it moves slightly to the left or to the right in a desperate attempt to escape it's tormentor.  Your smirk grows.  This brings pleasure to you as you look to your left and right to see if any other misfortunate insects will emerge from the grass when they should have stayed put.  Feeling like it's time to move on, you stand up, raise your foot, and end the miserable ant's suffering and continue on with your life as if nothing that transpired here had any significance on you what-so-ever.



Now it's their turn.  

Payback is a bitch.

野良でやっても楽しい。身内でやっても楽しい。シンプルイズベストを体現したようなトリガーハッピー系オールドＴＰＳ。海外の方もよく書いているけどシリアスサムが好きなような人にはたまらないでしょうね。PS3とかもってなくて購入を断念していましたが、ＰＣに来たということで購入。ネタも多くてワクワクしながら最後までいけました。

良い点
・終始漂うＢ級臭、シリアスなギャグ
・トリガーハッピー。ごく普通な武器に紛れ込んでいる馬鹿みたいな挙動をする武器達。
・多彩なラジオチャット。それに反応してくれるＮＰＣ達。ソロでも寂しくはない。EDF隊員がいるのだ。
・個人の趣味趣向、スキルレベルに合わせた４クラス。基本のレンジャーから援護のエアレイダー、発展型のウィングダイバー、フェンサー
・未配信のＤＬＣを含めて100を超えるステージ。
・思いのほかよく練りこまれているオンラインゲームバランス
・非常によく作りこまれた建造物。日本にきた事がある人ならおそらく最低でも1つはわかるだろう。更にほぼすべて破壊可能。

悪い点
・非常に蛇足で不必要なアーマー稼ぎ。平気でwikiに3時間放置とか書かれているがこんなものはチートで出したほうがマシ。だけど、オンラインを全難易度通しでやるとおそらく十分な数が集まる。
・ごく一部のステージでエアレイダーのすべての航空支援使用不可能な時間がある。

なんともいえない点
・マルチでの武器、アーマー限界解放に必要な条件がオンラインでの達成率が70%で途方もない時間が必要。とはいえ、おまけみたいなものなので必須というわけでもない。

24543242.review:
+ Local Co-op Splitscreen (A game that lets you couch co-op? What a rarity nowadays)
+ Fun, arcadey gameplay
+ Diverse weapon selection
+ 4 classes with their own pros and cons and specific playstyles and weapon selections
+ Plenty of missions to kill bugs in
+ 5 difficulties that the game entices you into trying: Easy, Normal, Hard, Hardest, Inferno
+ Gain more powerful weapons on higher difficulties
+ Giant mecha that can be operated by the player
+ Diverse vehicles for Air Raider class that are made either for solo play, team play, or both
+ Skin-of-your-teeth moments abound
+ Silly ragdolls

+/- Throwaway, drag-along "plot" that exists purely to introduce the next ridiculous enemy and give you reason to shout "EDF!"
+/- Some classes require the faintest amount of care and skill to use effectively (Fencer - Dash-canceling; Air Raider - Getting into the vehicle fast enough to prevent dying/Knowing what vehicles are best for certain missions; Wing Diver - Stop running into giant insect hordes with no energy management)
+/- Some missions are absolute hell for specific classes
+/- Odd spikes in difficulty [PERSONALLY] (I'm looking at you, Monster Party)

----- Armor grinding; Will explain below
- Online multiplayer has almost died out; You can find a small handful of games that aren't in moonrunes
- EDF 5 does not have confirmed PC release :(
- Some dodgy weapon balancing hither and thither
- The game ends at some point and you will eventually have to stop playing


[h1]To Save Our Mother Earth From Any Alien Attack[/h1]

EDF works fantastic with either controller or KB+M, which is something you might not expect from Japs when porting to PC if you've played some of the more notorious ones. It's non-serious, all-fun as you shoot explosives at giant ants and giant spiders and watch them all go boom. There's not much to say, personally. There is a fair amount of skill that you can use on certain classes, but in the end, it's at its best when played to kill time with friends. It's fantastic to binge on because of the fun it offers, and it's great on those offdays when you say to yourself "Man, what do I even want to do today?"

[h1]Our Forces Have Now Dwindled and We Pull Back to Regroup, or; How I Learned to Hate Armor Grinding[/h1]

"Armor" is your character's health. Armor is gained by a ratio; Each class has a different ratio as well. Without drawing the actual numbers, 2 boxes of Armor = 1 actual Armor for Ranger, the "basic" class that carries over from other EDF games. 4 boxes of Armor = 1 actual Armor for Wing Diver, the mobile and squishy class that focuses on manuevering through the air. These boxes of Armor have a [i]CHANCE[/i] of dropping from all enemies in the game. Other things that can potentially drop are: Small Healthpack, Large Healthpack, and Weapon Boxes. Armor gain is not affected by difficulty. This means that you gain the same amount of armor per crate regardless of difficulty. 2 crates = 1 Ranger armor whether Easy or Inferno. You start off with a measly amount of armor, which is to be expected. You are recommended to have ~5000 armor for Inferno, roughly. Armor gain does not transfer to other classes; If you have been playing Ranger throughout the whole campaign and got 5000 armor somehow, your untouched Wing Diver will still have ~200 armor that you will have to gain all over again; probably by going through the Normal/Easy difficulty campaign all over again, but with this class. 

This isn't necessarily bad; It encourages you to keep playing the game with these different classes until you gain both familiarity with the class as well as sufficient gear and armor. The problem is that armor farming is a slow process even at its most grindiest. And you have to do this with every single class. It is the most unfun part of an otherwise great game. The only workarounds are farming specific missions or using a cheating tool to modify your armor; obviously, neither of these are great. It is simply a sad reality.

Yet still, the game shines as a prime example of how to make a fun game in all other aspects. There's not much balancing for multiplayer and even singleplayer can seem a bit iffy sometimes. It takes experimentation to know what weapons to use on what missions against what enemies, but it's not impossible to understand. Sadly, some weapons are really mediocre compared to others and may tempt you to use these overall better choices, but this is not the whole case.

The armor grinding is horrendous, yes, but I completely urge you to buy the game, even if it's only when it is on sale. It's great fun alone and with friends the same.

24537422.review:
There is nothing hidden in the gameplay of this game.  What you see is what you get.  Repeatedly used models of a small number of enemy types used over and over again to create massive battles.  Despite that, the gameplay is very addictive for those who enjoy the destruction and havoc during each mission.  The game has a large assortment of weapons for each class, all of which need to be unlocked by playing progressively harder missions.  This ends up being a very long grind to get the weapons you want, but the missions are such pure mayhem and chaos that while some missions might feel similar, varied level design keeps the gameplay fresh.

On the technical side, the port is very solid, though the keyboard controls feel VERY shoehorned in.  They work, but not as well as a controller does, especially the fencer and air raider.  These two classes have an abundance of weapons that need to be finely adjusted, but to give them weight, their aim is slow to move.  This makes you FEEL as though you are aiming an enormous cannon, but while the controller just holds the stick upwards, the mouse has to continually move upwards, and most likely be picked up and placed lower on the mousepad to continue moving up.

Anyway, I'm ranting.  Expect nothing more than the trailers, campy one-liners and scifi tropes included, but expect a nigh-endless amount (despite about 95 missions, online only missions included), especially with friends (limit is four).

24532180.review:
I've played the PS4 version of this game and compared to the PC version,  I've noticed a lot better performance. I manage to slightly exceed the recommended requirements, and I have noticed drastic reduction of loading times, little to no frame rate drops, and slightly better graphics. As for the game itself, it gives you exactly as advertised: giant bugs, giant robots, giant everything. The story is simplistic and the voices are equivalent to a good bad movie, but the game play itself makes up for all of it.

Some are experiencing freezes and even crashes, so I can only recommend this for this who meet or exceed recommended system requirements as just like the console version, it requires a lot of processing power to handle. Console was pushed to its limits in this game with its large amount of bugs, particles, and enough big explosions on one screen that will make Michael Bay cry in joy.

If you like mindless fun killing giant creatures with weapons big and small and giant mechs, this is the game for you. Fun for all ages (ages 10+ though for minor blood effects). E-D-F!!!

30 minutes later              :"o wow not bad"

THE BAD

8/10 high fun factor and long replay value EDF!!! EDF!!! EDF!!! EDF!!!

24515378.review:
Never heard of EDF.
Never regret buying it.
Regret never hearing about it.
Never had framedrops on 4790k 980.
Never had problems with 4 player coop.

Reminds me of 20 different movies and games...
It's a malgamation...

There are 4 classes.  I'm sure they're equally fun.  But I've been using the heavy "Fencer".  He's basically a tank with legs and mortars.  I've stuck with him ever since.  HEAVY weapons, HEAVY and SLOW aiming.  But you get unlimited dash, so it pays off.  (be prepared to SWAP the left and right clicker in the Fencer options, he holds 4 weapons.  Address them accordingly.)  [should be default!]

I usually play 3RD Person shooters with a controller.  But I got on EDF with Mouse N Key and just stuck with it ever since.  (I can't even imagine how horrible it'd be with a controller.)  Navigating the UI with mouse n key is weird.  (maybe theyll update to have a cursor.)

It looks good.  I love how far I can see action.  The distance and tragectory. I don't see how anyone can complain.  Except maybe a way to keep the corpses around a little longer!

And I put the voices straight to Japanese VO.  I'll probably put English my 2nd playthrough.  It just proves story doesn't matter.  Mayhem overcomes, yeah, it's a bad situation.  I'm sure that's what they're saying.  And I actually LIKE the "Typing of the Dead".  So IF it's B-Movie style, I'm down with that too.  But I figure, we're in the streets of JAPAN, the civs are gonna be screaming in that language.

I only crashed twice.  But at least the 2nd time was right when we started a mission.
It runs the CPU a lil hot.  So keep your SH*T icy.

Jerry Springer type sh*t Final Thought:  I want everyone to play this.  Hundreds of UFO's dropping thousands of MASSIVE insects.  MIND BLOWN.  It has split screen too.  Aliens FRACKING on a global scale!  It's a fun and scary thought.

24511654.review:
This game is amazing, I only played Insect Armageddon before this and that barely counts as an EDF title, it misses the jank fun charm the series is known for. However 4.1 here has it in spades. For example there is a homing rocket launcher that fires 30 at once causeing a tiny Itano Circus or a jumping spider mech with twin flame throwers.
       It's an extremely fun couch co-op game (they kept splitscreen for the pc version). It is completely hilarious and doesn't take much skill so really anyone can play. 
       Your ability to play higher difficulties is based on your drops, the problem is the drops don't seem to have set levels so if there is a kind of weapon you need before you can move onto Hardest (not the hardest difficulty) or Inferno you may need to grind mission 26. 
       My only other problem is that in online co-op there are level caps to weapons you can use by difficulty, it's to prevent people from being carried, but the only reason I want to go into a higher difficulty right now is to get a better weapon for a lower one.

24511526.review:
เป็นเกมที่ถ้าเล่นคนเดียว น่าจะน่าเบื่อ+ธรรมดามากๆ เลยนะ

แต่พอ Co-op เท่านั้นแหละ (ยิ่งกะเพื่อนนะ) เกมแมร่งโครตทรงคุณค่าเลย อย่างฮา ถถถถถ

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
รายละเอียดเพิ่มเติม (คร่าวๆ นะ เพราะยังเล่นไม่ครบทุกด่าน)

เราจะได้เล่นเป็นหน่วย EDF ไล่ฉีดไบกอนใส่แมลงต่างดาวตัวยักษ์ (ไบกอนก็ปืนนั่นแหละ)
การเล่นเป็นแบบเลือก Mission เลือกคลาส เลือกอาวุธแล้วเล่นให้จบเป็นด่านๆ ไป โดย Objective ส่วนใหญ่ที่เจอคือฆ่าให้หมด

มีคลาสให้เลือกเล่น 4 คลาส
1. Ranger - ทหารราบธรรมดา แต่ใช้อาวุธได้หลากหลาย สามารถขับยานพาหนะของ Air Raider ได้
2. Air Raider - ยูนิตซัพพอร์ต อาวุธกากกว่า Ranger เพราะส่วนใหญ่จะเน้นฮีล บัฟ เรียก Artillery Support และที่เด่นสุดๆ เลยคือใช้พาหนะได้ 1 อย่าง มีตั้งแต่มอเตอร์ไซค์กีกี้ ไปยันหุ่นยักษ์ตัวใหญ่กว่าตึก
3. Wing Diver - ยูนิตประเภทเดียวที่บินได้ อาวุธจะเป็นประเภท Energy ที่สามารถ Regen เองได้ Energy จะใช้ทั้งในการบิน และเป็นกระสุนให้อาวุธ ถ้าเผลอใช้หมดถัง ต้องรอคูลดาวน์ เพราะ Overheat
4. Fencer - ตู้เย็นเดินได้ (คลาสนี้ไม่ค่อยได้เล่น ข้อมูลน้อย) อึด ถึก ช้า อาวุธแรง แต่ยังสามารถแดชหรือกระโดดได้ในระยะสั้นๆ

ความสนุกของเกมนี้อาจจะเป็นการสะสมอาวุธและทดลองใช้อาวุธซึ่งมีอยู่หลากหลายมาก ใน Mission ที่เรารับมาพวกแมลงอาจจะดรอปกล่องอาวุธมา และเมื่อเราเล่นจบด่านนั้นๆ เราก็จะได้อาวุธในกล่องนั้นมา ซึ่งได้แบบ Random อาจจะได้ของดี ของกาก หรืออาจจะของซ้ำก็ได้ ซึ่งคุณภาพของอาวุธจะขึ้นอยู่กับความยากของด่านที่เราเล่น ยิ่งยาก ของแรร์ยิ่งมีโอกาสตกมาก

24510847.review:
首先这是咱写的第二篇测评/w
怎么说呢，如果你寻求的是爽快和电影一样的感觉，那么这款游戏也许很适合你，但如果你追求的是显卡危机那样的极致画面，那么这个恐怕真的并不是那么合适。
游戏中你要面对的是成群的，真的是成群的虫群，飞机，机甲，榴弹和火箭弹在虫海中爆炸的火光，漫天飞舞的残肢，被误射或者被外星人击垮的大楼，这一切都充满了十足的爽快感。
总的来说
+超爽快的割草？感
+有时会有迷の动漫或者电影代入感
+武器种类还算是相当丰富的（不过也有不少逗比玩意）
+感觉十分优秀的优化使得大量虫海以及建筑还有爆炸并不会有很明显的丢帧卡顿
+爆炸爆炸爆炸无论是能量武器还是火箭弹榴弹RPG轰炸炮击，当爆炸在虫群中绽开的时候那种迷の爽快的感觉
+EDF队员偶尔会有迷の喜感的flag
+-多到爆炸的关卡数量
-如果你有蚂蚁恐惧症这游戏可能并不适合你
-如果你有蜜蜂恐惧症这游戏可能并不适合你
-如果你有蜘蛛恐惧症这游戏可能并不适合你
-如果你是苛刻的画面党恐怕你需要好好看一下预告决定一下自己能不能接受这样的画面
-战斗结束后战利品不能自动拾取以至于你经常需要留下一两个怪一边保证不被AI打死一边满地图的滚？或者跑着捡东西
-？目前貌似还没有汉化可用（不过用官方的日语也基本没啥问题的都能看懂）
总的来说这是一款非常不错的游戏，非常的爽快，非常的割草，而且还可以四人组队互坑（咦？），如果你想要玩一些现代武器的割草爽快的游戏的话，那么推荐你可以试试的

24504472.review:
Extréme návyková a zábavná arkádová hra z pohľadu tretej osoby

Strieľate obrovských pavúkov, robotov, UFO a ďalšie veci. Vaše úlohy sú najprv strieľať, potom strieľať, potom ešte viac strieľať aby bola istota že je každý nepriateľ mŕtvy a žiadne otázky sa nepýtať. 
Príbeh v hre prakticky neexistuje, ani ho nie je treba, ale hra je plná tak hrozných dialógov, že je to až výborné a budete sa smiať na tom, aké je to celé príjemne blbé.

Hra obsahuje 4 triedy vojakov, každý s odlišnými zbraňami a zameraním. A že je tých zbraní, cca. 200 pre každú triedu. Niekto udenie zbrane 2, niekto až 4 a každý vyžaduje iné zaobchádzanie a má iné + a -, takže svojho ohľúbeného si nájde každý. Nové zbrane si odomknete zbieraním bední počas boja ktoré vypadnú z nepriateľov a tak isto si zvýšite vaše zdravie, alebo sa ošetríte.

Hra obsahuje 80+ misií a 5 obtiažností. Vyššia obtiažnosť znamená odomknutie lepších zbraní, ale aj odolnejších nepriateľov, takže obtiažnosť je dobré zvyšovať len veľmi postupne, najprv si odomknúť lepšie zbrane na nižšej obtiažnosti.

Online kooperácia dovoľuje až 4 hráčov súčasne a vtedy sa naplno ukáže aký zábavný chaos dokáže vyvolať využitie všetkých druhov vojakov v jednom boji. Netcode je stabilný, žiadny lag, rýchle načítavanie, len nezabudnite že váš online progress misií je od toho v single-player móde separátny. Zbrane a výbavu si ale viete prenášať z jedného do druhého.
Online má tak isto dobrú featurku ktorú je ale možné vypnúť a to limit na použité zbrane, aby ste nemohli s level 50 zbraňou hrať na obtiažnosti normal a decimovať nepriateľov po desiatkách. Pre výzvu ale odporúčam toto nastavenie nevypnúť. Je tu dokonca aj split-screen !

Množstvo obsahu v hre je až neuveriteľný a hra vám vydrží na niekoľko desiatok až stoviek hodín aby ste si odomkly väčšinu hry. A dosiahnuť 100% ? To zaberie veky vekúce. Zábava aj sólo, ale ak máte niekoho ďalšieho na coop či dokonca ste až štyria, tak je to brutálny zábavný masaker aký nemá obdoby.

24501673.review:
This is literally the best Gantz video game ever made, if only it had more boobs it'd be perfect.

+ Ridiculous amount of content for the price. (98 missions and 6 difficulty options.)
+ 800 different weapons and their variations.
+ Over 30 different enemies.
+ 4 Classes (Ranger, Wing Diver, Air Raider and Fencer.)
+ Entirely focused on gameplay, ditch the story out of the window because this one is all about killing stuff.)
+ Supports single-player, 2 player splitscreen and 2-4 player online coop. (Online netcode is really good.)
+ Mouse & Keyboard controls work well, no mouse acceleration or anything like that.
+ Runs mostly at 1080p/60fps with the recommended system requirements. (Although when you have 4 Air Raiders in online coop and all of them launch airstrikes at the same time you're going to be in for a pretty bad time. :D)
+ You can pilot a mile high mech and punch a Chinese Godzilla ripoff in the face.

- The game is hard locked at 60fps, unless someone fixes this it's gonna stay as a negative.
- Very limited graphic options, you can basically only choose between the resolution and having the game in fullscreen or not.
- If you like to have a good story in your game then DO NOT PLAY THIS GAME! STAY FAR AWAY! YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED!

I honestly can't figure any more negatives about the game. Even my girlfriend who isn't huge into gaming absolutely loved playing this for over two hours in splitscreen. If you like killing stuff and games purely about gameplay then this is a must buy.

24501549.review:
１．諸君は他のレビューでグラフィックが低い、旧作から変わっていない、等といったコメントをしばしば見かけることと思う。
しかし、それらはこのゲームの「映像表現の素晴らしさ」を損なうものではないということを言っておかなければ、公平とはいえないだろう。

十分に広大なフィールド、戦場を照らしだす爆炎、群がり押し寄せる敵…EDFはこうした要素を非常に秀逸な表現に仕上げている。
巨大蟻の顔面が詳細に美麗に仕上げられていたとして、諸君は嬉しいのか？
（もしそうなら、ゲームより蟻飼育セットを買ったほうがいいだろう）
つまり、「何のために」…これを見失わないゲームは、良いゲームだ。

２．こうしたことは、ゲームの他の要素についても言える。
このゲームは、派手で、激しく、そして楽しく戦い尽くすために作られている。
弾丸をばら撒き、爆破し、時には狙撃し、戦車やロボットに乗り込んで蹂躙し、あるいは蹂躙される！
そして叫ぶ、EDF！EDF！

３．されど物事に欠点はつきものである。
諸君はなかなか成長しないアーマー値に苛立つかもしれない。
沢山のアイテムを拾い集めなければならない事にうんざりするかもしれない。
ただ、その過程を楽しめるとしたら、それは些細な事なのかもしれない。

４．CPUがAMDだとクラッシュするらしい。パッチを入れれば一応動かないでもないようだ。
[strike] しかし一体なんでそんなもの積んでるんだ？[/strike]

５．もう一度：EDF！EDF！

PCで出るまで２以降 *一切していなかった*。
コントローラーで遊ぶような分野ではないと感じたからだ。
まして極度の処理落ち。
しかし、今回のsteam参入で念願のキーボード及びマウス、そして高解像度でストレスフリー！・・・とまではいかなかった。

伝統のAI、前に出るな。
手間がかかるだけの拾い集め。
戦闘に集中できない一因。

それらを公式でサポートしきれないようなら、MOD作れるようにすれば良いんじゃないかと思う。
公式の負荷も減るだろうし、こちらも望む機能が得られる。
そろそろ国産にもMOD文化導入して（切実）、どうぞ。

24495491.review:
[b][h1]EDF, EDF, EDF!! Sandlot brings a great game to PC with excellent optimization.[/h1][/b]

[b]For the first time, you can play a Sandlot EDF game with a nearly 100% stable 60FPS.[/b]
Needless to say, to any EDF fan this is a dream come true. 60FPS was one of the bullet points for the PS4 version, and disappointingly it couldn't hold up to. The game performance was wildly variable with it spending most of the time under 60FPS and constant screen tearing to boot, thanks to the Adaptive Vsync used by the game.
It was by no means unplayable;considering if you suffered through past EDF games;,but just that much out from the dream.

Now we have this, not only at 60FPS, but with free online and even SPLIT SCREEN. Something that is often ripped out of PC Ports! Sandlot is great. (Despite minor issues)

[h1]Pros[/h1]
[list]
[*]Great performance, 
CPU limited. The only way I could get the game to drop frames was for things to really go nuts using physics, like blowing up multiple buildings. Which on my aging 1st Generation Core i7(Even overclocked to 4Ghz), will probably result in worse drops in these situations compared to a recent gen Intel Core CPU.

My GTX 980 uses only up to about 25%(+-5%) usage at 1080p 60. Suffice to say, even a much lower end card should be just fine.
[*]Good KB&M support
It's not great however as navigating the start menu and the main menu is odd. You'll have to use the keyboard for this, but even after remapping keys, the start menu still is hardcoded to WASD for movement. Not whatever you have remapped them to.

Rotation sensitivity is mouse sensitivity (Carryover from PS4 version)
Hopefully this will be patched.
[*]Split-Screen!
This is great, EDF shines in Co-op locally or online. I haven't tested performance yet, but I'd imagine it be more performance hungry than Solo. On PS4, this brought the framerate down even more. 

[*]Arbitrary Resolution Support!
They had an issue with it at launch, but Sandlot patched it. Resolution works correctly now. 

Take that ShitEnix, ShitmoKoei and the rest of you yuckles!
[*]AA
EDF4 has some pretty nasty aliasing on all UI elements and even in the game. So thankfully they included an option for this. BUT, it seems to be partially broken ATM. Only working on UI elements and character models (In the main menu only,) In game AA doesn't do anything.

http://screenshotcomparison.com/comparison/179024

Hopefully just a bug. Even still, the UI clean up is very worthwhile and much nicer looking than the PS4 version.
It scales up with resolution beautifully too. The entire thing. I don't know what they are doing for the UI, but it is better than a lot of other developers. It looks great at every resolution.
[*]Free Online!
Do I need to say more? No more being stuck behind the PS+ paywall. Which frankly isn't worth the money for MP games that don't use Dedicated Servers. Which EDF didn't and doesn't here AFIK.
[*]A lot of replayability, despite uneven mission design.
There are 89 base missions for solo mode and several additional ones for online only.
Now take that and multiply it by 4 difficulties. Sometimes things get changed around in harder missions, tougher enemies, more of them,etc.
In Co-Op there is a separate multiplier as well to make it more dififcult based on the number of players.
Add in 4 very different clases with over 800 weapons total.

[*]You can get in a 50M tall Mecha and fight Godzilla basically. The scale of it is amazing.
Especially if you forego the Mecha and do it on Foot!

[*]There is a sense of scale to the environments and enemies that few games pull off as well as EDF4. Even with it's visuals.
[/list]
_________________________________________________

[h1]Cons[/h1]
[list]

[*]Not many Graphical Options. Making scalability tough.
You can turn AA&Shadows off.
AF can be set up to 16 or turned off  (Point or linear i'm assuming when off).

And that's it.

[*]Chat Wheel seems broken currently. 
It doesn't do anything when you select an option. No speech bubble, no sound when a yell/sing choice is selected.

[*]AA seems broken currently. 
http://screenshotcomparison.com/comparison/179024

[*]Bringing up the Chat Wheel currently seems to cause hitching/skipped frames about 3/8ths of the time.

[*]Awkward Mouse/KB Support in menus.

[*]Wish it supported the DS4 natively like some other games.

[*]Mission design is farily uneven and uncohesive. There is some overarching narrative through voice overs that ties things together. But it's all a bit haphazard. It works well enough though.

[*]Achievements/Trophies are on the INSANE side. To get them all, you'd have to beat the game with every class on 4 difficulties, accross 89 missions. Nuts baby. In addition to other mundane and grindy stuff. 
Don't get me wrong, I love EDF. But this is ughsville.

[*]LoDs and draw distances for shadows are very aggressive. But it's understandable considering how much shit is going on screen at times.

[*] [b]Price[/b]. They are asking 50$ for a digital only version of a game that launched with a physical copy brand new at 40$ on PS4. It's 35$ the fist week, meanwhile EDF 4.1 on PS4 is still sitting at 20$ on Amazon.

[*]No option for push to talk. Mics always on. You know how this goes..
You can mute it selective in mission select but.. volume would be nice!


[*]Text scaling issues even at 100% DPI in Windows 7 at resolutions lower than 1920x1080
Not a problem in the PS4 versions(It ran at 1080p though, sooo, not a huge deal)
http://u.cubeupload.com/MrBonk/EDF41201607202151519.png
The very right edge of some letters are still slightly cutoff in various menus as well.
[/list]
Is EDF4.1 worth 50$? If it's your first time purchasing the game. I'm going to lean on yes. But to those of us who bought 2025 and 4.1 both new at full price. No.
So i'd wait for a sale. If it goes on sale for 35$ again, GRAB IT.
_____________________________________________________________________


There were some more issues, but they have been removed from my review because Sandlot patched the game on August 4th 2016. 
Even better, a developer that actually gives a crap and fixes problems with their game! Something other big companies like *Cough* ShitEnix, ScamcoBandai*cough* rarely ever do.

24491959.review:
あの地球防衛軍が進化して帰ってきた！ついでに侵略宇宙人と巨大生物も進化して帰ってきた！

今作はPS4で発売された同タイトルゲームの移植です。
ゲーム内容としては、タイトルがすべてを語っていると言っても過言ではありません。
地球を侵略する巨大生物（主にでかい虫）や宇宙人のロボットをミッション開始前に選び、装備した武器で倒していくゲームです。
敵を倒すと確率でアイテム（永続的にHPを増やすアーマー、武器、HP回復）を落とすので、それを拾ってキャラを強化してまた次のミッションに挑むという流れでゲームは進みます。
ミッションが難しくて進めない場合でも、ミッション開始時に選べる難易度を下げたり、以前のミッションで武器やアーマーを集めたりなど、解決策は色々あります。
武器に関しても、兵種によりますが、アサルトライフルやスナイパーライフル、ミサイルやロケットランチャーといったものからパイルバンカーやハンマーなどの近接武器も用意されており、爆発物で敵を蹴散らしたり、スナイパーライフルで確実に一体ずつ処理したり、自分の好みの方法で地球を防衛できます（ただしフレンドリーファイアがあるので自爆に注意）。
PS4版は未プレイですが、PC版ではこのシリーズの名物（？）であった処理落ちもほとんどなく、これを寂しいと思うかは人それぞれではあると思いますが、個人的には快適にプレイ出来て嬉しかったです。

COOPもあるので皆も友達を誘ってEDFに入隊しよう！
そして市街地を更地にしながらついでに迫り来る侵略者たちを返り討ちにしよう！

PCで地球を守れる日が来た
とは言え自分のグラボは推奨スペックすら下回るRadeon　HD6670ではあるものの
よっぽど負荷のかかる大量の建造物破壊や大量のNPCを引き連れたりしない限りは問題なく遊べているので満足

追記：シングルプレイの際は後半になるにつれてカクつきが目立ちますがマルチの時はシングルよりも軽いように設定されているのかシングルの時ほどカクつくことはない
が、やはりさくさくとしたプレイ環境が欲しいならグラボはできるだけ推奨スペックに近づけたほうが良いかと感じます

追記その２：その他のスペックは据え置き、グラボをGTX750Tiに換装いたしました、前回までのグラボと比べ遥かに性能が良くなったのでプレイ中はさくさくと軽快に動いているのですが2つ気になった点を
・開始直後一瞬簡素なモデリングになるが綺麗に戻る
　　プレイに支障をきたすことではないですがRadeon　HD6670というこのゲームをプレイするには貧弱なグラボでは起こっていなかった現象です
　　他所で聞いた話によるとTitanを使用しているハイスペックPCのでも開幕のほんの一瞬は簡素なモデルが見えている、との声もありました
　　勝手な推測に過ぎませんがRadeonにて最適化されているため起こっているのではないかと考えています
　　ですがプレイの最中に発生するわけでもないので大した問題ではありません
・メニュー内で装備や兵種変更の際のカクつき
　　これもGeforce特有なのかはっきりしませんが前回の貧弱とはいえRadeonのグラボでは起こっていない現象です
　　体感ですが切り替えの際はRadeonの方がスムーズでGeforceの方はカーソルを移動させる際にカクカクとしている感じがします
　　私としては上よりもこちらの点が少し気になるといった程度です

この2つくらいですね、なんだかGeforceに何か恨みでもあるのかという感じになってしまいましたが
ストアのほうでも当初は推奨スペックのグラボの欄にはGeforceの名前は無かったので遠からずといったところではないかと考えています

もう一度書いておきますがどちらのメーカーにせよゲームプレイ自体はスペックに問題がなければ全く苦もなく遊ぶことは可能です

しかし上記の2点が気になる、このゲームのためにグラフィックボードを変えたい、メーカーに特に拘りを持っていないのでどっちでも選べるという方はRadeonにしておいたほうが良いと思います。

Neste game você terá que combater milhares de insetos enquantro avança na historia, que não é bem o forte do game, mas irá se divertir muito e com certeza, encontrará um bom desafio, enquantoestiver a lutar contra os... ah jogue!

- Variedade gigante de armas, mesmo com varias armas de mesmo modelo e variando pouco, você terá uma bela meta pela frente.

Pontos contras:

- Algumas vezes, uma animações tem o grafico estranho. Chega até ser hilário, você entrar no tanque do seu amigo e quando disparar a metralhadora dele, ver uma animação meio fixa.
- Alguns usuários relataram problemas com processadores AMD pra joga o game, mas até então o jogo nunca travou pra mim nem apresentou problemas, uso um AMD FX-4100 QuadCore. Os desenvolvedores estão verificando se existe este problema e recomendam que você esteja atento a configuração minima pra se rodar o game.
- Gosto da idéia de pagar um preço alto em um game bom mas o fato de ainda ter mais de 70 Reais em conteudo adicional torna a coisa meio ruim... Embora sejam armas que nao fazem falta, não deixa de ser conteudo adicional, poderiam diminuir um pouco o preço.

24475811.review:
An extremely fun and addicting arcadey third person shooter. You shoot giant bugs the size of houses such as ants, spiders, hornets, robots, and more. They explode in a nice shower of blood and bodyparts as well as satisfying death sounds. There's very little of a story as it's just mission based where your objective is always to kill everything. The lack of story is ok because it isn't needed, and what is there is B-movie entertaining.

There are 4 entirely distinct classes with each class having ~200 unlockable weapons each. Each class can carry 2 weapons except the fencer who can use 4 and the air raider who can also equip a vehicle (to request on the battlefield). You get weapons by picking up the green cases dropped by enemies and then it's random what you get at the end of the mission based on difficulty and mission number (the higher for both the better the potential weapon drops). You can also pick up red armor boxes which increase your max armor (health) at the end of a mission at differing rates for the 4 classes.

There is single player with a whopping 89 missions with 5 difficulties for each. The missions are short being 5-20 minutes long depending on difficulty and the mission. Online mode has 96 or so missions but progress in mission completion is independent of single player. You can play with up to 3 other people by having either public or private player slots. The more players the harder the enemies are compounded with whatever difficulty you chose. Weapons you find in online mode are available in single player and vice versus. The only problem I personally have with online is that there are weapon level limits you can use depending on the mission and difficulty. To use an inaccurate example say you chose mission 10 and difficulty hard in online mode, the game will only let you use weapons up to level 20, so your powerful level 50 weapon you can't use. The purpose is to have balance so people with uber weapons can't go to someone's easy game and obliterate everything. And finally there is splitscreen co-op which is something extremely rare for pc. It means 2 people can play on the same pc with the screen split down the middle, just like consoles are famous for. You need a controller for player 2.

The friendly ai is really annoying though. They are famous for getting in front of you blocking your shots and especially getting in the way of your explosives causing them to explode on you, even killing you on harder missions where friendly fire is higher. The enemy ai is adequate for the most part. No advanced tactics, they just swarm you and sometimes wander around. Occasionally they get stuck somewhere and you have to follow the radar to find and kill them to finish the mission.

The dialogue is really hilarious. Listening to your EDF soldiers talk among themselves is always good for a laugh. And of course everyone likes the EDF song "To save our mother earth from any alien attack..."

The amount of content and playtime here is staggering. Even if you concentrate on only one character you'll get dozens of hours of enjoyment. Not to mention online mode. Worth every dollar!

24466554.review:
Ever wanted those cool huge-scaled war battles with BIG enemies you see in movies to be made into videogame, but the closest you got was yet another AAA-game with just some cool-looking but non-interactable background action while you're dealing with a maximum of ~10 enemies at once? Look no further! 

Alien ships so big it takes a whole minute for them to fall after you shoot them down! Hundreds of enemies on screen simultaneously! (flying ones can literally cover all the visible sky around you) Giant robots sending you flying with their steps! Kill them all while shouting cheesy one-liners or singing inspiring songs along with teammates!

The most fun videogame i've played in quite a while. Sharing this experience with friends makes it 10 times better.

24463981.review:
You may think that this game is a mere hack-and-slash genre, like in Dynasty Warriors or Saints Row. No. Yall are wrong.

This game is just a commentary of Imperial Japan's military aggression against the United States during World War II. EDF = Japan. Opposition (Aliens, Bugs, etc,.) = USA. Like Imperial Japan, EDF lacked the advanced weaponry and the numbers of her opposition (aka USA). Thus, my fellow comrades were both heavily outgunned and outnumbered to the point where I became a lone survivor to this inevitable doom. Remember the mission where only merely-poor tanks and rangers must defend the beach against the superior alien robots (the one without the free bombing run)? Doesn't this mission ring a bell? If not, ignorance must be erradicated as this mission represents the US beachhead operation on Iwo Jima. Many of my fellow soldiers were swiftly rewarded a plane ticket to Yasakuni Shrine. How about the alien attacks on civilian in urban environments? That represents the US firebombing of Japan during the course of the war. 

Despite our tremendous losses, I sense the Spirit of Yamato, the Essence of Bushido, and the Presence of the Samurai within the physical bodies of the EDF. Like the Imperial Japanese, the EDF fighting spirit will always outmatch the weapons of the foreign devils. Their arrogance only focus on material. We, EDF, focus on willpower. If I choose the side between Imperial Japan or USA, I'd obviously join Imperial Japan. The Emperor needs me. The white devils will never hinder me. The Yamato Race will live on to bring peace to the world through military unification like our Fore Fathers did during Sengoku Jidai, the invasions of Korea, the war against the Russians, and the conquest on the Chinese. OUR SPIRIT BULLETS ARE NO MATCH AGAINST THEIR LASERS, ACIDS, CLAWS, MANDIBLES, PHOTONS, SPIDER WEBS, ETC,. GUNS UP, MY NAKAMA! WE SHALL FIGHT WITH KATANAS DRAWN, DE ARIMASU!

24463534.review:
정말 이 게임을 "요즘 그래픽보다 못하고 인터페이스 보기에 구려서 별로인 게임이다"라는 편견으로 접하지 못하시는 일이  없기를 바랍니다. 처음 얼핏 봤을땐 "아 그냥 시리어스샘 느낌나는 그런 게임이겠지" 라고 판단했습니다만 잘못된 판단이였습니다. 그런식의 마구잡이 싹슬이 게임이랑은 다릅니다. 컨트롤도 아주 중요하고 상황에 맞는 무기 조합및 무기의 적절한 레밸도 중요합니다. 물론 나름의 공략도 필요하죠.

 미션수는 80개가 넘어가고 거기에  아주 다양한 무기가 있고 거기에 장비 레밸도 있어서 파밍요소도 충분하며, 개성있는 4가지 클래스로 인해 운용법도 다양하고. 패드의 찰진 진동을 느낄수 있습니다. 컨트롤도 아주 중요하고 상황에 맞는 무기 조합및 무기의 적절한 레밸도 중요합니다. 물론 나름의 공략도 필요하죠. 미션 별로 아주 넓은 도심및 야외 부터 좁은 지하 동굴등등 그래픽은 구리지만 표현은 잘 되어있고 도심에서는 건물들을 마구잡이로 부수면서 플레이 가능합니다. 난이도도 이지부터 인페르노까지 다양합니다. 난이도가 올라갈수록 적도 강해지고 팀샷으로 인한 피해량도 최대 100퍼까지 점차 올라갑니다.
 아! 또 한가지 게임을 하면서 드랍되는 장비상자(녹색)외에 아머 상자(붉은색)가 있는데 이걸 많이 획득할수록 점점 자신의 체력수치도 증가합니다. 영구적으로 말이죠. 다만 미션은 성공해야 습득한 물품이 획득가능해집니다.
 
 듣기론 전작은 클래스2개뿐인데다 그래픽은 지금은 못봐줄정도고 현재 스팀으로 올라와있다는군요. 어느분 말이 이 게임은 이번작에 와서야 완성되었다고 평하니 한번해보시면 좋을듯 싶네요. 

 현재 세일중이긴한데 기본 가격이 너무 높게 책정되있다는점이 상당한 마이너스 요소네요. 원래 콘솔에 있다가 넘어왔다고 듣긴했습니다. 자세한건 모르지만요.

 ps 비슷한 게임이 뭐없나 싶어서 생각해봤더니 헬다이버즈를 3d로 플레이 하는 느낌이랑 비슷할듯 싶네요. 물론 스케일은 이쪽이 더 큽니다.

24461066.review:
This game has some minor mechanical oddities and a few admittedly quite amusing bugs but it is a fantastic game best played with other people so you can have someone to sing the EDF song with constantly or do dumb shit with.
Also the voicechat system in this game, while lacking in a toggle, is surprisingly solid and manages to catch your voice without catching too much of the background.

The dialogue and story is also just presented in such a wacky, cheesy way that it's so bad it's good, and believe me, that's very intentional as you might notice from the awesome trailers on the steam page that are just completely hillarious.

10/10 would sign EDF's anthem again and again mid-mission.

24459124.review:
Hier mein Senf:
Kurz und knapp:

Grafik?: Nicht gut, erfüllt seinen zweck ( Im Verlauf des Spiels explodiert eh alles nurnoch).

Sound?: Alles in allem o.k. 7/10
Erster Eindruck?: Menü ist sinnerfüllend gestaltet,jedoch hatten die Devs wohl keine lust ein gutes PC Layout zu entwerfen. mehr oder minder 1 zu 1 von der Konsole übernommen ( Ja sogar der Split-Screen-Modus wurde übernommen. - Wtf?)

Steuerung: Zweischneidig- Im Menü Ist WASD angesagt, Maus funktioniert zwar rudimentär, aber Mauszeiger? Fehlanzeige. Im Spiel - recht angenehm, bis auf die Fahrzeuge mit 4 waffen.

Ki?: Reicht aus, aber nicht gut.

Was erwartet mich?: Bin nun mittlerweile Mission 41 ( Ich spiele quer durch die Schwierigkeitsgrade, deshalb recht langsam). 
-Es erwartet Dich Non-Stop action im Sci-fi stil, viel geballer, viele Effekte, teilweise Großartige Kulissen (Wenn z.B. ****** in scharen auf dich zulaufen und du dir nur denkst" Oh scheisse" 
-5 Schwierigkeitsgrade, allesamt spürbar unterschiedlich voneinander
- Massen !!!!! an Waffen, wodurch sich verschiedene Spielstile entwickeln (die Du auf höheren Schwierigkeitsgraden auch definitiv brauchst).
- Einen Earth Defense Force Gesangs-Chor.

Kaufempfehlung?: Geschmackssache, denke man kann es tendenziell mit Dynasty Warriors vergleichen. Magst du stumpfes geballer auf Zahllose Gegner? Wenn ja dann JA.

Achja, am besten mit einem Freund spielen, steigert den Spaß ungemein. ( bis zu 4 Spieler online modus)

24456145.review:
Okay, this is a PC port, so it should be reviewed as one and not a game in and of itself.

What they did right:
Skippable intros
Skippable cutscenes
Rebindable keys
Stable framerate (as it should be, graphics are like PS2 era)

What they did wrong:
No windowed fullscreen
Some sounds become really annoying and they're also too loud like the woman screams
Does not have mouse cursor, you can navigate menus with the mouse but it feels sluggish, keyboard works perfectly well in that regard
Bad texture quality (come on, hire a few artists make an HD DLC at least)
Always enabled voice chat in multiplayer (at least a push to talk or mute option is a desired feature on PC)

Anyway, overall solid port from a company who had NO experience whatsoever in porting games to PC. They did pretty well and could do better. The game deserves its price point in my opinion and I'm new to the series. It does feel a bit repetitive and if you can't complete a level after collecting a hundred case drops it all goes to waste, which is unfortunate but not really a bad design philosophy.

Recommendation level: Absolutely recommended.

24455220.review:
[h1]Nur ein toter Giant Insect, ist ein guter Giant Insect!	[/h1]

Earth Defense Force 4.1 ist Third-Person-Shooter-Trash und zwar vom feinsten.

[b]Ist die Grafik gut?	[/b] Vielleicht mal 2005.

[b]Stimmt der Sound?	[/b] Naja

[b]Ist die Steuerung brauchbar?	[/b] Mit der Ranger-Klasse und M&T-Steuerung ist es klassisch und auch präzise

[b]Umfang?	[/b] Es sind 89 Missionen (recht kurz max 15min für eine) und man hat 4 Soldatenklassen zur Auswahl. Wenn man alle Level mit allen klassen machen will kommt man auf 356 Level. Das dauert schon ^^ Auch die 700 Waffen laden zum experimentieren ein.

[b]Ist es abwechslungsreich?	[/b] Dauergeballer in Städten, Dauergeballer auf dem Land und noch mehr Dauergeballer im Untergrund.

[b]Sind die Gegner wenigstens Abwechslungsreich?	[/b] Ameisen, noch größere Ameisen, Spinnen, noch größere Spinnen, Roboter und Raumjäger, Wespen, Drachen, noch größere Drachen (das "Riesen" hab ich mir gespart, da die kleinsten Gegner ca 2-3 mal so groß sind wie ein Mensch) und einen Godzilla-ähnlichen Gegnertyp.

[b]Können Leute mit Phobie es trotzdem spielen?	[/b] Jaein, Wenn man diesen Viechern es mal richtig zeigen will mit nem Raketen- oder Granatwerfer, dann unbedingt. Wenn die Screenies auf der Storepage schon zuviel sind, dann lieber sein lassen, denn man kommt teilweise sehr nah ran (auch für mich viel zu nah)

[b]Ist eine gute KI vorhanden?	[/b] ..............................Nein.

[b]Gute Physikeffekte?	[/b] Meterweitfliegende Leitplanken weil man dagegen gerollt ist. Meterweitfliegende LKW weil man dagegen geschossen hat (Assault Rifle). Das sagt wohl alles.

[b]Was macht den Scheiss dann so besonders das ich es spielen sollte?	[/b] Mich hat es durch die gewaltige, wuchtige Action überzeugt. Wenn man eine Armee Ameisen mit den KI-Kameraden über den Haufen ballert und nebenbei die halbe Stadt zerstört aus der Perspektive, ist das einfach nur geil. Wenn man gegen viele Riesenroboter kämpft, die so groß wie ein Hochhaus sind und man selbst ist ein einfacher Fusssoldat, ist das einfach nur geil. Wenn man sich die Luftschläge der eigenen Leute oder des riesigen Alienmutterschiffs (was ansich schon extrem Geil aussieht) ansieht, ist das einfach nur geil. Wenn man ein Alien-Transportschiff aus dem Himmel holt und es vor den eigenen Füßen aufschlägt, ist das einfach nur geil. Wenn man mit seinen Kameraden synchron "EDF!" schreit und dann alle anfangen auf die anrückende Armee von Viechern zu ballern, ist das einfach nur geil. Genauso cool ist es mit den eigenen Kameraden zu singen ^^

[b]Nagut, hat es ein problem über das du nicht hinwegsehen kannst ?	[/b] Außer das die Achtbeiner gegen etwas mit weniger Beinen ausgetauscht werden sollten ? Zum Beispiel Schafen ? Das wäre dann eindeutig der Preis. Selbst wenn es so trashig cool ist, wie es ist, würde ich maximal 25€ dafür zahlen wollen, das was es bietet an Macken, sind den hohen Preis nicht wert.

Fazit: Die Macken des Spiels sind bestimmt so gewollt und auch ohne ist der Trashfaktor enorm. Wäre der extreme Preis nicht würde ich es uneingeschränkt empfehlen. Somit leider erst ab einen Preis von 20-25€. 


Meine Steamspielzeit spiegelt nicht meine echte Spielzeit wieder, da ich es im Offline-Modus spiele.

24454924.review:
I hope you've got 3 friends ready to jump into your premade game group.  If you do, this is some of the most fun you can have on PC.

If you don't, you're in trouble.
-The game browser hides whether a given game is in the lobby (you can join it) or in-game (you have to sit on your hands for 10 minutes until the round ends, then you can join.)
-By default, sound activated voice chat is enabled for everyone.  Especially the 9 year old mouth breather whose microphone is right next to his speakers.  It _cannot_ be muted unless you are the host.
-There are no gear loadouts.  Every time you join a new game, you'll be rejiggering your entire inventory because different stages ban different gear based on level.  Pugging is an exercise in frustration.

This is a (fairly rough) port of a console game which is several years old, and as such I don't anticipate any of the above issues to be patched.

24453600.review:
EDF is a game with a lot to offer anyone willing to put a little time into it. You can play it on easier difficulties to just enjoy the bad voice acting and ridiculous spectacle of a plot (it even has splitscreen co-op). Or you can crank it up to where beating a mission eventually requires tremendous skill, coordination, and tactical evaluation of how to maximize your damage output in a variety of situations, with up to 4-players in online play. 

No matter how you want to enjoy it, EDF offers a unique experience you won't find anywhere else. It's special blend of creative and explosive weaponry, hilariously carefree physics, and destructable environments has been winning over a small legion of hardcore fans for over a decade. And the most definitive entry in the series is now available on PC, running better than a console could ever hope to, without sacrificing any features or content (assuming we get the mission DLC later on).

24453319.review:
Earth Defense Force is a very polarizing series. When people encounter it you usually get two types of reactions:

1. Bafflement that this game could be considered good, followed by rants about how bad the graphics, story, production values, and stuff of that ilk is. Optional rants about how boring it is.

2. People who profess their undying love for it.

Having put several hundred hours in the series over the years, I am firmly in category two. It's a gamers game for sure. If your are looking for a game with involved technical mechanics and high production values, look elsewhere. One obvious glance at the game will tell you that the devs didn't put much effort into AAA production values, but the beauty of it is that they just don't care. What this game prioritizes and excels in is being fun. You have one goal for each stage, kill all the enemies, and you have free reign over how you need to do it. No checkpoints. No objectives. This often means unrelenting chaos and destruction as building debris and bug carcasses fly around all over you over loud explosions. Single player is good enough, but co-op'ing with friends, when you pull off a crazy plan to beat a hard stage you were struggling with on Inferno difficulty and everyone is ecstatic and laughing, that's some of the best co-op I've ever experienced in a video game. There's nothing else like it.

If that sounds like the vibe you can get into. Instant purchase.

24453299.review:
Let me start off by saying that this is a fun game. I am not going to deny that. But is it $50 worth of fun? HELL no. Not even close. I am not going to go along with the rank and file fan boys that are giving this game rave reviews.
As a Gaming Critic I have to ask and answer the same question every time I Review a game: "Is this good for the consumer?" And unfortunately the answer here is a resounding no.
The game is marred by it's being a shoddy port. Dated graphics, framerate drops, horrendous PhysX, glitches, multiplayer crashes, and reports of the game outright not working on AMD processors all bring down the game in a big way.

Here is an excerpt from my Review:
"this game’s title is about as long-winded as the gameplay itself. Now, before we get into things it’s worth noting that somehow these Earth Defense Force games seem to have a fairly large following of which I am not a member of. I have never played any of the previous titles nor do I expect to so please take that into consideration. I am no fan boy and I don’t expect to become an EDF Disciple. What I CAN do, though, is tell you about the game itself. It sucks. There’s no way around it. Looking at the mechanics of the game it fails on nearly every level, however like one of those B Movies that are pure horrendousness with campy lines, cheesy plot, and shallow characters. The graphics are dated, the port is riddled with flaws including poor optimization, framerate drops, horrendous keyboard/mouse support, lame samey horde mode levels, WAY too much screaming, broken multiplayer, and if you have an AMD Processor then forget about it. You will most likely not even be able to play it.
So, you’d think that would be the end of it. But no, it has some good things going for it too. And strangely enough, a lot of them are the same ones I’ve already listed. Pure horrendousness with campy lines, cheesy plot, shallow characters, and samey horde mode gameplay. This game has some odd mixture of badness that has actually somehow created an enjoyable game."

See the full video here:
https://youtu.be/-3xiW0QAhTc
